story:
Homeschooling differently...

We started homeschooling our children seven years ago. About a year ago we discovered one of our daughters was dyslexic.  After searching high and low for a program that would help us to teach her uniqueness, we found the perfect program.  However, it would require many days of traveling and most of our budget for curriculum.  So we started to figure out what changes would have to be made in order to make it work. We had a 'Eureka!' moment as we realized the way we were homeschooling our five children could be changed. Drastically.

So we designed a curriculum that freed us from feeling trapped by our home and by our finances. We got rid of some bells and whistles, which always lost the focus of the child anyway, and centered it on the classics. We designed assignments to teach each student how to think critically in every subject. We focused on digitizing everything we could, so all of our books and materials could fit into a single backpack and travel with us anywhere. Even the Instructor's Guide.  Finally, a curriculum that allows all of us to maximize extracurriculars - athletics, field trips, internships, and other life experiences - with more control and affordability.

At the core of the curriculum we use art, journaling, and creating a portfolio as a vehicle for the student to express who they are and show a progression of maturity. Students can focus their journaling and portfolio-building on their interests and their strengths. By the end of 12th grade a student will have a mature, well-rounded portfolio which demonstrates the person they are to potential colleges, universities, and employers.

And The Artistic Homeschooler was started...



What Makes Our Curriculum Different?

Focusing on Middle and High School grades, we will be writing a total of six guides covering grades 7-12. Each guide will cover History, Art History, Science, Language, Grammar and Composition, Latin, a modern language, and Studio Art. All for less that the price of a single elective.

We will also be writing several unit studies, perfect for supplemental education of other curricula or summer education for traditional high schoolers.

Our Curriculum is:
Versatile
What we use to educate our children should not hinder our lives or their educational development. What we use to educate our children should conform to us, not make us conform to its needs.

The ease of digitized books, experiments based on household supplies, and harnessing verified internet sources means that you can easily educate your child from anywhere and at anytime. Schooling while traveling, moving often or repeatedly, living outside the radius of a library, or even missioning in remote ares will not hinder your child's education anymore. Our digital platform means no heavy instructor's guide to juggle, no workbooks to manage and no heavy books to lug around. Our instructor's guide comes in a downloadable file easily imported into your computer, laptop, iPad, Kindle, or other tablet. Everything you need fits into a single backpack!

Expressive

As a student matures the ultimate goal is to inspire them to self education. Invoking and encouraging that passion to learn has no better vehicle than art. Artistic talent is not required.  Art has many facets that we see and use everyday in life without acknowledging the presence of the creativity that is a part of it. Any businessman can run a store, but an entrepreneur sees a new and creative opportunity that adds value to society. Any skilled tradesman can use tools and follow a plan, but a craftsman designs and creates new wonders that were never there before.  

Art is the communication of information from your student to others. It is the expression of their thoughts and beliefs. It may be painted or drawn, but it can also be written, spoken, built, and carved. A student must be taught to express or communicate their thoughts. As your student moves through this curriculum, they will build an entire portfolio to express their passions and their ideas to future employers and universities.

Thought-Provoking
There is more to an education than inspiring passion or the recitation of memorized facts. The goal of an education should be to learn the ability to coalesce information you've learned into a reasonable narrative and to spark the desire to learn more and dig deeper. In order to do that, an education must train a student in a critical and logical thought process. Using critical thought and logic trains a mind to explore and question the world and viewpoints around him. By doing this, the student grows and matures.

Lastly, an education must build an understanding of personal values.  Values may be different for many people for a number of reasons.  With this curriculum, we will ask questions that challenge a student. As a student processes challenging topics, they will grow and mature as a person which will be apparent in their portfolio. It also will spark some wonderful conversation and dialogue in the family.

Download a Free Sample HERE


Why Are We Crowdfunding?

When we started to talk to other homeschooling parents (either actively schooling or looking at schooling), we realized that we were not the only ones who were looking for this answer. From the United States to New Zealand, we had parents encourage us to take this idea out of heads and put into onto paper so that EVERY homeschooler could use it.

We want the freedom that we have found to be YOUR freedom as well.

In order to do that, we need the funds to truly start a business. The funds to focus on development, have tech support, provide informative links/videos, have website interfaces, and get the software to develop epub and pdf formats for the guides.

If this campaign is successful, we will devote ourselves to this full time so that we will be finished publishing all 6 middle school and high school guides by August 2019!

Who We Are

We are a family of seven and a disabled-veteran owned company that has learned the privilege of serving others.  We are proud to have a history of serving our country and now create a future of serving our children and yours. We want all children to have the chance at an education that helps them achieve their potential today and in tomorrow's world.  

Beyond teaching our children, we have a combined 15 years of teaching art, art history, and technology  at public and private institutions to students from kindergarten to college.  We enjoy learning new things and have 5 degrees, from art history to earth science, between the two of us. In fact, one of us is currently finishing a Master's in Ecological Restoration. More importantly, we are passionate about inspiring students to learn and self educate. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Our enduring gratitude is yours for backing our campaign AND for sharing our ideas!  Simply sharing this with other makes us smile, and we would love to receive your input on the one-week sample available on our website which will allow us to continuously improve the curriculum and gear it to your needs as we complete it.

Check us out at www.theartistichomeschooler.com

Keep up with our venture at www.theartistichomeschooler.com/blog

Check out some of our ideas at www.pinterest.com/ClassicArtistic  

And visit us on facebook at www.facebook.com/theartistichomeschooler/

story:
Who We Are:

My name is Brad Carr. I’m 32 years old. And I’m a professional baker. I have 9 years of restaurant experience, serving as both a cook and a pastry chef. I really enjoy the effort that goes into making delicious desserts and pastries. I’m passionate about using quality ingredients to create great tasting items from the bakeshop. My wife, Kim, is my partner.  She manages the bakery and does an awesome job. She has 8 years of experience in accounting and office management.

This campaign will not only help us reach our goal to have the funds necessary open our bakery, but will also help create awareness of who we are and why our bakery will be a great asset to our community. When you decide to contribute you’re not only helping us achieve our dreams but you’re helping us build a better city together. We are strongly involved in community events and want nothing more than to continue making Hartsville a great American city.

 

What We Need:

We are seeking $7500 in startup capital which will go towards the following:

We need $2500 for kitchen equipment: work tables, inventory racks, utensils, bowls, pans, and cooling racks.

We also need $2500 for front of the shop furnishings: tables, chairs, display cases, a drink case, a hot beverage station, coffee thermoses, and window displays and decor. 

We will use $1500 to purchase packaging and service utensils: product boxes, box liners, paper bags, mugs, glasses, saucers, forks, spoons, and serving dishes. 

The last $1000 will be used for promotional materials to help us get our name out into the community in the form of rack cards, business cards, t-shirts, hats, and decals. 

 

Our most unique perk will be that our products will be baked fresh daily. We want to create an atmosphere of community and hometown pride. 

 

Your Impact:

It has been far too long since Hartsville has had a true hometown bakery. We are looking forward to sharing delicious mouth-watering desserts, fresh crusty breads, and gorgeous custom made cakes with our city. 

Our success so far:

We are in the final stages of remodeling our build to better serve you! We are on the verge of opening, but we need your help to make the final push to meet our mark! We are excited to open and be a presence in Hartsville’s downtown! GCB participated in the 2016 Startsville program and was honored as a small business winner. We have also completed the Business Builder Program of Hartsville. We are also a member of the Chamber of Commerce and MainStreet Hartsville.

Challenges we face: 

We face the same challenges that any small startup business faces, however our team has plenty of experience in running small businesses. We have a combined 17 years of experience. GCB has been operating as a home based bakery for over a year and has had an awesome response since our first appearance at the Hartsville Farmers’ Market. We are excited to be a part of the community downtown.

Other ways you can get involved: 

We appreciate your support! No contribution is too small. Get involved by sharing our campaign page, telling your friends and family about us, grab a decal or business card and help us generate the buzz about Griggs Circle Bakery!

story:
Avast mateys, the Captain is asking for your help to find a bigger Pirate's Den. 


El Capitan's Gourmet Sausages and Pretzels has been a Bellingham favorite and valued community member since opening in 2003.

We've heard from a lot of our loyal customers and pirate brethren over the years that you would love to be able to hang out and have a beer with your sausage at El Capitan's. We'd like to do just that - expand and offer an even greater selection of specialty options and serve up delicious local beer to go with your brat, vegan dog, or whatever your heart desires - and we need your help.

Opening on Western Washington University's campus in the fall of 2003, the Captain opened the much beloved Pirate's Den  location at 1314 Railroad Avenue in November of 2008 (currently our only location) and has operated as a late night only business for eight years.

If you've watched the video, you also know the Captain came to Bellingham to be a teacher, and to that end, received a M.Ed. from WWU in 2012 but has since decided to focus on the growth of his pirate sausage empire.

Happily, and thanks to you all, our business has grown throughout the 13 years we have been in operation. Unfortunately the electrical and plumbing capacity of the cool. old warehouse at 1314 Railroad Avenue is no longer adequate for our needs.

So the time has come for the Captain to cast off the old square-rigger, leave the familiar confines of our existing location to venture forth in search of a new Pirate's Den, as we have outgrown our present pirate's lair. 

We would like to expand our menu of gourmet sausage and specialty sausages, add more vegetarian and gluten free options, and increase our pretzel-making capacity. Maybe even more important for a pirate's den, we want to offer a nice selection of the fine local beers found here in Bellingham - as a natural pairing with and extension of our current menu. After all, what could be better than beer and brats! 

We would also expand our hours to include lunch and early evening hours to accommodate those who may not be in downtown Bellingham during the late evenings. 

The cost of the entire project is a little hard to estimate as it will vary greatly depending on the site that we find, but is expected to be in the $90,000 vicinity. We will need to fund about half of the project via our valued customers and long-time supporters.

We are offering seven funding levels, and of course are offering valuable pirate plunder, or at least recognition, in exchange for your support. 

In addition to be an active supporter of the Bellingham community, the Captain and crew has:
  • provided food and supported events to benefit others throughout the area 
  • works towards food justice, 
  • actively supports efforts to help those homeless or those at-risk
  • contributed to the economy by providing above current wage scale wages for all employees, contributed the to the tax base, and as an active supporter of the Downtown Bellingham Partnership.

With your help, we will be able to continue to provide our customers and community with the support, quality food, and friendly service that you have all come to expect, while supporting ourselves in a fun and beneficial manner. 

Even if you are not able to provide direct financial support, you have the power to help. Spread the word - share on Facebook, Tweet, and post. Tell your classmates, beer-mates, or crew-mates! Write and sing sea shanties - or even tell an epic poem or two.

The Cap'n will use all of the contributions for the new expansion, regardless of whether we achieve our target  goal or not.

The Captain and crew would like to thank you in advance for all of your support, both in this campaign, and throughout the past 13 years. We look forward to seeing you at the existing Pirate's Den,  and in the future, at our new location.

story:
Who we are & what we are doing

  • We are a collection of millennials, both graduates and still in school, that are passionate about social good and impact.
  • We want to create meaningful change in the world. We believe that through education and empowerment, we can help create a more conscious, ethical world. 
  • Longterm, we would like to take Good Weekends across the country and help conscious consumers discover these emerging impact brands. 

Needs for us and Perks for you

  • We need $2,500 to cover the expenses for this first event. We are not charging the vendors a booth fee and for this reason, need help offsetting the cost. These funds will go towards helping us cover event essentials such as insurance permits, signage, music equipment, etc. 
  • We are thrilled that we can offer all of our supporters the opportunity to help make this mission have global impact.
  • We are 100% confirmed for this event, so any funds contributed to this endeavor will be used towards making it amazing.

Join the movement 

  • We see The Good Weekends as a movement. We believe that the majority of people want to make purchases from ethical brands and impact-driven companies, but many consumers don't know how to find these brands or learn about them. We want to change that. 
  • Our founder, Denise Troy, is incredibly passionate about social enterprise and owns a social good company that helps young artists pursue their dreams. 

The Good Weekend in LA will feature small and start-up mission driven companies including: 

COOKIES THAT GIVE 

KAY + JO

WUNDERKID

THE SMILE LIFE 

WILDFLOWER ROOTS 

Calling for all of you beautiful people to help

  • We stepped into this wonderful opportunity with a short timeline making it difficult to acquire outside sponsors. This is why we are coming to all of you amazing people and asking for help. 
  • Please share about our event. More people knowing and sharing about the event provides us a larger platform to create a truely meaningful impact.
  • Come and join us on Sunday, July 24th for The Good Weekend in the historic French Market Place in West Hollywood. We would love to celebrate social good in LA with all of you.

FAQ
Who is The Good Weekend?

We believe in the power of GOOD.

Good businesses, good people, good thoughts…We live in the age of the conscious consumer. Increasingly, consumers are looking to brands for sustainable goods, best practices and mission centric goals. We believe the momentum of ethical consumption is increasingly growing. We host Good Weekends across the country highlighting and celebrating these brands. We’re a marketplace for mission driven brands.

What is the Good Weekend Event?

Acting as a marketplace for mission-driven brands, the Good Weekend will bring together social enterprises, sustainable businesses and local non-profits in a weekend celebration of social good. Good food and trendy products will set the tone for the weekend as attendees can shop from booths set up by social good companies and sustainable brands, while enjoying live music and food trucks.

Why was it created?

This is the age of the conscious consumer! Purchasing products or services that benefit the world in some way with social and environmental considerations in mind is becoming more prevalent in consumerism, especially among Millennials. We want to celebrate and champion the brands and companies doing GOOD in the world.

When and where?

Our first Good Weekend will be in West Hollywood, California in historic French Market Place on Sunday, July 24.

When will we receive our perks?

Your perks will be shipped within a month after the event.

Cities where we want to expand.

We would love the opportunity to keeping growing this event and taking it to cities around the country.  Chicago, Austin and Nashville our next on our list.

This is the age of
the conscious consumer! Purchasing products or services that benefit the world
in some way with social and environmental considerations in mind is becoming
more prevalent in consumerism, especially among Millennials. We want to
celebrate and champion the brands and companies doing GOOD in the world.
When and where? 
Our first Good
Weekend will be in West Hollywood, California in historic French Market Place
on Sunday, July 24.
When will we receive
our perks? 
Your perks will be shipped within a month after the event. 
Cities where we want
to expand.
We would love the opportunity to keeping growing this event
and taking it to cities around the country. 
Chicago, Austin and Nashville our next on our list.

story: It’s not just about donating, it’s to encourage positive initiatives in your neighbourhood or anywhere on the planet.

story:
THE GREAT CRAFT BEER TASTE OFF WORLD TOUR

Like you, we love Craft Beer!  And, if you're anything like us, you enjoy tasting craft beers from around the world, not just the usual, local brews.

We, Icy Wingz Events, specialize in hosting Craft Beer Taste Offs. Please refer to our website for information on our previous events – www.icywingz.com

Our Goal

We want to bring our event concept to the world... similar to the Grand Prix auto race, but with Craft Beer!

Why we need your help

Due to the costs of freight (chilled) and duty and excise taxes, plus getting these awesome brews to different countries and venues to hold the events, we just need some initial funding to get the ball rolling.

Our concept has proven very popular with craft breweries and the venues we've partnered with to date.

You might be thinking, “why should I invest in this if the event isn’t taking place here?”

With your support, we’ll be able to bring this event to you!

What we do...

Our first Taste Offs were held in New Zealand. We then took the concept to Melbourne/Australia where we ran the Australia vs New Zealand Craft Beer Taste Off. The Top 5 beers from 34 entries determined the individual winner and the winning nation. New Zealand won the inaugural international competition by a whisker. We since hosted the return match in Wellington, New Zealand in March this year, which was also won by New Zealand.


To keep it simple, beers are given a score of 1 – 5 on just taste. No labels – a blind tasting - no bias – the beers that score highest, win.


The Top 10 beers are revealed during a presentation starting about an hour before event closes. It would be counter-productive, potentially damaging to brewers announcing lower placings. As far as everyone is concerned any brewer not placed in the top 10 might have just missed out.

The event's concept has proven to be very popular.  It gives value for money to our tasters, a lot of fun, and puts the public, rather than professional judges, in charge of deciding which beers come out on top. The ticket price always includes the tasting and Happy Hour-priced beers after the tasting.

Our events celebrate the success of craft brewers and their creations. They give our tasters the opportunity to meet and talk with many innovators of the craft beer world.

We believe the time is right to take this event to the rest of the world – inviting craft brewers and tasters worldwide to join in.

We’ll begin our world tour in Vancouver, Washington, US (across the bridge from Portland – the craft beer capital of the world), where 10 Brewers each from the US, New Zealand and Australia go head to head in a Tri-Nation blind Taste Off. The Brewers for this event are confirmed and committed.

Please see below our planned tour venues after that event.

Putting on these events is expensive, and would be impossible without the generous support of our sponsors. Taking this event worldwide not only adds another dimension to the excitement it creates, but it also adds to the costs for making this possible. This is why we ask you to support us with contributions to turn the dream into reality.


We estimate we require about US$50,000 to cover costs such as:

Beer Purchase

Freight (most likely by air)

Excise taxes

Import Duties

Airfares (for two event organizers)

Marketing & Publicity

Accommodation for two event organizers

Equipment & Hire Charges (e.g. disposable kegs, jockey boxes, etc.)

Printing & Stationery


If you can’t help with money, you can still help in other ways – like by making plenty of noise about our campaign and by using the Indiegogo share tools.

Our Goal

We want to bring our event concept to the world... similar to the Grand Prix auto race, but with Craft Beer!

Why we need your help

Due to the costs of freight (chilled) and duty and excise taxes, plus getting these awesome brews to different countries and venues to hold the events, we just need some initial funding to get the ball rolling.

Our concept has proven very popular with craft breweries and the venues we've partnered with to date.

You might be thinking, “why should I invest in this if the event isn’t taking place here?”

With your support, we’ll be able to bring this event to you!

Please help us put ‘The Great Craft Beer Taste Off World Tour’ on the map!


VENUES IN:

US – UK – GERMANY –NEW ZEALAND – AUSTRALIA - CHINA ... YOUR CITY!

EVENT DATES:

2016:

USA – Vancouver/Washington, October

AUSTRALIA – Melbourne, November

2017:

UK – London, February

GERMANY - Berlin, February

NEW ZEALAND – Wellington, March

CHINA – Beijing, June

AUSTRALIA – Melbourne, August

USA – Vancouver/Washington, October

story:
Peace of Earth is a small farm in Vermont's Northeast Kingdom. Over the past six years we've slowly transformed a neglected Christmas tree planting into a productive and diverse farm.  We've grown the farm at a pace consistent with our financial capabilities and the pace of changes made by hand.  Now we are at the point of needing a way to cool and store the fruits and vegetables that we grow for our CSA program and local sales.  With your help we can build a root cellar and passive cooler to refrigerate our goods without electricity year round, using the insulating power of the earth and the abundant winter cold found here in Vermont.

What We Need Your Help For

Each year the farm is increasing production as our gardens improve and perennial plantings of fruit crops come into maturity.  In order to meet the cooling needs of the farm and be able to offer a winter share of storage crops to our CSA we need a way of cooling our produce.  Many farms turn to a walk in cooler for this purpose. We'd like to try something different, and a little experimental, that operates without burning fossil fuels.  Root cellars have been used for thousands of years, and ice houses at least  a hundred, but both have their limitations.  We'd like to take the principle of using earth as a constant insulator a step farther by adding tanks of water inside the cellar that will freeze during the cold months and slowly melt and cool the space in the summer months.  

The root cellar will be a 16x16x8 foot poured cement foundation dug into a side hill.  The root cellar’s cooling time period will be expanded beyond the winter months with the addition of tanks of water inside the cellar that will freeze from the inside out when outside air temperatures are 31ºF or below, utilizing a passive heat exchange system of copper pipes filled with butane.  The frozen tanks will slowly melt during the warmer months, cooling an enclosed space within the cellar that can be used as a walk in cooler.  Once built, the passive cooler should continue to operate without the need for a power source, saving emissions and dollars. 

How The Passive Cooling Action Works

Butane boils at 31ºF.  When the copper pipes containing butane are in contact with air or water that is above 31ºF, the butane will boil and become a gas that will rise to the top of the sealed pipe which is outside the root cellar.  If the temperature outside is below 31ºF the butane gas will condense back into a liquid and drop down to the bottom of the pipe array inside the water tank.  If the water in the tank is above 31ºF the butane will once again boil and condense, starting a cycle that will continue as long as the water temperature is above 31ºF and the outside air temperature below 31ºF.  Each time the butane is boiled by the water tank temperature, heat is transferred from the water, cooling, and eventually freezing the whole tank starting from the inside out.

What we'll use the money for:

$7,000 16’x16’x8’ poured cement foundation with roof (labor and materials)

$2600 Excavation, gravel, trucking and drainage pipe

$1300 Construction details (Insulation, Ventilation, Shelving, Door, Interior wall)

$1100 Passive refrigeration units (4 water tanks, copper piping and fittings, butane)

-If we raise less than our goal we will still be able to move towards completion of the root cellar/passive cooler by scaling down the project, completing it in stages as finances allow, or using the money pledged as matching funds for further grant or loan requests

What's Growing at Peace of Earth Farm?

Rebecca, Jeffrey and the other animals on the farm have been doing the work of clearing, fertilizing, mulching, and planting a diverse array of plants and fungi to create our current farm community.   Instead of reacting to the challenges of farming with pesticides, we choose to maintain ecological diversity, keep the soil undisturbed and covered with mulch, and make sure that the proper nutrients are available for growing healthy resilient plants.  


We grow a wide variety of vegetables, fruits, and herbs.  As well as pigs, chickens and ducks.  We are just in the beginning stages of growing shiitake mushrooms on logs.  In addition we operate an indoor shoot and sprout operation from our home, helping to create year round income and fresh green things available locally in the heart of winter.

We sell our produce through a CSA (Community Supported Agriculture) program as well as to stores and restaurants, mostly within 30 miles of the farm.  We'd love to be able to offer a winter CSA share with the storage capacity of a root cellar.


Your support of this project will help in 3 main ways

1. A small farm will receive a financial boost from the community, allowing us to grow as a business and provide more food locally
2. The local community will gain access to more high quality food in the form of a winter CSA share, fresh flats of raspberries, shiitakes, sprouts or lettuce....!

3.  The passive cooler concept is a new idea.  We are dedicated to keeping good records about how well it works.  We will adjust the amount of tanks or insulation as necessary and make the results known.  We would like this experiment to benefit other farms or individuals wishing to replicate it and will gladly share our data with school groups, tours, or others wishing to stay up to date via newsletter. Someone has to go out on a limb and experiment with new alternative technologies that companies are not likely to invest their dollars in.  This is grass roots research!


How You Can Help

-Any donation no matter how small is greatly appreciated!  Every dollar adds up, that's why they call it crowd funding.
-Share, share, share!  Please help us get the word out about this campaign.  Send out some emails or post to Facebook, Twitter, or your social media of choice. Please help us find folks that are interested in supporting small regenerative agriculture, exploring alternative energy techniques, and increasing local food security and pass along our project.

Perks

We've got some great perks to thank you for your financial support of our project.  Take your pick, from farm grown tea, garlic and csa shares to home-made: art, dinner parties, and t-shirts.

Thank you! Thank you!

story:
Short Summary                                              Experience one of the holiest cities in the world right from your home. Bethlehem360° will contain photos and videos of historical, religious, and archeological sites that you will be able to control. From our tour, you can view the site you are interested in from any angle and get in depth as much as you wish. You will be able to rotate, zoom, and control the image using the keyboard, mouse, or touch screen. 

From this project, you will be able to visit any place in Bethlehem from anywhere in the world. You can discover Bethlehem from our 360 virtual tour as if you are actually here. If you haven't visited Bethlehem before, you will be able to now from our online tours. (Imagine a simulated reality of this holy city.)

(This is a 360 video sample , you can move right, left, up and down)



The WHO and the WHAT

iFocus team brings a variety of experience and knowledge to the Virtual Tour. Our Team produces only the highest-quality virtual tours for a variety of industries. We utilize the latest high-tech equipment, combined with our team of photographers. Our virtual tours can be viewed on a variety of platforms from mobile devices, tablets, laptops and PCs. You can view our work by visiting these places below!

 

                        solomon's pools                                                ST.saba monastery

 

                        Herod's mountain                                           Qruntol mountain

                                               and there is #So_Much_more  ...
You will see that we have already filmed some of the most historical sites in this region but have not been able to continue and get you and our viewers further. This is why we need your help. We want to showcase and introduce Bethlehem to the world and deliver this holy city directly into your home. With just a click of the mouse, we want you to be able to experience everything Bethlehem has to offer. For example, viewers are able to enter the Manger Square and view the Church of the Nativity from the outside but are not able to enter inside the church and explore there. With your help, we can achieve this.

Our team wants to create tours of all the important sites in the city of Bethlehem, and each site has several points it needs filmed. In total, we need to film around 150 points which includes locations in and outside the area, street views, and different angles for a complete 360 experience.

BETHLEHEM is the city where Christ was born. It is a city full of significance for millions of people worldwide. It is the center for culture and tourism and is only 10km south of Jerusalem, another very significant city for all people. People of Bethlehem rely heavily on tourism and our project will help bring people and businesses together from all over.  

WHY we need YOU

The funding we are seeking here is to get us started. We want to start filming these locations right before and during spring time and it takes time, money, and man power to begin.

-We need to provide food and transportation for five people during filming time which needs at least 2-3 months.

-We also need to pay for entering these locations which can run up to $300 per day for just one site and on most occasions we need a couple of days for just one location due to tourist visits, closures, and time interference with other schedules.

-We use one set of equipment to film but would need at least another to capture the material quicker and more vividly or we have to continue renting some of the equipment. We need a new camera, lens, head, and tripod.

-Pay taxes to the Ministry of Tourism for filming

-We need to pay for the photographer, design film maker, marketing agency and campaign writer.

-Pay for marketing our campaign using Google AdWords and Facebook Ads.

-And we need to finish and launch our website.

So we have come here for people who are interested in this project and can help us create it. We want to be part of your world and invite you to ours.

With your help, we will provide food and transportation for our crew, rent or preferably purchase equipment for filming and editing, pay for all the entrances for the locations and pay for permits to be allowed to film and display some of these sites. Your help will get us to start this project and allow us to work for the following months! 


Some of our lovely places you will enjoy as well!


 

 


THE PLAN

Once our team gets the funding it needs, we will begin preparing ourselves and our equipment to begin. We will seek permits to film in the areas we have chosen, and once we pay for these permits, we will make schedules for each location biweekly. We plan to begin filming mid-March and end in May, with an extra month (June) for any corrections or last minute problems to solve.

While filming, we will meet with hotels, restaurants, and souvenir shops and make connections with them in order to use them in our virtual tours. Our project, after the initial funding will sustain itself by advertising these businesses. With a special price and coding, customers will be even able to purchase items from souvenir shops or book hotel rooms via the virtual tour.

At the same time, tourist agencies around the world and locally will have the option to purchase our packages to use for their agencies which will be specially designed for them. Our project will be able to sustain itself but we need the jump start! We need your help to start us off!


Other Ways you can Help!

Most importantly, give whatever you can to the campaign. Many small donations will add up and help us stay relevant online.

In addition to that, you can always, and please do, share share SHARE!

· Spread the word: Share this campaign on Facebook and Twitter, or tell your friends in an email.

· Stay connected: Follow our Facebook page for updates and easy sharing!


For daily updates follow our social media accounts!


Follow Us:

                

or visit our web link : http://ifocus.ps/bethlehemvtour/ (english) and http://ifocus.ps/portfolio/ (arabic but contains most of our work.)

We will seek permits to film in the areas we have chosen, and once we pay for these permits, we will make schedules for each location biweekly. We plan to begin filming mid-March and end in May, with an extra month (June) for any corrections or last minute problems to solve.While filming, we will meet with hotels, restaurants, and souvenir shops and make connections with them in order to use them in our virtual tours. Our project, after the initial funding will sustain itself by advertising these businesses. With a special price and coding, customers will be even able to purchase items from souvenir shops or book hotel rooms via the virtual tour.At the same time, tourist agencies around the world and locally will have the option to purchase our packages to use for their agencies which will be specially designed for them. Our project will be able to sustain itself but we need the jump start! We need your help to start us off!Other Ways you can Help!Most importantly, give whatever you can to the campaign. Many small donations will add up and help us stay relevant online.In addition to that, you can always, and please do, share share SHARE!· Spread the word: Share this campaign on Facebook and Twitter, or tell your friends in an email.· Stay connected: Follow our Facebook page for updates and easy sharing!For daily updates follow our social media accounts!



Follow Us:

   
    

   
   
or visit our web link : http://ifocus.ps/bethlehemvtour/ (english) and http://ifocus.ps/portfolio/ (arabic but contains most of our work.)

story:
Short Summary

In 2010 we, me and my husband Andrew, purchased our piece of land in Zanzibar and since then we have invested every penny we could save in our dream: a small but thriving B&B where tourists can feel at home and which provides local business with customers and opportunities to develop as well. So far we have certainly succeeded in the second part of our dream as we have built Peku Peku (which means Barefoot in Swahili) with the help of local crafstmen. Something we we will keep doing so in the future. The few guests who have stayed with us in the try out phase have certainly helped local businesses as they rented cars and taxis, gone on spice tours and frequented other local businesses in our area. There was just one problem.....

What We Need & What You Get

 

We want to be a sustainable business and therefore we chose for  solar panels to provide us with electricity. But the two panels we have are not enough to keep everything going such as the pump we use to pump up water from our own well for the shower, toilet en kitchen, the fridge, the lights at night, uploading electrical devices from our guests, etc. In order to make sure we have a reliable energy source we would need an additional 2 to 3 solar panels. But the budget......

Just another Euro 2,000 will fund the purchase of the panels and the batteries that go with them as well as the workmen who will install them. It´s an all inclusive!

 What do you get when you invest in our business, well, take a look at the perks!

The Impact

 

With Peku Peku we want to offer people the chance to experience our part of Africa in a relaxed and comfortable way. We are located in Michamvi Kae, a remote area on the coast of Zanzibar with beautiful beaches. But also, we want it to be a source of income not only to us but also all the other local business. Our guests bring income to local shops, crafstmen and business such as restaurants, snorkling and diving operations, spice tours etc. We have already seen that happening with some of the guests we had this year. Besides that we already employ one man as a gardner and night guard and we can imagine we, at one point, when the business is thriving, we have jobs for other local people. We really want Peku Peku to be a win win win situation. A win for our guests, a win for the local community and a win for us.

 

Risks & Challenges

 Doing business in Africa is always a challenge. Nothing is ever sure. But over the years Andrew has built a network around him in Zanzibar and on the main land, although not being there all the time, which enabled him to already overcome many obstacles when building Peku Peku and will also help with the last hurdles.

The risk for you is none. The money you invest will go to Peku Peku no matter what. The money we raise will first of all help solve the issue with the electricy. Any money left will go to Peku Peku to further develop our garden and vegetable patch, to building a few more banda´s (small huts) for people who also want to experience Africa but have a smaller budget, we still have so many ideas and plans.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you feel for our goal but are not able to help us financially, please share this campaign with as many people as possible. In that way you can also help us tremendously. You never now who will read about the campaign. One click can go a long way.

story:
My name is Nana Atuahene, and I need your help.

I have been in the business of graphic design and printing for many years, and not a moment has passed where I was not striving to provide the best service and experience to my customers. I always aim to go the extra mile. From this, my company Atuahene Designs was born, and has become my pride and joy. I am able to focus my efforts on making sure that I am not only doing what I love, but bringing persons’ ideas and designs to life in a colorful and unique way.

Atuahene Designs is my main source of income, and therefore what I use to provide for myself and my family. It is important to me in more ways than one, and to lose it would be devastating. I have scraped and saved many times in order to invest in growing the business, but each time, emergencies and unforeseen circumstances keep popping up, leaving me no choice but to tap into my savings. This has happened at least three times, and I am at the point where if my business does not grow, it will fall under, but I refuse to withhold finances at the cost of helping my family. They mean the world to me.

This is why I have decided to try and seek funding in order to get Atuahene Designs to the next level.

Presently, I am seeking $10,000 in donations in order to purchase some necessary machines and software for the business, and to register the company. Some of the items I would like to invest in include graphic design programs, a new desktop computer, papers, a hard drive, and accounting software. With this expansion I would not only be able to provide better and faster service for my customers, but grow the business to a sustainable size, that will allow it to take on bigger and better contracts.

To those who donate, I thank you for your generosity, and am more than willing to offer my services in order to show my gratitude. If you check out the reward tier, you will see what I will offer to donors at various levels. Every dollar counts, and even if you cannot donate this time, sharing my campaign on social media would go a long way in helping to spread the word.

I am still working hard to save money towards the company, because I believe in this venture. Please help me to keep it afloat.

Thank you for taking the time to read this,

Nana Atuahene

story:
Food for Thought by the Sea is raising funds to buy a food truck to help other non-profits raise money and awareness for their organizations.  This truck will be a community fundraiser on wheels!
Anyone familiar with the Marilyn Schlossbach Group knows that the organization gives and gives.  Now, Food for Thought needs you to give! 
If everyone who reads this gives $20 or more we can put this community food truck on the road.  Join us in this incredible community endeavor! 
About Marilyn Schlossbach 

The Marilyn Schlossbach Group owns: Labrador Lounge, a vacation hot spot in Normandy Beach; Pop’s Garage, an authentic Mexican eatery on the Asbury Park boardwalk and the Grove West in Shrewsbury; What's Your Beef in Rumson; Langosta Lounge, APYC,  and Lightly Salted which is also located on the Asbury Park Boardwalk.  In addition, I am the head of Marilyn Schlossbach Catering & Events.


LITTLE FOOD TRUCK WITH A BIG HEART


Food For Thought:

I am is committed to strengthening my local community. Throughout my culinary career, I has been an advocate for environmental issues, culinary arts and grassroots community outreach. Through Food for Thought by the Sea, I am able to incorporate my passion for charitable work and outreach into a non-profit organization.

Just one of many ongoing initiatives, Food for Thought by the Sea’s Community Table has fed more than 10,000 hungry neighbors on Thanksgiving, Christmas and Easter. In addition, it helped provide local restaurants and community members in Asbury Park with fresh produce and goods at the Carousel Farmers Market, and is and acts as a platform for local youth to pursue interests in horticulture, the culinary arts and water sports.

Food for Thought by Sea's continued goal is to strengthen Asbury Park through positive community outreach and youth-empowerment programs.  Some past and current programs include:

·  Free Summer Surf Lessons with the Boys and Girls Club and Asbury Park Recreation Department

·  Free art music and gardening program with the Boys and Girls Club

·  Support of the Kula Garden project in affiliation with the Kula Café in Asbury Park

·  Carousel Farmer’s Market in Asbury Park

·  Free community dinners at Langosta Lounge in Asbury Park on Thanksgiving, Christmas and Easter.

The Food Truck will also cooperate with the Food For Thought program to help engage the community youth with similar programs!




SHOUT OUT TO THE ARTISTS

We are beyond thankful to a handful of local artists who will be contributing to this campaign by donating their amazing works as prizes to those who donate in higher donation brackets. They are...

Roddy Wildeman: Wildeman was born in Long Branch, New Jersey and has been an Ocean Grove resident for the past decade. His work hangs on the walls of the Rockefeller family private offices, and is sought after by private collectors and commercial venues internationally. Wildeman is the owner of Torche' Galerie Belmar, NJ. Inspired by philanthropy, Wildeman donates his art to multiple auctions and charities each year!

Jay Alders: Jay Alders is a fine artist, photographer & designer whose distinctive style & imaginative prowess is recognized around the world. Alders has been pursuing his lifelong dream of becoming a thriving professional artist since he was a child.In November 2009, Jay was described as “The Artist who is Everywhere” by ESPN because of Jay’s constant globe trotting and impressive industry involvement. Alders  is also known for his heartfelt philanthropy work and healthy vegan lifestyle. He proudly & regularly gives back to the world community whenever possible. In 2009 he was named an Official Ambassador to Surf Aid International.

Danny Clinch: 

Danny Clinch loves music. He listens to it, plays it, photographs it, and films it. Through this passion, Danny has established himself as one of the premier photographers across the entire music scene. He has shot and filmed a wide range of artists, from Johnny Cash to Tupac Shakur, from Bjork to Bruce Springsteen! His work has appeared on hundreds of album covers and in publications like Vanity Fair, Spin, Rolling Stone, GQ, Esquire, and more!


Porkchop: Porkchop is a multi-disciplinary artist living in Asbury Park, New Jersey. He has a MBA in Sculpture from VCU and has had a successful career  designing and creating murals, mixed media art and sculpture. He creates intriguing scenarios by combining paint, illustration, and text. He has exhibited exclusively in the United States and Europe!

Scott Szegeski: Known for works displayed from Asbury Park to California and beyond, Scott Szegeski has made a name for himself through his prolific surf prints! An avid surfer and lover of the Ocean, Szegeski is inspired by the nature of the waves and the vibes of the beach. Szegeski's prints are currently displayed at the Four Seasons Hualalai Resort and the Malibu Farm Cafe in Malibu,CA- just to name a few. In his free time he can be seen at the beach or spending time with his two daughters! 

WE NEED YOUR HELP

Your donations will help us renovate this truck and get it moving so you can catch it this summer! They will serve as a catalyst to a social movement that will benefit all of us and unify our wonderful community.

Donate Now! All donations are greatly appreciated!

Porkchop: Porkchop is a multi-disciplinary artist living in Asbury Park, New Jersey. He has a MBA in Sculpture from VCU and has had a successful career  designing and creating murals, mixed media art and sculpture. He creates intriguing scenarios by combining paint, illustration, and text. He has exhibited exclusively in the United States and Europe!


Scott Szegeski: Known for works displayed from Asbury Park to California and beyond, Scott Szegeski has made a name for himself through his prolific surf prints! An avid surfer and lover of the Ocean, Szegeski is inspired by the nature of the waves and the vibes of the beach. Szegeski's prints are currently displayed at the Four Seasons Hualalai Resort and the Malibu Farm Cafe in Malibu,CA- just to name a few. In his free time he can be seen at the beach or spending time with his two daughters! 




    WE NEED YOUR HELP 
Your donations will help us renovate this truck and get it moving so you can catch it this summer! They will serve as a catalyst to a social movement that will benefit all of us and unify our wonderful community.

Donate Now! All donations are greatly appreciated!

story:
Oodles.press is a unique project, where every user is allowed to participate in discovering, disclosing, and shaping alternative viewpoints. Each user can debate with other users around the world in their own native language. The basic principle, and key concept, of the Oodles.press project is that “something does not emerge from nothing". This means that we:

  • Will aggregate news from 500 sources around the globe in one place, creating a global news stream in multiple languages.
  • Will create a structure that allows each reader to find the most significant news relevant to their interests.
  • Will provide cyber-journalists, user-reporters, and readers the tools to determine what is real, what should be kept, and what is worthy of attention.
  • We will allow users to decide what news is worthy of their trust and attention.

We hope that in such a way one will obtain news worthy of trust.




| PRESS RELEASE |




In today’s information-age society, our opinions are shaped by the mass media and the information that they present. With so many sources, it can be difficult to keep up and sort out what is real and what is just that outlet’s agenda.

Oodles.press is a powerful and independent tool for reflecting real events. We are not indifferent towards our world. Regardless of where we live on earth, we share the same home. Our team feels a high level of personal responsibility and Oodles.press is our contribution to the well-being of our world.



Oodles.press is a news aggregator, developed on the basis of a hybrid content generation model:

PGC – Provider-Generated Content

  • 500 news sources from all around the globe
  • 20 categories from Politics to Science to Healthcare
  • A system for determining how the news is resonating across the internet

UGC – User-Generated Content

  • A system of readers’ international interaction, with automated translation
  • A user-reporter system so that new on-scene materials can be shared quickly
  • A cyber-journalism system to provide professionals and amateurs a convenient toolset for publishing their own articles analyzing newsfeeds from various spots around the world establishing the degree of unrest caused by various events how fast the news travels across mass-media and social networks

Additional unique features

  • Aggregation and evaluation of responses to the news across social networks
  • News stream clustering and filtering
  • Mobile application that monitors the key news related to your specified topics
  • The mobile application will monitor selected topics, adjust user settings, and provide alerts in a user-friendly interface




The project is at an advanced stage of development and we need your help so that oodles.press can make its contribution to the world and make the world a better and fairer place. Everyone is entitled to accurate news and information.






All perks will be delivered to the contributors and donors, regardless of the extent of campaign accomplishment



Every project entails some risks. We, however, are a strong and reliable team that can carry the project to its start. We guarantee that the project will be launched, your financial support will not be lost and the perks will serve as a valuable memento that will remind you of what you've done and will make you proud.




Our team, the developer group Musqogee, has considerable experience in developing online projects and is undoubtedly capable of finalizing the project.

The team consist of a Team Leader, eight specialists and the Project Supervisor, who performs supervising functions in respect of financial matters, project development stages, and commitments to donors.




Together we will lift the universe off its hinges!

story:
Magnolia's will feature craft beer, cocktails/martini's, craft beer cocktails, wine, salads, waffle sandwiches, waffle desserts and waffle brunch!  We will be located at 1190 Edgewood Ave. S, Jacksonville, FL 32205.

Creating a locals restaurant and contributing to the revitalization of Murray Hill has been a strong passion of mine!  I am opening a restaurant in Jacksonville to give residents a community feel restaurant with food that you only dreamed of but without breaking your wallet. Magnolia's will offer a unique dining experience with the food focusing on freshly baked waffles, healthy options, vegan, vegetarian and gluten free options! 

Magnolia's will have a separate dining area from bar so you can decide what area best suites you. There will also be a large covered outside area to enjoy the endless sunny days in Florida! A small private area will also be available to reserve for your larger, more intimate outings or events! 

Our waffles will be made in house daily, no preservatives and no additives. Vegan and gluten free waffles will also be available. And the option to taste the weekly beer waffles.  Every order will be made fresh to order, just like a fresh loaf of bread!

Sandwiches will be offered with a side salad with no additional charge.  Over 10 salads will be offered, over 15 vegan options and 30 vegetarian options for meals and desserts. Sandwiches can be ordered as half sizes so everyone has a size to enjoy. 

Magnolia's will have over 8 savory desserts and an all day brunch menu!

Located at 1190 Edgewood Ave., Magnolia's is within a mile of Murray Hill, Avondale and Riverside! 

Events will be held to support local art, an active life style, beer dinners, and anything else we can think of that we believe you would enjoy!

Check us out on FB: www.facebook.com/Magnoliaspub or online at www.Magnoliaspub.com
story_txt: Magnolia's will feature craft beer, cocktails/martini's, craft beer cocktails, wine, salads, waffle sandwiches, waffle desserts and waffle brunch!  We will be located at 1190 Edgewood Ave. S, Jacksonville, FL 32205.Creating a locals restaurant and contributing to the revitalization of Murray Hill has been a strong passion of mine!  I am opening a restaurant in Jacksonville to give residents a community feel restaurant with food that you only dreamed of but without breaking your wallet. Magnolia's will offer a unique dining experience with the food focusing on freshly baked waffles, healthy options, vegan, vegetarian and gluten free options! Magnolia's will have a separate dining area from bar so you can decide what area best suites you. There will also be a large covered outside area to enjoy the endless sunny days in Florida! A small private area will also be available to reserve for your larger, more intimate outings or events! Our waffles will be made in house daily, no preservatives and no additives. Vegan and gluten free waffles will also be available. And the option to taste the weekly beer waffles.  Every order will be made fresh to order, just like a fresh loaf of bread!Sandwiches will be offered with a side salad with no additional charge.  Over 10 salads will be offered, over 15 vegan options and 30 vegetarian options for meals and desserts. Sandwiches can be ordered as half sizes so everyone has a size to enjoy. Magnolia's will have over 8 savory desserts and an all day brunch menu!Located at 1190 Edgewood Ave., Magnolia's is within a mile of Murray Hill, Avondale and Riverside! Events will be held to support local art, an active life style, beer dinners, and anything else we can think of that we believe you would enjoy!Check us out on FB: www.facebook.com/Magnoliaspub or online at www.Magnoliaspub.com

story: In April 2016 there will be two far right demonstrations in Dover. Various fascist groups have targeted the town seeing it as a potential breeding ground for their vicious brand of hate and bigotry. On both occasions that they visit we intend to counter their hatred by sending out aid to our neighbours in the Calais camps. So, while the Nazis rampage around Dover we will be focusing on on cancelling it out be delivering love, solidarity and warm socks. To do this we will need to pay for crossings for vehicles, and essential supplies. Help us oppose the Nazis and block out their hate - make a solidarity donation now. We promise you it will go directly to our friends at L'Auberge des Migrants, the fantastic group working to support refugees in the Calais camps.

story:
This Indiegogo is for SPONSORS ONLY.
To purchase tickets, please visit our EventBEE!

http://megamail.eventbee.com/event?eid=143543542

RAWket Chocolate Frolic!

Health-Healing-Happiness After-Party

Friday, June 10, 2016 ~ 8PM to Midnight

Music + Mocktails + Merriment + Move + Mix + Mingle

  • DJ and Live Drumming! Belly Dancing!
  • Love Potions!
  • Sponsor Samples with Exciting Giveaways! 
  • Get to know your fellow HHH attendees!

www.RAWketchocolate.com

We are Anand and Chef Mason of WholeWay Home, in Las Vegas, NV. We have been teaching people how to make their own RAW chocolate for a several years now. This June we are pleased to be presenting at the Health-Healing-Happiness Conference and Expo! Over 1000 people are expected at this year's event!!!  

To top it off, we want to throw an after party that features not just ordinary chocolate... but one that focuses on RAW and vegan and Organic Chocolate, PLUS all the other things that make it swing! Like CHAGA! MACA! MAGIC! Music! Mocktails! and MORE!!! We're calling it the RAWket Chocolate Frolic!

There are some actual hard costs to throwing an awesome party.
More Cash = EPIC Bash. ALL PROCEEDS go towards party planning. 


 Why Cacao? Why Frolic? 

Are you wanting, needing, waiting, yearning, burning for chocolates? Justify your LOVE of Chocolate. Chocolate heals your heart! …and boosts LOVE CONNECTIONS! When you eat RAW VEGAN CHOCOLATE ~ it can increase regular dark chocolate health benefits up to 20 times! It’s low-glycemic, raw, gluten-free, vegan and gourmet. 

Why NOT Frolic?!?!

--------------------------------------------------------------

Party with REAL Impact!

A spoonful of sugar makes the medicine go down. When folks who are not vegetarian or vegan (yet) see how much fun and delicious raw vegan chocolate is - they just might start thinking about changing their diets!

  1. Get people to be Vegan-curious! Expose folks to raw, living and minimally processed foods in a light-hearted and playful accessible manner! 
  2. Let Loose with the Juice! Give people the opportunity to let loose and have a blast without feeling the overwhelming pressure to drink or consume harmful “Sin City” substances. By offering unique interesting elixirs to imbibe that will raise spirits – we WILL raise consciousness!
  3. Transform lives! Your hosts have produced numerous fun events before. They know how to get people to interact and open up to once-in-lifetime experiences and good times - that subtly transform lives...

Challenges and the VISION to achieve

Here are the risks and obstacles to achieving our goal.

People

  • Sponsors with healthy versions of chocolate (and related products) who want to access "Product Influencers" in a great setting where they can engage consumers for life.
  • Professional DJ with  sound system and setup.
  • Live downtempo drum accompaniment.
  • Fun amusing emcee for the event.
  • Live performances by dancers/musicians/magicians/more...
  • Talented mixologist to develop Specialty Cacao Drinks and Mocktails: Raw Cacao, Maca, Tea, Blends (and use sponsor products as possible)
  • Loving grateful volunteers to help set-up and breakdown/cleanup.

Place

  • Location that will allow amplified music at least until 12 midnight.
  • Location that will allow our sponsors to share their food products with our guests.
  • Location that is central enough for out-of-town visitors to get to easily by bus, foot or cab.
  • Location that is not only central, but has a hip and healthy vibe and ambiance - with access to alcohol. (Access to raw/vegetarian/vegan food a plus!)
  • Event infrastructure (tables, chairs, curtains, PA, etc.)

Promotion

  • Thank all sponsors and volunteers with nice perks and presents.
  • Outreach crew to help let friends know this will be a fun event to attend
  • Social media crew to help keep the event prominent online.

Product

  • Create a smooth seamless event where people can be relaxed, have fun, because everything is all taken care of perfectly for them and the event producers.
  • Heck - if we do not raise all the money - we will still throw a great party - just in a smaller location and maybe we'll have to stop at 10pm (but we're shooting for an EPIC location and go at least until midnight - it's a Saturday night in LAS VEGAS!)
  • When this party is successful - then let's blow it out for an ENTIRE WEEKEND of celebrating Healthy Chocolate in the future! Focusing on Raw, Vegan and/or Minimally Processed and Organic Chocolates.

    "Raw Chocolate is the entry drug for healthier eating!"
    Cherry Capri from the book, Eat Like Eve

Other Ways You Can Help

Yes, we have thrown out some $$$ and rewards - but please do not let the $$$### intimidate you. We welcome anyone who wants to join the fun and participate in any and all the creative ways you might propose. 

  • In-kind donations are especially appreciated 
  • product giveaways, and their full value will be respected. We hope that you, too want to throw a RAWkin' party in Vegas and look forward to the fun!
  • AND please SHARE! SHARE! SHARE!

www.RAWketchocolate.com

p.s. The video features the song “Stratosphere” by J Laze (Looking Good Records, 1999) available under a Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial license.

story:
This impacts those who have obesity, their families, employers, neighbours, health practitioners and governments.


We found ourselves in the public parks of Montreal working out with a surprisingly high number of other Montrealers

With the only goal of helping more people reaching their health goals and particularly those who can't afford or don't like gyms, we organized workouts and bootcamps in the public parks of Montreal and the number started growing rapidly.

No equipment was necessary, just bars, benches and our body weight. The more we continued the more the numbers grew … until winter.  We started to think about creating a place to welcome the community that we spent the summer creating.

In the parks it was always free so it was open to everyone. However, it was a bit complicated to keep it going all year, especially when the winter arrived.

Right now we operate from a small office, that we share with other coaches and we mainly use it for consultations. And it became very complicated to give the necessary fitness support to our clients. It became obvious to us that we had to level up the standards of our service.

What we have noticed:

SELECT A PERK


SELECT A PERK

SELECT A PERK
SELECT A PERK

The principal goal of this campaign is to give a home to Alpha Shape. A place where we can give fitness classes and nutrition coaching with the philosophy of “Pay as you Train”. We already identified the ideal place and you can have a glance on the picture below.

But as excited as we are, our dream has become more expensive than anticipated and we are reaching out to our community to help us push through. Our ideal project would require 100 000. However, for the moment our goal is to at least get into action. Because our clients, our team and our idea needs a home. We hope to raise 35 000 and the money raised on Indiegogo will help us:

  1. With the deposit required by the city of Montreal of 15,000$, this is not even taking in consideration the permit fee
  2. Then we have Basic renovations: 6000$
  3. The fitness equipment: 9000$
  4. Media and computer system: 1000$
  5. And the follow up and coaching app:  4000$. This will be a way to connect and engage even more with our clients.

    SELECT A PERK

We are confident in our project because we have done extensive research and planning to prevent any possible problems or risks with the fulfillment of our campaign, and we are confident that we can get up and running in a timely matter. Furthermore combined we have :

  • Experience in the nutrition fitness and wellness industry for a combined 6 years. We are in the process of receiving the next level of certification.
  • Experience in the sales and customer service industry for a combined 14 years. An already established client base of around 150
  • An extremely experienced and knowledgeable team of 11 coaches ready to get  started 
  • A collected lead base of around 700
  • The appropriate space for our project in an ideal location close to public transport
  • A used and thought out follow up strategy for the retention of clients and optimal results
  • An active website and blog that is giving us more exposure.
  • A registered company
  • Mentors in the industry who have 20 years of experience
  • A partnership with a whole food supplement company who supplies the supplement side of our nutrition programs (along with the distribution network, and warehousing)
  • We have a strong need in the market place for our services
  • We have the passion, excitement and the will to do what it takes 
  • We are in contact with suppliers for gym equipment; we are in contact with suppliers for membership system and staff system; we are in contact with a contractor with regards to renovations

We are a community facility, and it is our goal to be as involved in the community as we can from the very beginning. We therefore want to get the community involved from the very beginning as well.

Our community is our single greatest asset and our single greatest source of strength, and we want our community and our partners to feel included every step of the way. 

Plus we are committed to reward our supporters with great perks!

SELECT A PERK

story:
Study the photo above. Can you guess which of these kids have diagnosed disabilities? 

QUEST Horsemanship, Inc. (QUEST)'s family of clients, instructors, volunteers and donors might respond: Who cares? 

QUEST's Unified Drill Team program fights the community bias that people with disabilities -- whether "labeled" physically, emotionally, or mentally -- are somehow lesser individuals. Trained staff and volunteers bring together a variety of youth and adults on horseback riding teams.  Teammates assist and encourage each other through riding tasks and patterns, while participating in "equestrian therapy" in a modern format.  Horse care, stable management and equipment care are additional training topics, as clients progress.

Team training leads to public horse shows where clients prove their successes to family, friends, local medical professionals and educators.  Observers are encouraged to view the team as a whole, not to single out individuals. EVERY teammate has great value! "Share. Encourage. Respect." remains QUEST's perfectly applicable motto: practiced in the riding arena, to be carried over into the rest of LIFE.

Many individuals who qualify for QUEST's team programs do not have the financial means to become clients. For instance, a mentally disabled adult who receives monthly support from a state agency often must choose from a restricted list of activities approved by that agency.  While QUEST staff members lobby to be included on such activities lists, they have also set up a sponsorship program.   Sponsored riders who qualify can be welcomed onto one of two planned 2016 Unified Drill Teams: one group of four youth riders, and one group of four adults.. 

In 2014 and 2015, QUEST successfully trained and showcased teams of riders. The shows were successful, and resulted in new clients, volunteers and supporters at QUEST.  In July of 2015, QUEST moved to its own home, where it can operate year-round in its indoor arena despite excessively cold and snowy Western NY.  QUEST has also secured access to a privately-owned truck and trailer.  The next step in the Unified Team vision is taking teams off the home farm and OUT into the community, presenting horse shows to other therapeutic centers, to schools or to businesses who support the idea of integration on every level. 


QUEST's client numbers have tripled since December 2013. With this growth, our vision has expanded.  QUEST moved to its own home farm in July 2016, and as a result will be able to host a total of 50 clients per week by summer 2016!  Clients on QUEST's waiting list would happily fill all remaining spaces, but many are financially unable to participate.  Ask to read personal letters from clients waiting to be sponsored-- an adult with a terminal illness, an adult with brain damage from an auto accident, a child with cystic fibrosis, and others.

We need your help! The cost of the four-month training and horse show for a TEAM of riders is $3000; the cost per client is $750.  Fees cover weekly rides with teammates, led by specialist instructors and accompanied by trained volunteers; team shirts and other related items; horse health (teeth, hooves, digestion, etc) and maintenance; healthy drinks and snacks for human AND horse athletes; equipment purchases; and insurance. 

QUEST IS STAFFED ENTIRELY BY VOLUNTEERS.  100% OF DONATIONS (after platform and credit-card company fees are paid) ARE USED TO CREATE AND MAINTAIN TEAMS.  QUEST incorporated and was granted 501(c)(3) status in March 2014.  QUEST's Treasurer has been trained by accountant and attorney professionals, and is regularly audited.  

Indiegogo.com highlights QUEST and its UNIFIED vision to an enormous crowd of potential supporters!  Donations of $20-100 will quickly add up to full team sponsorships.   Donors can expect to be publicly thanked, included on QUEST's "Wall of Fame" permanently, and given a bi-weekly update on how their teams are progressing.  Help us welcome our 2016 Team members!

Please, if you are unable to give financially, share our story using Indiegogo's tools!
