story:
Nature's best home decors and accessories made from the roots of Vetiver, a medicinal plant.

Vetiver is a kind of grass mainly available in eastern and western part of India. This grass can grow up to 150 centimeters (5 ft) high and form clumps as wide. The stems are tall and the leaves are long, thin, and rather rigid. The flowers are brownish-purple. Unlike most grasses, which form horizontally spreading, mat-like root systems, Vetiver's roots grow downward, 2 meters (7 ft) to 4 meters (13 ft) in depth.


The Vetiver bunch grass has a gregarious habit and grows in tufts. Shoots growing from the underground crown make the plant frost and wildfire resistant, and allow it to survive heavy grazing pressure. The leaves can become up to 150 centimeters (5 ft) long and 8 millimeters (0.3 in) wide.[3] The panicles are 15 centimeters (6 in) to 30 centimeters (12 in) long and have whorled, 25 millimeters (1 in) to 50 millimeters (2 in) long branches.[3] The spikelets are in pairs, and there are three stamens.

The plant stems are erect and stiff. They can persist deep water flow. Under clear water, the plant can survive up to two months.

The root system of Vetiver is finely structured and very strong. It can grow 3 meters (10 ft) to 4 meters (13 ft) deep within the first year. Vetiver has no stolons nor rhizomes. Because of all these characteristics, the Vetiver plant is highly drought-tolerant and can help to protect soil against sheet erosion. In case of sediment deposition, new roots can grow out of buried nodes.

Herbal skin care use

Vetiver in recent years have been used to produce perfumes, creams and soaps. It is used for its antiseptic properties to treat acne and sores.

Several aspects of Vetiver make it an excellent erosion control plant in warmer climates.

Strong root: Vetiver does not form a horizontal mat of roots; rather, the roots grow almost exclusively downward, 2 meters (7 ft) to 4 meters (13 ft), which is deeper than some tree roots.

This makes Vetiver an excellent stabilizing hedge for stream banks, terraces, and rice paddies, and protects soil from sheet erosion. The roots bind to the soil, therefore it can not dislodge. Vetiver has also been used to stabilize railway cuttings/embankments in geologically challenging situations in an attempt to prevent mudslides and rockfalls, the Konkan railway in Western India being an example. The plant also penetrates and loosens compacted soils.

Vetiver is mainly cultivated for the fragrant essential oil distilled from its roots. In perfumery, the older French spelling, Vetiver, is often used. Worldwide production is estimated at about 250 tons per annum. Due to its excellent fixative properties, Vetiver is used widely in perfumes. It is contained in 90% of all western perfumes. Vetiver is a more common ingredient in fragrances for men; some notable examples include Dior's Eau Sauvage, Guerlain Vetiver, Mr. Vetiver by Une Nuit a Bali, Zizan by Ormonde Jayne and Vetiver by L'Occitane.

Vetiver  is also used as a flavoring agent.

The United States, Europe, India, and Japan are the main consumers.

.

In-house use

In the Indian Subcontinent, Khus (vetiver roots) is often used to replace the straw or wood shaving pads in evaporative coolers.[3] When cool water runs for months over wood shavings in evaporative cooler padding, they tend to accumulate algae, bacteria and other microorganisms. This causes the cooler to emit a fishy or seaweed smell into the house. Vetiver root padding counteracts this smell. A cheaper alternative is to add Vetiver cooler perfume or even pure Khus attar to the tank. Another advantage is that they do not catch fire as easily as dry wood shavings.

In the hot summer months in India, sometimes a muslin sachet of vetiver roots is tossed into the earthen pot that keeps a household's drinking water cool. Like a bouquet garni, the bundle lends distinctive flavor and aroma to the water.

Medicinal use

Vetiver has been used in traditional medicine in South Asia (India, Pakistan, Sri Lanka), Southeast Asia(Malaysia, Indonesia, Thailand), and West Africa.

Old Tamil literature mentions the use of Vetiver for medical purposes

More over the Vetiver routs have fibrous properties so here we are introducing attractive handicrafts for your show case.

Beautifully made boat and house will be a main attraction of your show case or at working place.


The Hindu God Ganesh


He is the Lord of success and destroyer of evils and obstacles. He is also worshipped as the god of education, knowledge, wisdom and wealth. In fact, Ganesha is one of the five prime Hindu deities (Brahma, Vishnu, Shiva and Durga being the other four)

so we made ganesha in  vetiver he not only bring positive vibrant in your place but also bring a special attraction in your wall.

Mother Mary

 

Mary, also known as St. Mary the Virgin, the Blessed Virgin Mary, Saint Mary, Mary Mother of God or the Virgin Mary is believed by many to be the greatest of all Christian saints. The Virgin Mother "was, after her Son, exalted by divine grace above all angels and men."

this mother of god made beautifully in vetiver roots.

Kathakali

Kathakali is one of the oldest theater forms in the world, and its a stylized classical Indian dance-drama noted for the attractive make-up of characters, elaborate costumes, detailed gestures and well-defined body movements presented in tune with the anchor playback music and complementary percussion.

this common Kathakali character face made beautifully in Vetiver roots.

Hat, footwear  and handfan.

Vetiver has many ayurvedic medicinal uses and it has been used in traditional medicine in South Asia.

Hat:

Hat made by vetiver root keeps your eyes cool and prevent hair fall, you will love it to wear even at your home.

Footwear:

You will feel like walking on grass inside your home and it prevents your foot from crack and also keep your body cool.

Hand fan:

These hand fan will create a very refreshing breeze which gives you pleasant aroma of Vetiver and also refreshes your mood.

Why we need crowd funding:

To produce all these we dont need big mechineries but we need spacious place and well trained workers and also some mechineries for moulding and stitching etc. 


We  train poor women and also handicapped people who can sit at one place and work. We offer fair salary and all facilities by marketing these products all over the world, which will give them a financial stability and confidence to live and to give good education to their children.  

A small contribution of yours can make a big changes in their life and can keep you blessed.
story_txt:
Nature's best home decors and
accessories made from the roots of Vetiver, a medicinal plant.
Vetiver is a kind of grass mainly available in
eastern and western part of India. This grass can grow up to 150 centimeters (5
ft) high and form clumps as wide. The stems are tall and the leaves are long,
thin, and rather rigid. The flowers are brownish-purple. Unlike most grasses,
which form horizontally spreading, mat-like root systems, Vetiver's roots grow
downward, 2 meters (7 ft) to 4 meters (13 ft) in depth. 
The Vetiver bunch grass has a gregarious habit
and grows in tufts. Shoots growing from the underground crown make the plant
frost and wildfire resistant, and allow it to survive heavy grazing pressure.
The leaves can become up to 150 centimeters (5 ft) long and 8 millimeters (0.3
in) wide.[3] The panicles are 15 centimeters (6 in) to 30 centimeters (12 in)
long and have whorled, 25 millimeters (1 in) to 50 millimeters (2 in) long
branches.[3] The spikelets are in pairs, and there are three stamens.
The plant stems are erect and stiff. They can
persist deep water flow. Under clear water, the plant can survive up to two
months.
The root system of Vetiver is finely structured
and very strong. It can grow 3 meters (10 ft) to 4 meters (13 ft) deep within
the first year. Vetiver has no stolons nor rhizomes. Because of all these
characteristics, the Vetiver plant is highly drought-tolerant and can help to
protect soil against sheet erosion. In case of sediment deposition, new roots
can grow out of buried nodes.
Herbal skin care use
Vetiver in recent years have been used to produce
perfumes, creams and soaps. It is used for its antiseptic properties to treat
acne and sores.
Several aspects of Vetiver make it an excellent
erosion control plant in warmer climates. 
Strong root: Vetiver does not form a
horizontal mat of roots; rather, the roots grow almost exclusively downward, 2
meters (7 ft) to 4 meters (13 ft), which is deeper than some tree roots.
This makes Vetiver an excellent stabilizing hedge for stream banks,
terraces, and rice paddies, and protects soil from sheet erosion. The roots
bind to the soil, therefore it can not dislodge. Vetiver has also been used to
stabilize railway cuttings/embankments in geologically challenging situations
in an attempt to prevent mudslides and rockfalls, the Konkan railway in Western
India being an example. The plant also penetrates and loosens compacted soils.
Vetiver is mainly cultivated for the fragrant
essential oil distilled from its roots. In perfumery, the older French
spelling, Vetiver, is often used. Worldwide production is estimated at about
250 tons per annum. Due to its
excellent fixative properties, Vetiver is used widely in perfumes. It is

in fragrances for men; some notable examples include Dior's Eau Sauvage,
Guerlain Vetiver, Mr. Vetiver by Une Nuit a Bali, Zizan by Ormonde Jayne and
Vetiver by L'Occitane.
Vetiver 
is also used as a flavoring agent.
The United States, Europe, India, and Japan are
the main consumers.

the house. Vetiver root padding counteracts this smell. A cheaper alternative

advantage is that they do not catch fire as easily as dry wood shavings.
In the hot summer months in India, sometimes a

distinctive flavor and aroma to the water.

story:
Summary

  • My name is Shelby Hamden and I'm the owner and creator behind Blueberry Hill Soaps.
  • I create handcrafted, artisan soaps, usually with the cold process method. I love creating beautifully scented soaps that look just as pretty as they smell.
  • I'd like to take this to the next level and start creating larger size batches and a larger size soap option.
  • Your contribution not only funds the supplies I need to upgrade my business, but in turn the growth of the business will help support my family, pay for electric bills, car repairs, soccer & dance, etc. 

What We Need & What You Get

Supplies Needed & estimated cost.

  • Soap Molds large enough for full size batches. I currently use small soap molds that only yield 5-10 3.5 oz size bars. I plan to upsize to molds that are large enough to provide 15-18 5 oz size bars. 
  • Large Size Quantities of Ingredients, I never use animal products or palm products, so I don't include a lot of different ingredients, but buying in bulk will save a ton of money! 
  • Colorants & Fragrances. I only use vegan colorants (no carmine!) and I often use both synthetic fragrances and essential oils. Buying these in bulk quantities will also be cost effective, especially since I typically only source from 3 different suppliers, this saves on shipping.
  • Mixing containers & mixing utensils. I will need to accomodate these larger size batches with some larger mixing containers. Some of the containers I have now will accomodate these larger batches, some will not. 
  • In addition, the funds from this campaign will pay for crafters guild insurance, the fees from the campaign itself, and the perks.
Perks:
  • Certain support levels will include a product gift. I appreciate the support and I'm more than willing to turn it around and provide a quality, handmade product.

The Impact

  • This project is extremely valuable to my family. This is a home based businesses, run by myself, Shelby Hamden, with Nick playing a major support role. 
  • Due to the time spent unemployed over the last year, Nick has finally found work in a new career in teaching and although it's a major pay increase from being unemployed, it's a decrease from the previous salary he made prior to teaching.
  • We haven't ever had to utilize daycare in the last 2 years and we hope to continue this trend by keeping my working from home full time (although I do hope to continue working part-time at the craft store!)

Risks & Challenges

No new project is without risks. In the instance of this only being partially funded, it's important that you know where your money goes first. The first amount of funds is spent on bulk ingredients. I've chosen this so that in the event we do not fully fund, I will have the ingredients to make the soaps for the perk prizes/gifts. 

Additionally, another important expense is the craft guild insurance, to provide liability insurance in the chance of mishap. I like to think my quality control is very good, but everyone makes mistakes and it's important to protect my customers and my family.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please spread the word about our campaign. Share, share, share! If you're logged into IndieGoGo and you use the "sharing" links at the top of this page, we can see who refers the most contributions! There may be a gift in it for you! ;)
  • Use the hashtag #bbhsoaps when you can so we can see all your support.
  • Consider adding our products/etsy store to your holiday wishlists!

story:
WHY YOU SHOULD HELP:

Women who have lived through Domestic Violence experience emotional dis-empowerment, they are often left lacking in self-worth, confidence or inner power and can feel helpless to control their situation. Further to this as a result of the trauma caused by Domestic Violence, many women experience symptoms of Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) and even after extensive counselling many women continue to struggle to regain control of their life.
Symptoms of PTSD may include:

  • Anxiety
  • Depression
  • Fear
  • Anger
  • Insomnia
  • Self-isolation
  • Eating disorders
  • Nightmares
  • Suicide

World Health Organisation, has declared that “violence against women is today widely recognised as a global problem. It is one of the least visible but most common forms of violence, and one of the most insidious violations of human rights. It has serious impacts on the health and wellbeing of those affected, both in the immediate and longer term, continuing even after the relationship has ended. Exposure to violence leads to poorer physical & mental health overall compared with women who have not experienced violence”.

MY EXPERIENCE:

With a Post Graduate Diploma in Mental Health and after working for many years as a Registered Mental Health Clinician, I have gained extensive experience working in all areas of adult mental health, from acute to the community and forensic mental health, coupled with experience in child & adolescent mental health services.

As an Independent Practitioner of Hypnotherapy, NLP, Timeline Therapy & Life Coaching, I have the pleasure of assisting people to overcome problems that have been holding them back from enjoying their life to the fullest.

As a survivor of Domestic Violence, I bring lived experience and firsthand knowledge of the devastating impact that Domestic Violence has on an individual, children, family and even friends. For the past 18 years I have worked hard towards rebuilding my life so that my children could have a brighter future. My four sons are now all young adults and working towards their own futures and having embarked on my own journey of personal growth over the years, I have discovered the formula for self-empowerment and have had success applying this to my own life.

It is because of these reasons that I am passionate about empowering the lives of women who have been impacted by these devastating and life changing acts of violence. Making me the perfect person to assist women across Australia and even across the world.

ABOUT THE EMPOWER YOUR LIFE PROGRAM

My own life experiences have inspired me to develop a powerful hypnotherapy program that specifically assists women to overcome the negative and traumatic effects of Domestic Violence, so that they can feel a strong sense of self-worth, self-empowerment, confidence and control over their own life.

I have had great success with this therapy program while working with individuals and have then further developed the therapy by adding an educational workshop (Empower Your Life Beyond Domestic Violence), that I have since been running successfully with small groups.

I created the Empower Your Life Beyond Domestic Violence program after extensive research and through modelling the successful work already done by the likes of Tony Robbins (Life & Business Strategist) and Shane & Jess Fozard (Australian Success Academy).

Empower Your Life Beyond Domestic Violence allows women to gain the relevant knowledge they need to take control of their lives immediately, through an exciting and engaging educational workshop that incorporates NLP Life Coaching techniques. Participants are then led through the powerful hypnotherapy session that will enable them to leave with new found feelings of improved self-worth, self-empowerment, confidence and control over their life, so that they are ready to put that knowledge into action. And when put into action these feelings will grow stronger each and every day.

There is no other program like this one in Australia that is specifically designed to empower women who have been victims of Domestic Violence, making this program even more important. The program is delivered in a safe, supportive and caring environment, which allows women to feel comfortable enough to make those changes happen, with ongoing support available after completion of the program.

Due to the success of the Empower Your Life Beyond Domestic Violence program, I am now taking the program to the next level, with the aim to reach, empower and assist to change the lives of even more women across Australia.

I also aim to extend this program overseas through the use of a recorded audio program and online webinars.

WHAT YOUR DONATION WILL BE USED TOWARDS:

  • Building a dedicated website for EMPOWER YOUR LIFE BEYOND DOMESTIC VIOLENCE (Website & design $400-600)
  • Audio & Visual equipment, including data projector ($3355)
  • Resource printing ($300-500)
  • Venue Hire for first four events ($1040)
  • Audio Program recording ($600-1000)
  • Advertising ($700-1000)

    Total Start-up Costs $6,395 - $7,495

HOW YOU CAN HELP:

Your donation will help me enrich the lives of many women across the world, allowing them to live the life they want to live. Remember to check out the donation perks!

Show your SUPPORT by donating and assist women who have experienced Domestic Violence.

SHARE this campaign with the greater community through social media or any way you can.

Take a stand today & say NO to violence against women.

Create REFERRALS to the program.

Because we ALL deserve to live the life we choose for ourselves!

THANK YOU FOR SUPPORTING MY CAMPAIGN
 

If you would like more information about this program or my story, please send your email to:
Michelle Schultz
empoweryourlife.withhypnosis@gmail.com

story:
Who are we?

We are Chris and Amy, a young couple based in Plymouth UK. Chris has a degree in Economics and currently works in Marketing for a local company. Amy has a degree in International Business with Spanish and currently works for a national debt counselling charity. Our hobbies include surfing, cycling and keeping our 20 year old surf wagon roadworthy. We also both love to travel and between us have visited many countries, the majority of these being developing countries. On our trips we have been involved in various voluntary roles, including teaching roles, manual labour as well as offering business advice to help people to help themselves. During our time overseas our eyes were opened to the reality of poverty and injustice and the need for sustainable funding for charity's to to help effectively. It was these life experiences that led us to begin looking into ways to sustainably help in a tangible and effective way, and so Hope in Planks was born.

What's it all about?

At Hope in Planks (HIP) we sell top quality wooden home and kitchenware that we are proud of and we are sure you will love, items such as such as wooden candle holders, spoons, chopping boards etc.

10% of every sale is donated to a not-for-profit we support in Guatemala called Story International.  They do an amazing job at transforming the lives of orphans in the mountainous region of Huehuetenango in Guatemala.  For more information on how they do this, please check out their website - www.storyintl.org

Amy volunteered with Story International as a school teacher back in 2013.  We know the charity well and absolutely trust and love the work they do.  We wanted to be able to support them financially in a sustainable way.

What's the goal?

Our goal is two-fold.

We want to make great quality wooden products that people love, cherish and find useful in their day to day lives.

But we do this so that we can sustainably support beautiful orphans to learn the vital skills needed for their day to day lives.

How will we achieve our goal?

To ensure our products are loved by our customers, we plan to stay in touch through various social media: Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram, we want to know our customer and know what products they would like to see in our range. We will be starting with a small range of products but we aim to introduce new products into our range in the near future.

We will be supporting orphans who are soon to leave the orphanage in Guatemala as they can often be lost as they leave the establishment of the orphanage to join the big wide world. We will do this by supporting Story International's El Puente program which is a 12-month program designed to ease the transition from group home living to independence and adulthood.

During their time at the transition home, they learn to build a resume, drive a car, cook for themselves, manage a budget, etc. This is all overseen by a Resident Advisor who also helps each resident make a 12-month and two-year life plan.

What's the bigger picture?   

We are passionate to see change and to be able to sustainably achieve change is part of the bigger picture.

We would love for Hope in Planks to be successful so that we will be able to support more orphanages in Guatemala and Central America.

We are passionate about ensuring orphans have the right skills needed to thrive in the big wide world when they turn 18 and leave the establishment of the orphanage.  

We would love to be able to get involved further with providing funding/resources to be able to help equip these children for the workplace and learn the necessary skills for life.

Even more long term, we would love to support those leaving orphanages to be able to start their own business, through providing training and advice in Business start ups, empowering them to help themselves rise above poverty and see transformation in their communities.

OK, so how will we begin this big vision?

We will be selling all sorts of wooden home and kitchen ware.  Our products are made in Europe by a co-operative of woodworkers who produce quality items made from local woods such as beech and oak. The wood is sustainably sourced and certified by The Forest Act of 1993 which ensures sustainable forest management for which the local families depend on. The products are then sent to the UK, where we hand finish them, sanding, varnishing and branding them. Then we package them up and pop them in the post.

How can you get involved and support?

Well we need around about £1000 to get started, so we can make a good bulk order of our products and supplies, and to get our website fully up and running.

To do this we need your help! 

You can support us by buying anyone of our perks you can even buy more than one if you wish. You can find them on the right hand side of the page, these will be the products we will sell when our shop goes live. We want to start as we mean to go on too, so for each perk you buy we will donate 10% to Story International.

Small and Medium Beech Chopping Boards

Oak Candle Holder

Large Beech Chopping Board

Twice Curved Cherry Wood Spatula

Beech Pestle and Mortar

Mega Beech Chopping Board

Beech Kitchen Roll Holder

If you want to do more or can't buy any of our perks but want to support, please spread the word, tell your friends and share us on Facebook, Instagram or Twitter.

Thank you for any support you give it makes a huge difference!!

What's the postage cost I hear you ask?

Well, all of our products come with FREE postage anywhere in the UK. :-D

For International Shipping we have had to add on some costs at the Checkout stage. (Sorry guys)

What are the risks?

To be honest the main risk is that you don't capture our vision and crazy big plan. There aren't too many risks to the business as this funding will help us get our initial bulk order out there. From there on we can reinvest the money we make from selling these items to make our future orders. So we shouldn't be in a position of making large orders and not have the funds to pay for them.

There is a risk that you all really capture our vision and we get loads of support, meaning we will be incredible busy for a while and may run out of stock initially. This is a very welcome risk and one we would love, we welcome the challenge!

From us, Hope in Planks and Story International, thank you for taking the time to read this and for any support you give even if its a 'like' at your computer screen.

Thanks everyone

Much love,

From the HIP team.
story_txt: Who are we?We are Chris and Amy, a young couple based in Plymouth UK. Chris has a degree in Economics and currently works in Marketing for a local company. Amy has a degree in International Business with Spanish and currently works for a national debt counselling charity. Our hobbies include surfing, cycling and keeping our 20 year old surf wagon roadworthy. We also both love to travel and between us have visited many countries, the majority of these being developing countries. On our trips we have been involved in various voluntary roles, including teaching roles, manual labour as well as offering business advice to help people to help themselves. During our time overseas our eyes were opened to the reality of poverty and injustice and the need for sustainable funding for charity's to to help effectively. It was these life experiences that led us to begin looking into ways to sustainably help in a tangible and effective way, and so Hope in Planks was born.What's it all about?At Hope in Planks (HIP) we sell top quality wooden home and kitchenware that we are proud of and we are sure you will love, items such as such as wooden candle holders, spoons, chopping boards etc.10% of every sale is donated to a not-for-profit we support in Guatemala called Story International.  They do an amazing job at transforming the lives of orphans in the mountainous region of Huehuetenango in Guatemala.  For more information on how they do this, please check out their website - www.storyintl.orgAmy volunteered with Story International as a school teacher back in 2013.  We know the charity well and absolutely trust and love the work they do.  We wanted to be able to support them financially in a sustainable way.What's the goal? Our goal is two-fold.We want to make great quality wooden products that people love, cherish and find useful in their day to day lives.But we do this so that we can sustainably support beautiful orphans to learn the vital skills needed for their day to day lives.How will we achieve our goal?To ensure our products are loved by our customers, we plan to stay in touch through various social media: Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram, we want to know our customer and know what products they would like to see in our range. We will be starting with a small range of products but we aim to introduce new products into our range in the near future.We will be supporting orphans who are soon to leave the orphanage in Guatemala as they can often be lost as they leave the establishment of the orphanage to join the big wide world. We will do this by supporting Story International's El Puente program which is a 12-month program designed to ease the transition from group home living to independence and adulthood.During their time at the transition home, they learn to build a resume, drive a car, cook for themselves, manage a budget, etc. This is all overseen by a Resident Advisor who also helps each resident make a 12-month and two-year life plan.What's the bigger picture?   We are passionate to see change and to be able to sustainably achieve change is part of the bigger picture.We would love for Hope in Planks to be successful so that we will be able to support more orphanages in Guatemala and Central America.We are passionate about ensuring orphans have the right skills needed to thrive in the big wide world when they turn 18 and leave the establishment of the orphanage.  We would love to be able to get involved further with providing funding/resources to be able to help equip these children for the workplace and learn the necessary skills for life.Even more long term, we would love to support those leaving orphanages to be able to start their own business, through providing training and advice in Business start ups, empowering them to help themselves rise above poverty and see transformation in their communities.OK, so how will we begin this big vision?We will be selling all sorts of wooden home and kitchen ware.  Our products are made in Europe by a co-operative of woodworkers who produce quality items made from local woods such as beech and oak. The wood is sustainably sourced and certified by The Forest Act of 1993 which ensures sustainable forest management for which the local families depend on. The products are then sent to the UK, where we hand finish them, sanding, varnishing and branding them. Then we package them up and pop them in the post.How can you get involved and support?Well we need around about £1000 to get started, so we can make a good bulk order of our products and supplies, and to get our website fully up and running.To do this we need your help! You can support us by buying anyone of our perks you can even buy more than one if you wish. You can find them on the right hand side of the page, these will be the products we will sell when our shop goes live. We want to start as we mean to go on too, so for each perk you buy we will donate 10% to Story International.Small and Medium Beech Chopping BoardsOak Candle HolderLarge Beech Chopping BoardTwice Curved Cherry Wood SpatulaBeech Pestle and MortarMega Beech Chopping BoardBeech Kitchen Roll HolderIf you want to do more or can't buy any of our perks but want to support, please spread the word, tell your friends and share us on Facebook, Instagram or Twitter.Thank you for any support you give it makes a huge difference!!What's the postage cost I hear you ask?Well, all of our products come with FREE postage anywhere in the UK. :-DFor International Shipping we have had to add on some costs at the Checkout stage. (Sorry guys)What are the risks?To be honest the main risk is that you don't capture our vision and crazy big plan. There aren't too many risks to the business as this funding will help us get our initial bulk order out there. From there on we can reinvest the money we make from selling these items to make our future orders. So we shouldn't be in a position of making large orders and not have the funds to pay for them.There is a risk that you all really capture our vision and we get loads of support, meaning we will be incredible busy for a while and may run out of stock initially. This is a very welcome risk and one we would love, we welcome the challenge!From us, Hope in Planks and Story International, thank you for taking the time to read this and for any support you give even if its a 'like' at your computer screen.Thanks everyoneMuch love,From the HIP team.

story:
Three years ago my brother and I went for a late night food run. At the time we were both struggling in our employment situations. We bought a disappointing strawberry Rhubarb pie. The next day we started talking about how we could do so much better than that pie we'd had the other night. One thing lead to another and we found ourselves developing recipes and ideas to run our own food business. We both moved on to better employment but I kept the ideas flowing and the dream alive.

I looked to my own South American roots as well as the influence of family and friends from around the world to come up with an unusual food that I could bring to my community. As ideas continued to evolve I settled on arepas. For those of you who are unfamiliar arepas are a bit like southern johnny or hoe cakes. They are savory cornmeal cakes that are typically found in Venezuela and Colombia. They are typically served with a savory fillings and can be eaten as a snack, side or a full meal.

I would like to serve a variety of arepas from my food truck: bean & cheese, shredded beef, chicken and pork as well as a mixed Cuban style picadillo,  Another way I hope to make my offerings stand out is through various sauces. This is where the second part of the brand comes from. Huacatay (black mint) is an herb typically found in Peru.  Huacatay sauce is made with the herb along with Peruvian chiles among other things. The sauce comes out a creamy lime green and gives any food a clean fresh taste unlike any you've had before. In addition to Huacatay and some hot sauces I'd also have Argentine chimichurri and Cuban mojo sauce. I would also love to offer a Colombian inspired sweet arepa topped with carmelized apples.

These many possibilities will be a feast to the senses but most especially to the tastebuds. This dream is coming ever closer to reality but I need your help, The biggest hurdle in a food truck business is the truck itself. The truck needs to be a fully equipped mobile kitchen. Most preowned or even pre planned trucks include unneeded equipment and lack needed equipment for what I'd hope to do. The range in cost is almost identical to that of building a new custom truck. 

So please pledge your support. My crew and I thank you in advance for your time, your support and your willingness to share the campaign with others.

story:
At this point most people I know or meet support this project, they just don't know what they can do to help it along. But now that this campaign is online the answer to that question becomes simple. The only thing stopping this project from going online is the funding it takes to program it, so share the word and if you can, pitch in a few dollars. 

Even if we don't raise the full amount this try, all donations will be re-invested in a nicer 're-boot'. We're already talking with video-experts just in case. Again, we won't spend a single dime of the donations, they will all be re-enrolled into the next, higher-profile crowdfunding campaign.

If you want to help more you can share a link to this in more places, and even help us get a few organizations attention by messaging them about us. There's also a few groups that could get this thing funded in a second if they'd just mention us, and I could really use your help in convincing them to do so. They need to know it's not just some obscure little group thinking about this stuff, so if you could even just message them on Facebook with a link to this it could  possibly end up helping a lot.  There's "Redacted Tonight", "The Juice Media" (aka Rap News), and really any other group that speaks against corporations.

If we can get the Centers for NonViolent Communication on our side that could do a lot to increase our social credibility.

story:
Update: Contribute NOW to reimburse your credit perks at the pop-up on January 28th or 29th or at www.EvilEyeMercantile.com!

Step into the past & look to the future!

I want to bring Chicago (Wicker Park/ Ukrainian Village/ West Town/ Bucktown area) an old-fashioned general store where neighbors can get away from modern times and discover goods crafted by hand by people who take pride in their work!

 

  • But me, I've been a lowly shop girl for 20-something years. I live paycheck-to-paycheck. I know that it takes some time to grow a business properly and I don't have the means to support it in the start-up phase . I need YOU!
  • I've got a business plan to share but also put together a temporary storefront to bring to life a mini-version of my vision. Please watch the video to get the idea ~ sorry I couldn't capture how AMAZING it smells in here!!!
  • Backing this store is backing my dream to do GREAT THINGS through COMMERCE! I want to create an environment that is FUN and REWARDING to work in, that is GRATIFYING to shop in, and which supports American makers and heartwarming causes WORLD-WIDE!

I'd like to inspire & propel good deeds through local commerce!

It's a great idea, right?!? But I need proper capital!

We've had encouraging feedback from neighbors during the pop-up shop on Division St. I'm confident that this concept can indeed grow and become a stop that the West Town/ Wicker Park/ Ukrainian Village communities will be very fond of. In fact, I can envision a growth stage where we'll be able to grow roots in other communities as well one day! However, it really takes time and patience and a lot of energy to get a small business its legs. I want to be sure that it has what it needs to grow. To have the capital to sustain a year's expenses would give it a really strong shot. This campaign is intended to begin that fund and hopefully also to reach some people who can back it at a larger contribution (be a financial partner!).  I'd love for you to be a part of it!

  • Capital raised will allow this concept to find a spot to grow roots. I'll be looking for a corner storefront (1000-1500sf) somewhere within the West Town, Wicker Park, and Ukrainian Village neighborhoods. The goal is to raise enough to give this a go in Spring 2017.
  • If you're chipping in at a rate which gets you product perks, you're in for a treat! I've used many of these brands for years and I absolutely love them. Ask me about them if you'd like when you're choosing your reward. And~ as we've extended the pop-up shop through January 29th ~ you can even claim your credit immediately by shopping in store at 2124 w Division!
  • This is a business model for a community general store and YOU are part of this community! This will be a venue for young and old, for positive thought and ideas, for strengthening the identity of the neighborhood. Symbolically, you can contribute at a rate which earns you to literally etch your name into our business! The aesthetic will have lots of weathered wood as a general store would have in the 1880s. You'll be able to carve your name into a board when we open! You can also get a lifetime employee discount or even share a special cause which we'll promote and contribute to!

Is it a good guess...

to say that you've spent a little time feeling blue about some people not being as kind or as considerate or as responsible and careful of others and Earth??? It so happens that I organized and executed the pop-up shop version of this concept in a time of strong emotions and feelings of despair all around me.  I am so thankful for the experience of learning so many good things that makers and organizations are doing to fight for our resources and to leave positive footprints. Keep your chin up and be part of solutions!  :

  • Help craftspeople find new audiences for their quality goods.
  • Keep vibrant small business sectors in neighborhoods.
  • Communicate ways to produce with clean energy, with fair labor practices, and with renewable resources.

It won't be easy!

I know this well! I've had a small business before back in 2001-2002. I ran the pop-up shop while working a full time job (couldn't have done it without a fabulous team~~whoot!) I've seen many businesses lately struggle and fold. Yet still, there are businesses in similar neighborhoods with similar values which sustain and persevere. Through observation and interaction that I've had with neighbors and other business owners during the pop-up event, I know that this concept can thrive here in time.  But it needs essentials to do this: financial support, a caring eye, and patience. I've got two-thirds of the ingredients.

  • I started my retail career at  Kline's -a small, family-owned department store in Chicago Heights, Illinois. I'm sure that is where I got my business values. Seeking great, quality brands is what they did. Listening to the customer brought them pleasure. Enjoying connection to community and individuals made them a destination for generations. I've worked for a regional dept. store ~Carson's~ over 20 years cumulatively. I've also worked for Mark Shale, Marshall Field's, and Museum Company. I've worked in merchandising for Phillips Van Heusen, Haggar, and Sarah Lee. I've had a vintage shop (fun, costume-y stuff from the 60s-80s mostly) in Bucktown (Phoenix Retro Resale).  I've studied Retail at Syracuse University and I've studied Marketing at University of Illinois at Chicago. I've picked up a little bit (and sometimes a lot) at each of these stops. I'm eager to take all of that and turn it into something that really elevates the shopping experience into something that does the heart good.
  • I'm a frugal-by-nature person. But, I know that sometimes you have to put your nose out there more than is comfortable. I don't want to see this idea fail because it didn't have enough in the bank to get through the start-up phase. I will take the capital raised and continue to watch for ways to improve and to think on those things and try and regroup and react and brainstorm and press until this works as long as there is a dime in the bank.

Pockets empty?

I can relate!! Even $5 or $10 helps a LOT in giving the campaign more momentum. If not, you can still show support by:

  • Sharing this effort with family, coworkers, neighbors, and friends! Tell them about it in person, too!
  • Use the Indiegogo sharing tools! 
  • Check out the Instagram & Facebook pages! There are many videos on the Facebook page for the causes that our brands named to give back to. I love to watch them. It might be a good way to start your day. Get inspired. Spread the love. (www.facebook.com/EvilEyePopUp)
  • Check out our website ~ www.EvilEyeMercantile.com! You'll still be able to shop there while I'm trying to raise funds for the brick-and-mortar space & there will be updates there, too!
  • If you would like to contribute as a financial partner, please get in touch directly. There is a 6% loan + 5 year/ 1% net profit structure for shares at $5,000 currently set up and I'm very interested in bringing more great minds to this team.

Thanks reading & listening. Please pitch in how ever you can so that this can happen!!

With much appreciation,

Kris.

story:
The Story

I moved out to the pretty rural side of Loudoun Wine Country to start that life-long dream project. The trails, struggles, emotions, pitfalls were almost too much to bare. The support and help of friends and family has meant that the dream still survives. I have spent countless hours working, and have even worked myself into exhaustion, but I have yet to give up, and now I can proudly say that I am close to realizing the first part of my crazy dream, but I need that last little bit to make it complete.
The first part of this dream project is to restore the old 1870's farmhouse. I have saved the home from being destroyed forever, and I have all but converted it into a Bed and Breakfast. What remains are the final touches, like curtains, rugs, furniture, and the comforts of a home. To complete this project would be a major achievement and only a small bit of help will definitely get me there. 
See more information about the guesthouse at http://www.homestead1870.com

What I Need & What You Get

  • I am looking for donations to help me get the final needs of the home completed, furniture, rugs, decorations, curtains, all the basics.
  • I am looking to raise at least $2,500
  • Donations will enter you into a drawing for a free two night stay

Risks & Challenges

  • Fortunately, the only challenge is time. I will complete this project and as long as the world or job do not come crashing down on me, I only need the to continue to invest the time to complete the project.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you cannot contribute, that's fine, please just get the word out, share it and mention it to others, maybe they can, take advantage of the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Also, if you just want to come out and help, there's plenty of work out here to do, and I am more than thankful for everything.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Summary

Pale pink sand. Wild dolphins cavorting in turquoise waters. Soft trade winds & coconut palms. Unique birds. Unrivaled snorkeling & diving.

This is what surrounds an abandoned pearl farm in the heart of the only UNESCO biosphere reserve in the French Polynesia Tahitian islands. The pearl farm is on a small island inside the Kauehi Atoll in a pristine environment which only recently opened up to tourism with the creation of an airport.

You can grow this tiny pearl farm into an ecotourism paradise for divers, snorkelers, sailors & travelers…& reap a number of exclusive perks. We’re creating an eco-lodge reflecting its origin as a pearl farm in traditional Polynesian culture: simple & cozy, focused on the land & the ocean. Because the island is inside a Biosphere Reserve, we’re working with the village elders to develop in a sustainable manner, renovating existing buildings & supporting solar power, osmosis desalination, rain water collection & composting. Our belief in a balanced relationship with nature also drives other sustainable projects like a garden to grow organic produce.

The Diving

While there is already some local diving, we are currently working to ensure that the dive infrastructure is firmly established in the area this year.

The Team

Gabriele & I are originally from Germany, however, we have worked in hotels all over the world. We have the knowledge & drive to make this a successful, unique place in paradise. We also have an international team backing us including people from New Zealand, Germany & the US as well as local Polynesian people working together. A European TV production firm is so enthralled by this project that there’s already a contract to film the renovation. 

What Your Perks will Fund

Other Ways to Be Involved

  • Spread the word by sharing this campaign.
  • Join our work exchange program which allows budget conscious travelers to work 4 hours day in exchange for one night of free lodging & meals on our island. Contact us for more info.

 

Top photo courtesy of Tahiti Heritage (http://www.tahitiheritage.pf/).
Embedded photo courtesy of the Renards (http://lesrenarddetahiti.overblog.com/).

story:
Please join us in growing Mad Lavender Farm into a more beautiful, functional and sustainable environment for spiritual recharge, education & fun.

Mad Lavender Farm is a 10 acre xanadu on a high, sunny field buffered by woodland and pine. Located in rural Hunterdon County, we’re just a few miles from I 78.

We started planting lavender in 2013 and last year (2015) we had our first real harvest. It was so satisfying and even a little overwhelming when all that lavender came into full bloom. Our “drying shed” was in one half of a camper, retrofitted to hang hundreds of bunches of lavender.

When we put the Mad Lavender Farm sign up at the end of our driveway last year, people came. We met hundreds of new people, some who live nearby and some who drove miles to find us. We know we have something very special here and we’d like you to experience it with us.

                

A very successful year (on a shoestring budget!)

We are so grateful for the help of WWOOF USA in helping to grow Mad Lavender Farm in 2015. We housed a total of 15 different WWOOF workers (willing workers on organic farms) in our 1986 Nomad camper. Together, we planted 300 more lavender bushes and installed a 3-tiered lavender labyrinth.  We now have seven different varieties of organically grown lavender. Our flock of two dozen exotic hens live in a gypsy caravan chicken coop. At sunset, a fire blazes in a big iron cauldron circled by tree stumps for seating in our fire pit.We have already started booking WWOOF workers to stay and help work on the farm in 2016.

Mad Lavender Farm hosted these attractions and events In 2015  

      • Walking Meditation in the Lavender Labyrinth

      • Yoga Retreats

      • Kombucha Workshops

      • Lavender Wand Workshop

      • Sage Smudge Stick Workshop

      • Hospice Worker Retreat

We have our sights on raising $20,000. to help develop the farm in 2016.

Because we are artisans and love working with our hands, we design and build all the structures and installations on the farm. Wwoofers and friends are enlisted to help which also cuts down on costs considerably. Our dream for Mad Lavender Farm is big, though, and now we need your help. Your contribution will cover the costs of additional materials, equipment and specialized labor to complete our vision.

Our first priority is to secure a Drying Shed for our ever increasing Lavender yield to be hung and processed. We need to replace the roof on an existing building, then we are good to go!

         

Our plan for a retail shop is to build and decorate a gypsy caravan medicine wagon.

To serve our visitors year round, and to maintain our vision for sustainability, we’d like to install a state-of-the-art compost toilet outhouse.  

We are also on the lookout for a 25 or 30 foot Yurt for meditation, workshops and retreats.

To grow our petting zoo we need a home for a couple of miniature milking goats. Goats add so much in the way of entertainment, as well as providing the main ingredient for goat’s milk soap.

We have a vision to build a “Gaudi Wall” art piece made of concrete decorated with broken mirror and tile to surround the fire pit and offer more seating. This is another great opportunity to hold workshops for making mosaics.

        

Constructing the Geodesic Dome (a four person project!)   

                                                                                                                          

How Did We Get That Name?

We named our farm “Mad Lavender” as a nod to Lewis Carroll. It reminds us to always inject a dose of fun and frabjousity into our creations on the farm. A good example is our “Flowering Dome”, an 18 foot high geodesic stainless steel dome donated to the farm this year by our friends Eric & Grace Fiorito. To complete our vision, by Summer 2016, the dome will covered with a mass of flowering vines and the interior will be outfitted with reclaimed pallet furniture and homemade cushions. Imagine sitting in the shade of fragrant blossoms having a Mad Lavender Tea Party under a geodesic dome in the middle of July!

How Did We Get Here?

In 2012, the future of our family's 10 acre farm came into question. Once a popular “pick your own raspberry” farm, my father’s crop was demolished by the ever increasing deer population. In order to preserve our farm, and to continue to maintain our farm tax assessment, we needed to find a deer resistant crop. Then we discovered Lavender. The more we learned the more enchanted we became with Lavender for it's beauty, variety, healthful properties and resilience. We decided that we would be lavender farmers.

Building Community

 There is a bit of magic in the lavender; walking the labyrinth, picking bouquets or gathered around the cauldron burning lavender stems. The heart begins to open, the mind finds clarity. There's a bit of magic, too, when people discover common ground. Perhaps it's in a sense of play, sharing resources, solving problems together, finding a sense of belonging or a new level of empathy. The community experience is what brings Mad Lavender Farm to life. We want to continue to build Mad Lavender Farm to serve our community in a way that is  satisfying, educational, entertaining and accessible. 

Risks & Challenges

Our first attempt to raise lavender in 2013 was disastrous. We invested in 300 plants and we lost nearly the entire crop to a devastating winter. By the following winter, we were ready. With sufficient research and better support, we grew healthier plants, better varieties and they came through another bitter cold winter no problem. We continue to remain teachable and open to new ideas. A sustainable farm is one that supports diversity, a vision for the future and a respect for the wisdom of experienced elders. 

How You Can Help (even if you can’t donate money)

If you are  excited about our vision, please share our campaign with your friends on social media.

If you know of a used Yurt in the tri state area, please let us know about it.

A temporary goat hut would come in handy, too.

Give us a call if you’re local and would like to lend a hand on the farm for a couple of hours. We feed our helpers very well!

Don building our Gypsy Caravan coop (with a cement floor to protect our hens from predators).

Adrienne's high brow damask stencil design to decorate the caravan.

Voila! Adrienne with our first wwoofer, Ashley, who helped stencil the caravan.

story:
Cup & Kettle Tea Shop

Jessica Messmer and Kayla Maldonado have been long time friends who have always dreamed of owning their own business.  One day, Jessica came up with an idea to open a tea shop in Bloomington (the best town ever).  Kayla later that same day called Jessica and asked if she would like to open a tea shop together!  This is how the Cup & Kettle idea came about through these two friends!  

We believe that Bloomington, IN has a wide variety of wonderful places to explore, eat,  and shop.  Unfortunately, tea lovers living in the area do not have many local options.  We want to create a local, Bloomington staple for tea drinkers in this community.  Great quality loose leaf teas served in a comfortable atmosphere is something that Bloomington is currently lacking, and we want fill that void.  We love tea, we want others to be able to experience loving teas in Bloomington!

Contributors like you will help make this dream a reality.  With the money we raise we will be able to open a tea shop in Bloomington serving a wide variety of organic, fair trade, loose leaf teas as well as tea accessories and feature local art work.

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking you to help us make this shop a reality by supporting our campaign.  We are using our own money, a loan, and this campaign to get a space in Bloomington and all of the supplies needed to properly sell our teas.  Those who donate will receive whichever perks they choose.

If our goal is not met, we will still be using the funds toward opening a tea shop in Bloomington!

Tell your friends!

Find out more by visiting our website

  • Please help our shop by telling your friends, it's as simple as using the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
What we are

Frequent Vibrationz™ is a Recreational Cannabis start-up, soon to be Oregon's premier recreational cannabis retail location that sells cannabis, cannabis concentrates and cannabis infused products for recreational use by adults 21 years of age or older. All product will be the highest quality available at the best price, hand picked by the highly knowledgeable owners to ensure that any choice made by the customer is a great choice. Our budtenders will be highly trained specialists on our cannabis products as well as lead the industry with legendary customer service. Frequent Vibration plans to become an active vendor within the community to make the city of Portland a better place. We strive to earn the loyalty of every guest that enters our doors by providing them with the highest quality products available on the market, highly knowledgeable and friendly staff to assist in the buying process, fair competitive prices and continued growth of our product line guaranteed to keep up with the rapidly changing and evolving industry.

Short Summary

With the veil of prohibition finally being lifted, botany, genetics and analytics can come together for the first time and carry cannabis forward. While the excitement and deep passion this plant represents can never disappear, the idea that cannabis has unknowable properties must be discarded forever! 

Cannabis is highly considered to be enjoyable to use and it has even proven to have it’s own health benefits. It is rich in chemical compounds with measurable, testable application processes. For Us here at Frequent Vibrationz, this new paradigm presents amazing opportunities and unique challenges, but the goal remains simple: to put our product in control. We want Our product to be the loudest voice!

What We Need & What You Get

We need to come up with $15,000.00 for our initial Building investment. We here at Frequent Vibrationz are looking for the opportunity to get the building and location of our dreams to open our first shop! We are a little short on the property cost and we are hoping you all can help the next best retail cannabis shop open as soon as possible to give Oregon the best vibes and buds they have ever had!
If you make an initial investment over $250.00 we will offer you Merchandise and a potential opportunity to be the first to buy public shares of our company. If you would like to make larger investments contact us on our website!

The Impact

  • Help us bring Oregon the best retail cannabis shop experience they have ever seen! Our shop offers a unique customer experience that every connoisseur will enjoy! We are one of a kind! We are going to make the cannabis industry an even more unique experience ! So, we ask that you help us out and we will pay it forward!

story:
Short Summary

I started a wine brand for my family called Seven Sisters to change our destiny. We grew up poor and when I was about 16 years old my father lost his job of 25 years and we were evicted having to leave the village. We were offloaded 2 with a family member in the town nearest to our village about 10 kilometers away. We were 8 children and mom and dad. My dream over the years was to build a family business so we can unite again as a family and secondly become financially independence. We mainly export to the USA since 2007. Because of apartheid black people was not allowed to own land, have wineries or farms. This means I had to buy my wines from other wineries. 2011 we acquired a barren piece of land which we are developing into a fully fledged farm. We planted vines and would like to landscape the farm and upgrade it. 

What We Need & What You Get

the first prize is to upgrade the current facilities and landscape the grounds in order to make it people friendly and also to cater for children. We need to landscape the land, build our own dam to retain water for our farm, purchase outside furniture, establish a petting farm yard for children. Equip the restaurant and tasting facility properly and appoint staff in order to have a healthy business

Your perk will be a branded Seven Sisters Apron and Cap, not yet selling in the market. An added bonus will be a picture, name and address of yourself on the hall of building our legacy in our galery on the farm. 

The Impact

If this campaign is successful it will put us on a different level of business. We can compete against the well established wine farms in the area, Spier Wine Estate etc.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • I understand if you cannot contribute financially but you can maybe forward this to people you know who could contribute. 
  • Do make use of the  Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hi, We are Wanda and Taz, a youngish husband and wife team with a big family of funny talented small humans who all like to get stuck in and help whilst learning the trade.

Together we have been working haaaaard for what seams forever, cafes, event catering,baking,making and learnng all whilst taz works 5 jobs for other people and helping friends, family and strangers with there prjects.

All the while we have had a shared dream that we will have our own venue that we can throw our energy and passion into, somewhere we can have a restaurant, bnb and hold events. well now we have that place.

the cwmanne tavern is a beautiful sleepy old tavern, that we want to transform  into a beautiful wide awake tavern with a bangin restaurant and a lively bar, serving beverages to match the quality of food that we are  known for creating. There will be tapas available at the bar as well as real coffee and freshly squeezed orange juice.

Bringing together the delights that wales has to offer with some of the traditions of a spanish bar will create a unique and delightful find for locals and travelers alike. A true gem and comfortable place to lay your head.

We are so close! but we are not quite there and are running low on funds, we need help to raise money to furnish the bedrooms, buy stock and start paying our hard working crew before we get  going.

luckily for al of us we have some really great things to offer you guys in exchange for your help!

story:
About

My name is Morgan Davis. I'm a graphic designer, fashion designer, photographer, proud graduate of Howard University, and the founder + CEO of Distinctly Creative. I founded Distinctly Creative in the Winter of 2015 because I wanted to create a safe space + community for black creative entrepreneurs to grow professionally & personally. In addition, I wanted to help further push the narrative that we as black people, black creatives all deserve a seat at the table.

What started as an Instagram page highlighting various black creatives turned into events, the Black Creatives Matter apparel line, the DMV Black Creatives Directory, an online learning platform, and so much more.

Currently, Distinctly Creative is located in a small studio space in Brentwood, MD. This space functions as an event space that's available to rent for a variety of creative events, and a rotating gallery space featuring work by local black creatives. 

In November of this year, Distinctly Creative will be moving to a 3000+ sq ft coworking + maker space in Suitland, MD. This space will allow us to further implement our mission of advocating & supporting for black creatives by opening a space that is catered towards helping creative entrepreneurs succeed. 

 

What's a coworking + makerspace & why? 

A coworking space is a collaborative, shared workspace where entrepreneurs and business professionals are able to work amongst other like-minded individuals. A makerspace is a collaborative workspace that unlike a coworking space provides members access to a variety of maker equipment. 

Coworking + makerspaces are not only a cost-effective option towards having access to professional level tools, but they also help establish a sense of community.

When you give creatives a space to create so many amazing things can happen between networking, economic empowerment, and community building which are things that are so needed, especially in Southern Maryland -- where there are very few spaces that are focused on entrepreneurs in general -- especially black creative entrepreneurs. 

Our new space will be able to provide the tools, resources, education, and community for creative entrepreneurs of a variety of mediums & skill levels -- in an atmosphere that not only promotes creativity + innovation, but does so in a way where it’s also providing a welcoming environment for black creatives & the overall community.

 

What will the space look like + where will it be located? 

Our new coworking + makerspace will be located in Suitland, Maryland next to the Branch Avenue Metro Station. The space is 3,000+ square feet and will include access to the following:

  • Heat Presses + Screen Printing Equipment
  • Sewing Machines + Sergers
  • Embroidery Machines
  • Art Easels
  • General Art + Sewing Supplies
  • Printers & A Plotter
  • Desktop Computers & Laptops with Adobe Creative Suite & Graphic Tablets
  • A coworking lounge
  • Storage Lockers + Mailboxes 
  • A recording studio for podcasts, live broadcasts, and other audio needs.
  • A photography + videography studio.
  • Meeting Room
  • Private Studio/Office Space
  • An event + gallery space.
  • Professional Development Workshops & Classes
  • Networking Events
  • Social Events
  • Periodic After-School Programming for Middle School & High School Students
  • A small kitchen

Membership Pricing: 

  • Day Pass: $30/day
    • Includes access to the space during business hours.
  • Virtual Membership: $45/month
    • Access to our online membership community**
    • 15% off event + meeting rentals
    • Free Monthly Networking Event 
    • Discounted Pricing to Distinctly Creative Events
    • 1 Free Coworking Day Pass - $10/day to co-work after that
    • 25% off Photography or Recording Studio Rental
  • Weekend Member: $185/month***
    • Access to online membership community**
    • Free Access to 2 Distinctly Creative Events per month
    • Free Monthly Networking Event
    • 2hrs of meeting room time per month.
    • 20% off event rentals
    • Access to the space to cowork on Saturday & Sunday during business hours -- $10/day for any additional days
    • 3hrs per month of photography or recording studio time
  • Full Time Member: $290/month***
    • Access to online membership community**
    • Free Access to 3 Distinctly Creative Events per month
    • Free Monthly Networking Event
    • 4hrs of meeting room time per month
    • Full coworking access during business hours
    • 25% off event rentals
    • 6hrs per month of photography or recording studio time
  • Private Office + Studio Space: $400-500/month****
    • 24hr access to private office/studio space
    • Access to online membership community**
    • Free access to our monthly workshops, classes, and social events
    • Full coworking/makerspace access during business hours
    • 6hrs of meeting room time per month
    • 2 free events per quarter (35% off after that)
    • Mailbox + Locker
    • 9hrs per month of photography or recording studio time

Membership Features:

  • Free high speed Wi-Fi
  • Coffee & Tea
  • Free access to general office necessities (copying, printing, etc.)
  • Storage space available
  • Mail services available
  • Free entry to events + workshops 

Additional Pricing:

  • $100/hr for event rentals
  • $75/hr for photography studio rentals
  • $35/hr for recording studio rentals (extra fee for audio technician)
  • $35/hr for workshops + meetings
  • All memberships + day passes require taking a $20 training class before having access to the sewing + t-shirt printing equipment. 

Hours of Operation:

  • Coworking/Makerspace Hours:
    • Wednesday - Friday: 11 AM - 11 PM
    • Saturday - Sunday: 10 AM - 11 PM
  • Meeting Room Hours:
    • Monday - Tuesday: 10 AM - 8 PM
    • Wednesday - Sunday: 9 AM - 11 PM
  • Photography/Recording Studio Hours
    • Monday - Tuesday: 10 AM - 8 PM
    • Wednesday - Sunday: 9 AM - 11 PM
  • Event Space Hours
    • Wednesday - Sunday: 9 AM - 11 PM (case by case basis for events ending after 11 PM & on Monday or Tuesday) 

**Our online community is where members are able to check-in to the coworking/makerspace, post events, add their business to our directory, connect with other members, and have access to livestreams of our workshops.

*** A two month commitment is required. 

*** A four month commitment is required. 

What We Need

Our goal is to raise $40,000 for our new coworking/makerspace. This amount will allow us to  purchase the necessary equipment, and perform general renovations.

 

Perks

In return for your support, we'll be offering our limited edition "Black + Creative AF" t-shirts + mugs, and discounts on some of our memberships. For more info, you can read the "Select a Perk" for more details.

  • $10 - Black + Creative AF Stickers
  • $25 - Black + Creative AF 11oz Mug
  • $45 - Black + Creative AF T-Shirt
  • $75 - T-Shirt + Mug
  • $100 - 7 Day Co-Working Pass (The fee for the training class is waived.)
  • $200 - 1 Month Full Time Membership (A two month commitment is not required for this, and the fee for the training class is waived.)
  • $400 - 2 Month Full Time Membership (The fee for the training class is waived.)
  • $1,000 - 1 Year Weekend Membership (The fee for the training class is waived.)
  • $2,500 - 1 Year Weekend Membership + 5 3hr Events (The fee for the training class is waived.)

 

Our Impact

Distinctly Creative is committed to a vision of promoting and advocating for black creatives and entrepreneurs, and being the go-to platform for those looking to broaden their skill sets, network with other like-minded individuals, and connect their brand/business with the overall community. Thanks to our supporters, Distinctly Creative has been able to work with, collaborate, and showcase hundreds of amazingly talented black creatives, and this new space will allow us to create an even bigger impact upon our community. However, don't just take our word.

----

"Distinctly Creative has been crucial to my evolution as a creative and building my network of like-minded black creatives. I’ve had countless opportunities to learn and grow professionally, get my art in front of the community and build bonds with fellow creatives. I’m really looking forward to their new learning platform, The Playbook, to continue my professional growth as a creative. Distinctly Creative not only promotes and advocates for black creatives, they have created a tribe!" - Rashad Muhammad of RAM Creates 

 

"Distinctly Creative is an innovative brand that creates many opportunities for black creatives in the DMV to build their network and promote their services. I have worked with Distinctly Creative for the past two years on multiple projects doing make or modeling, and each project has been an amazing edition to my portfolio and connected me with other creatives and potential clients.  - Muslimah Carpenter, MUA

 

"Distinctly Creative embodies the diversity that is black artistry. The mixture of cultures is phenomenal, with a distinctive energy that is relatable to the abundant amount of creatives who participate in these events. With her quote “Black Creatives Matter,”  Morgan (creator of Distinctly Creative and artist), gives opportunity, faith and a platform to the young and underground artists that are just trying to do what they love, create." - Heather Sulton, Visual Artist

 

 

Why your contribution matters. 

Here's why we think it's worth it help us open our space:

  • Our space will create jobs by employing creatives to teach classes, and curate exhibits. We also provide free monthly opportunities for members to vend/sell their products & services to the overall community. 
  • Our space will help make having access to professional creative equipment easier for those in the DMV -- especially in Southern Maryland + SE DC. There are very few spaces for entrepreneurs in SE DC & Southern Maryland, and even fewer spaces for creative entrepreneurs. 
  • Our space will help cut down the costs of being a creative entrepreneur. Being a creative can be expensive, and our space will help reduce some of those overhead costs by providing access to the necessary equipment/workspaces. 
  • Our space will act as a safe space & community hub for black creative entrepreneurs.
  • Our space will teach children & young adults the importance of entrepreneurship. Throughout the year we will be holding free after-school & summer classes for local middle schoolers and high schoolers to teach them about the facets of entrepreneurship. As a business that focuses on black creatives, we believe that it's incredibly important that we teach black children that their talents, interests, and voices matter, and that they're so much more than a stereotype.
  • Our space will teach creative entrepreneurs about the business side of the industry. We will be hosting monthly professional development workshops & classes that are open to our members and the general public. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute monetarily  it is greatly appreciated if you could share our campaign with your friends and families by sending them the link, or using the Indiegogo share tools!

If you have any questions, please feel free to shoot us an email at info@distinctlydc.com 

 

Thank you!
story_txt:
About

My name is Morgan Davis. I'm a graphic designer, fashion designer, photographer, proud graduate of Howard University, and the founder + CEO of Distinctly Creative. I founded Distinctly Creative in the Winter of 2015 because I wanted to create a safe space + community for black creative entrepreneurs to grow professionally & personally. In addition, I wanted to help further push the narrative that we as black people, black creatives all deserve a seat at the table.
What started as an Instagram page highlighting various black creatives turned into events, the Black Creatives Matter apparel line, the DMV Black Creatives Directory, an online learning platform, and so much more.
Currently, Distinctly Creative is located in a small studio space in Brentwood, MD. This space functions as an event space that's available to rent for a variety of creative events, and a rotating gallery space featuring work by local black creatives. 
In November of this year, Distinctly Creative will be moving to a 3000+ sq ft coworking + maker space in Suitland, MD. This space will allow us to further implement our mission of advocating & supporting for black creatives by opening a space that is catered towards helping creative entrepreneurs succeed.
