story:
What’s Happening at Lulu’s?

Transformation & Expansion

Lulu’s has become a Sedona favorite, and a landmark for chocolate connoisseurs to buy directly from Lulu’s production facility. The decor and seating in the lounge front tasting room, the drinks, and the music box events, have put smiles on so many faces. Now, as Lulu leaves Sedona, the beautiful space is emptying out unless we do something about it...

We currently have 18+ community members interested to keep the kitchen going as a collective rental, and an entire community to serve with the sweet lounge space, great healthy drinks & ongoing Music Box series with radio broadcast live & recorded from Sedona.

This community project has two parts: 1. The lounge is a great place to be, enjoy healthy, decadent treats produced in our own co-op kitchen & is also an intimate music listening venue for Sedona performers & enthusiasts. 2. Synergy Co-op kitchen is affordable & aimed to help creators expand their crafts to wider markets. Kitchen rental comes with amazing benefits for local artisans, but we cannot do this without community enthusiasts!

What You Get

THE CAMPAIGN PERKS  ➡️ ➡️ ➡️ ➡️ ➡️ ➡️

Check them out! ➡️Pre-purchase eco-friendly, ergonomic, reusable, stainless steel "Synergy Sedona" to-go mugs that come with a drink and a lifetime 5% discount whenever you bring it in for a drink. Don’t lose that mug! (Picture to come, we're still working on finding the BEST SLEEKEST MOST ATTRACTIVE MUG EVER!)

This baby’s for You, connoisseurs of the fine things in life...

Pre-purchase gift cards for our healthy gluten-free, delicious & organic goodies, music box VIP seat tickets, permanent VIP status (10% or 25% off for life!), Lulu's Chocolate bars, Lulu's Limited Edition Chocolate Gift Sets, Tender Hearts Cookies, private parties in the sleek and sexy lounge like you own the place (mi casa su casa), and Sierra's soulful folk band Lighthouse on the Moon will even come and play a show at your own house party. PLUS other awesome discounts where you can save as much as you want. Wait till July to really start redeeming when the kitchen is totally cookin. 

If you aren't looking for a perk, and you still want to contribute - just click the "BACK IT" button at the top of this page & enter any donation amount you want

 

Audio Downloads - Xtra Gifts from a SYNERGY Supporter

EVERYONE WHO CONTRIBUTES ANY AMOUNT Receives "Renaissance of Grace," healing World Music album by incredible healer & musician, Aurora Juliana Ariel, when you donate ANY amount PLUS:

Choose 1 additional downloadable product for donations over $33

2 additional downloads for donations over $50

3 for donations over $75

4 for donations over $100.

Choose from 100's of Aurora's healing life-transforming music albums, books and audios from her catalog. We will send you download links when you donate ANY AMOUNT to this campaign!

Long Distance Love

For friends, family and supporters of everyone who will benefit from this INCREDIBLE CREATION, even if you aren't in Sedona, we have some long-distance love for you! See the perks ➡️➡️➡️

Synergy Co-Op Kitchen Renter Perks

For those interested in renting the kitchen, check out the kitchen renter perks. Stack up those coupons and save!

 

A Venue for Sedona...

1. The Goods

100% gluten-free baked goods, vegetarian, organic, gluten-free breakfast sandwiches, vegan CBD raw dog biscuits, essential oils, kombucha, Barbara’s Bundts and what else? The sky’s the limit - Sedona is full of artisans. 

 

2. Lounge Space & Delicious, Healthy Drinks

You get a beautiful place to chill out! And it's soooo cozy in here...

 

3. Music

The “Music Box” experience originally created by Lulu will continue, and expand. Phase 2 of this project, once the kitchen is all arranged, is to open into the old “Atlantis” Store and build a STAGE for SEDONA! And won't we all love that. There won’t be any problems with sound ordinance in this location, where we will host intimate, real concert listening experiences with a 49-person occupancy, dance parties, theatre, comedy, rotating visual arts and whatever you wanna do.

Photo courtesy of Saith, during his incredible Music Box performance - Thank you Saith!

4. Night Hours

How about an after-dinner date destination, late night chai chat, luxurious wind-down for all the Sedona dinner servers, and an all-ages, healthy, safe and beautiful hang-out for our local friends under 21. Now that's some real community

What we Need & Max Costs

Immediate

1.5k - Signage

2.5k - Co-op Display Case

6k - Commercial Electric Ovens for Karen's, Barbara’s Bundts, and everybody.

Karen's dream ovens

8k - Remaining payment plan to Lulu for a boatload of chocolate & stainless steel - Buy local at the Lounge & that will also help us get that covered!

2k - Estimated Taxes & 3% Fees on contributions

= 20k TO START!

 

The Long Haul ~ A VISION FOR SEDONA

Night Hours ~ a bumpin' Theatre Concert Venue ~ Extended Lounge ~ More Seating ~ Better equipment for Co-op Kitchen & The Best Benefits Possible for Kitchen Co-op Members

10k- City Sewer Fee to add espresso machine and seating

10k- Espresso machine & plumbing installation, because the new and incredible “Garland Coffee” (garlandcoffee.com), Sedona locally roasted to perfection, deserves superb representation.

8k - Kitchen Hood to really get cookin - Right now we’re only an electric baking and raw production facility - no open stove tops till we get this! Once we have this we'll be adding a whole new healthy, gluten-free, vegetarian menu to Sedona offerings- yes!

Just getting started now, with the retail space & kitchen as it is, we can totally move forward toward this expansion...

Phase 2 - Optional - THE CONCERT VENUE 

IF you help this kitchen first succeed, Sedona, both by pledging to this campaign & coming into the lounge, then we build you a real stage intimate concert venue. Costs to be determined, though we already have architect, Dan Surber, & designers with plans in the works. That’s when we really become SYNERGY - food, music, lounge, art, the works - all in one.

 

The Impact

Boosting Local Economy and Beyond 

Think of all your favorite products that improve your everyday - food, drink, herbals, beauty-care. All your favorite goods come from original creators who put their life’s energy into bringing it to you. SYNERGY is going to bring more of those favorites to you, to Sedona, and beyond. 

A commercial kitchen is legally required to ship out of state. So we are really launching platform, AKA an “incubator” kitchen - we handle all regulations, inspections, fees and insurance to maintain a commercial kitchen, which we then rent at an affordable price, so artisans can focus on what matters most to them - their craft. This will give the local economy a major boost! 

Just as Lulu’s is successfully expanding beyond Sedona out of this space, watch and see what comes of this - all the success of our collaborators. And you get first taste at the Lounge :)

 

The Challenges

City Compliance & Funding

As we face some real rules & fees with the City of Sedona to do what really want to do (up to 10k sewer fee alone, and brand new, more expensive sign regulations), the biggest challenge we face is not getting enough start-up funding! If our beautiful Sedona community wants to see vital, local businesses succeed in our town, we all need to actively support them. No one wants to see a strip mall in West Sedona. Let’s keep it unique, and support amazing local businesses like Synergy, Chocolatree, Indian Gardens, Creekside, Local Juicery, Interdependence, and all your favorite Local Digs! We need community support right now, especially in the beginning, to create another amazing community space FOR YOU.

Parking

Some people have said the parking lot is difficult to get into. Well we have a solution for that - sedonatakeout.com will bring the goods, drinks, Lulu’s Bliss Shakes and all our offerings right to you. 

front of building view at the current "Lulu's Chocolate Lounge"

We have a lot to build on, and we start where we are and grow from here - just like Lulu's started out selling chocolate with an umbrellad push cart at California festivals, now look. Just like all your fav foods started in someone's home kitchen.

With the support of those who enjoy it, we get there.

Please pledge NOW - this is ONLY a 30 day campaign! 

Delaying means you might forget, so THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR TAKING ACTION NOW! The more you give, the more we can give you to love! 

This is How We Do It

Our Crew 

Julie Ayla Earthwalker - Kitchen Manager. Founder and Owner of conscioussedona.com - connecting the health-conscious with local, healthy businesses.

Sierra Shafer, Project Leader. 3+ years experience working for Lulu in kitchen, front of house, as a manager, and as a traveling sales agent. Event Coordinator for Sedona Street Arts Festival and Gumption Street Arts Festivals. Musician. Community Connector.

Tanya Marcy - Public Relations Specialist and event coordinator, an amazing connector in all things community.

Mark Short - Marketing Master of Sedona Advertising Agency

Josh Lillis - Signage Guru at Sedona Sign Company 

Kitchen Members including Joshua Vailokaitis - Rawr Bakery; Karen Russell - Karen’s Gluten Free Living; Illup Granvegard- Ambrosia, Shaun Ndeanna - Sedona Takeout, Jeanette Richelson - Barbara’s Bundts, and Sarah Anne Lesslie of Chocolita, continuing with some of her chocolate production in the same space she has rented with Lulu for the past 4 years.

Lulu's Chocolate - We have the continual support, in numerous ways, from Lulu’s Chocolate, for this campaign and beyond. Lulu will be shipping chocolate so we can keep all your favorite specialty line of Lulu's drinks on the menu.

And... You!

 

Join the Crew & Other Ways You can Help

In just one month after announcing, 17+ community members have expressed sincere interest, which verifies that this space will fulfill a sincere need in the community of Sedona and beyond. We want to help these young businesses get their products out to you - please pledge!

If you can’t support this campaign but you’d still like to see Synergy happen for Sedona, and for all our amazing kitchen renters, there are still ways you can help:

Share this campaign

Use the Indiegogo's share tools top right to post on social media. Especially forward to your email list, text message, and tell your friends about it! Thank you!

Follow us on Instagram

Currently listed as “Luluschocolatelounge”

Come into Synergy

Currently Lulu's Chocolate Lounge, come hang out in the lounge, take a coffee/tea break and try out the first round of goodies crafted in the kitchen. We are soft-launching SYNERGY first week of June, grand opening June 7th!

Thank you so much for your support, in helping us to make an AMAZING space for YOU, for Sedona, all our amazing visitors, and all our kitchen cooperative members, who, with your help, are going to create so much success and goodness in the world. <3 <3 <3 

Sedona visitors having a great time at the lounge

SYNERGY Co-op Kitchen & Lounge supports SMALL, CREATIVE, LOCAL businesses with little to no capital, and gives a HUGE boost to these quality, healthy products, so they can find their way to you and beyond. And supports local Music. The more we raise with this campaign, the better we can be, the lower our kitchen rental cost, and the more you can see, taste, and enjoy!

What’s Happening at Lulu’s?Transformation & ExpansionLulu’s has become a Sedona favorite, and a landmark for chocolate connoisseurs to buy directly from Lulu’s production facility. The decor and seating in the lounge front tasting room, the drinks, and the music box events, have put smiles on so many faces. Now, as Lulu leaves Sedona, the beautiful space is emptying out unless we do something about it...We currently have 18+ community members interested to keep the kitchen going as a collective rental, and an entire community to serve with the sweet lounge space, great healthy drinks & ongoing Music Box series with radio broadcast live & recorded from Sedona.This community project has two parts: 1. The lounge is a great place to be, enjoy healthy, decadent treats produced in our own co-op kitchen & is also an intimate music listening venue for Sedona performers & enthusiasts. 2. Synergy Co-op kitchen is affordable & aimed to help creators expand their crafts to wider markets. Kitchen rental comes with amazing benefits for local artisans, but we cannot do this without community enthusiasts!What You GetTHE CAMPAIGN PERKS  ➡️ ➡️ ➡️ ➡️ ➡️ ➡️Check them out! ➡️Pre-purchase eco-friendly, ergonomic, reusable, stainless steel "Synergy Sedona" to-go mugs that come with a drink and a lifetime 5% discount whenever you bring it in for a drink. Don’t lose that mug! (Picture to come, we're still working on finding the BEST SLEEKEST MOST ATTRACTIVE MUG EVER!)This baby’s for You, connoisseurs of the fine things in life...Pre-purchase gift cards for our healthy gluten-free, delicious & organic goodies, music box VIP seat tickets, permanent VIP status (10% or 25% off for life!), Lulu's Chocolate bars, Lulu's Limited Edition Chocolate Gift Sets, Tender Hearts Cookies, private parties in the sleek and sexy lounge like you own the place (mi casa su casa), and Sierra's soulful folk band Lighthouse on the Moon will even come and play a show at your own house party. PLUS other awesome discounts where you can save as much as you want. Wait till July to really start redeeming when the kitchen is totally cookin. If you aren't looking for a perk, and you still want to contribute - just click the "BACK IT" button at the top of this page & enter any donation amount you want Audio Downloads - Xtra Gifts from a SYNERGY SupporterEVERYONE WHO CONTRIBUTES ANY AMOUNT Receives "Renaissance of Grace," healing World Music album by incredible healer & musician, Aurora Juliana Ariel, when you donate ANY amount PLUS:Choose 1 additional downloadable product for donations over $332 additional downloads for donations over $503 for donations over $754 for donations over $100.Choose from 100's of Aurora's healing life-transforming music albums, books and audios from her catalog. We will send you download links when you donate ANY AMOUNT to this campaign!Long Distance LoveFor friends, family and supporters of everyone who will benefit from this INCREDIBLE CREATION, even if you aren't in Sedona, we have some long-distance love for you! See the perks ➡️➡️➡️Synergy Co-Op Kitchen Renter PerksFor those interested in renting the kitchen, check out the kitchen renter perks. Stack up those coupons and save! A Venue for Sedona...1. The Goods100% gluten-free baked goods, vegetarian, organic, gluten-free breakfast sandwiches, vegan CBD raw dog biscuits, essential oils, kombucha, Barbara’s Bundts and what else? The sky’s the limit - Sedona is full of artisans.  2. Lounge Space & Delicious, Healthy DrinksYou get a beautiful place to chill out! And it's soooo cozy in here... 3. MusicThe “Music Box” experience originally created by Lulu will continue, and expand. Phase 2 of this project, once the kitchen is all arranged, is to open into the old “Atlantis” Store and build a STAGE for SEDONA! And won't we all love that. There won’t be any problems with sound ordinance in this location, where we will host intimate, real concert listening experiences with a 49-person occupancy, dance parties, theatre, comedy, rotating visual arts and whatever you wanna do.Photo courtesy of Saith, during his incredible Music Box performance - Thank you Saith!4. Night HoursHow about an after-dinner date destination, late night chai chat, luxurious wind-down for all the Sedona dinner servers, and an all-ages, healthy, safe and beautiful hang-out for our local friends under 21. Now that's some real communityWhat we Need & Max CostsImmediate1.5k - Signage2.5k - Co-op Display Case6k - Commercial Electric Ovens for Karen's, Barbara’s Bundts, and everybody.Karen's dream ovens8k - Remaining payment plan to Lulu for a boatload of chocolate & stainless steel - Buy local at the Lounge & that will also help us get that covered!2k - Estimated Taxes & 3% Fees on contributions= 20k TO START! The Long Haul ~ A VISION FOR SEDONANight Hours ~ a bumpin' Theatre Concert Venue ~ Extended Lounge ~ More Seating ~ Better equipment for Co-op Kitchen & The Best Benefits Possible for Kitchen Co-op Members10k- City Sewer Fee to add espresso machine and seating10k- Espresso machine & plumbing installation, because the new and incredible “Garland Coffee” (garlandcoffee.com), Sedona locally roasted to perfection, deserves superb representation.8k - Kitchen Hood to really get cookin - Right now we’re only an electric baking and raw production facility - no open stove tops till we get this! Once we have this we'll be adding a whole new healthy, gluten-free, vegetarian menu to Sedona offerings- yes!Just getting started now, with the retail space & kitchen as it is, we can totally move forward toward this expansion...
Phase 2 - Optional - THE CONCERT VENUE IF you help this kitchen first succeed, Sedona, both by pledging to this campaign & coming into the lounge, then we build you a real stage intimate concert venue. Costs to be determined, though we already have architect, Dan Surber, & designers with plans in the works. That’s when we really become SYNERGY - food, music, lounge, art, the works - all in one. The ImpactBoosting Local Economy and Beyond Think of all your favorite products that improve your everyday - food, drink, herbals, beauty-care. All your favorite goods come from original creators who put their life’s energy into bringing it to you. SYNERGY is going to bring more of those favorites to you, to Sedona, and beyond. A commercial kitchen is legally required to ship out of state. So we are really launching platform, AKA an “incubator” kitchen - we handle all regulations, inspections, fees and insurance to maintain a commercial kitchen, which we then rent at an affordable price, so artisans can focus on what matters most to them - their craft. This will give the local economy a major boost! Just as Lulu’s is successfully expanding beyond Sedona out of this space, watch and see what comes of this - all the success of our collaborators. And you get first taste at the Lounge :) The ChallengesCity Compliance & Funding As we face some real rules & fees with the City of Sedona to do what really want to do (up to 10k sewer fee alone, and brand new, more expensive sign regulations), the biggest challenge we face is not getting enough start-up funding! If our beautiful Sedona community wants to see vital, local businesses succeed in our town, we all need to actively support them. No one wants to see a strip mall in West Sedona. Let’s keep it unique, and support amazing local businesses like Synergy, Chocolatree, Indian Gardens, Creekside, Local Juicery, Interdependence, and all your favorite Local Digs! We need community support right now, especially in the beginning, to create another amazing community space FOR YOU.ParkingSome people have said the parking lot is difficult to get into. Well we have a solution for that - sedonatakeout.com will bring the goods, drinks, Lulu’s Bliss Shakes and all our offerings right to you. front of building view at the current "Lulu's Chocolate Lounge"We have a lot to build on, and we start where we are and grow from here - just like Lulu's started out selling chocolate with an umbrellad push cart at California festivals, now look. Just like all your fav foods started in someone's home kitchen.With the support of those who enjoy it, we get there.Please pledge NOW - this is ONLY a 30 day campaign! Delaying means you might forget, so THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR TAKING ACTION NOW! The more you give, the more we can give you to love! This is How We Do ItOur Crew Julie Ayla Earthwalker - Kitchen Manager. Founder and Owner of conscioussedona.com - connecting the health-conscious with local, healthy businesses.Sierra Shafer, Project Leader. 3+ years experience working for Lulu in kitchen, front of house, as a manager, and as a traveling sales agent. Event Coordinator for Sedona Street Arts Festival and Gumption Street Arts Festivals. Musician. Community Connector.Tanya Marcy - Public Relations Specialist and event coordinator, an amazing connector in all things community.Mark Short - Marketing Master of Sedona Advertising AgencyJosh Lillis - Signage Guru at Sedona Sign Company Kitchen Members including Joshua Vailokaitis - Rawr Bakery; Karen Russell - Karen’s Gluten Free Living; Illup Granvegard- Ambrosia, Shaun Ndeanna - Sedona Takeout, Jeanette Richelson - Barbara’s Bundts, and Sarah Anne Lesslie of Chocolita, continuing with some of her chocolate production in the same space she has rented with Lulu for the past 4 years.Lulu's Chocolate - We have the continual support, in numerous ways, from Lulu’s Chocolate, for this campaign and beyond. Lulu will be shipping chocolate so we can keep all your favorite specialty line of Lulu's drinks on the menu.And... You! Join the Crew & Other Ways You can HelpIn just one month after announcing, 17+ community members have expressed sincere interest, which verifies that this space will fulfill a sincere need in the community of Sedona and beyond. We want to help these young businesses get their products out to you - please pledge!If you can’t support this campaign but you’d still like to see Synergy happen for Sedona, and for all our amazing kitchen renters, there are still ways you can help:Share this campaignUse the Indiegogo's share tools top right to post on social media. Especially forward to your email list, text message, and tell your friends about it! Thank you!Follow us on InstagramCurrently listed as “Luluschocolatelounge”Come into SynergyCurrently Lulu's Chocolate Lounge, come hang out in the lounge, take a coffee/tea break and try out the first round of goodies crafted in the kitchen. We are soft-launching SYNERGY first week of June, grand opening June 7th!Thank you so much for your support, in helping us to make an AMAZING space for YOU, for Sedona, all our amazing visitors, and all our kitchen cooperative members, who, with your help, are going to create so much success and goodness in the world. <3 <3 <3 Sedona visitors having a great time at the loungeSYNERGY Co-op Kitchen & Lounge supports SMALL, CREATIVE, LOCAL businesses with little to no capital, and gives a HUGE boost to these quality, healthy products, so they can find their way to you and beyond. And supports local Music. The more we raise with this campaign, the better we can be, the lower our kitchen rental cost, and the more you can see, taste, and enjoy!

story:
Short Summary

Hello! I am Cristina Drumm, the founder of Hygge in Savannah, Georgia. I moved to Savannah in 2013 to study at the Savannah College of Art & Design and fell in love with the city. Owning a brick and mortar shop has been a dream of mine since I was young. This year, I finally took the plunge and poured all of my love, time and savings into making it happen in the city I now call my home. 

The name Hygge, pronounced ‘hue-guh,’ is a Norweigan and Danish word for a feeling of coziness. The shop is a thoughtful curation of ethical and sustainable goods for the home, body and mind. I am often asked how the concept came together and the answer is simple; it was born out of a love for the things that bring us happiness and offer a sense of wellbeing. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

The money raised will be used for a shop sign, retail displays, shipping fees, and legal startup fees. The sweet perks are my way of saying thank you for your thoughtful contribution to reach my goal. The timing is such that you can even use your gift card redemptions on some holiday shopping!

 

The Impact

I believe that every piece we bring into our homes should have a purpose and should last a lifetime. I am committed to offering products that are friendly to our environment, ethically produced, one of a kind, and made by individuals who truly believe in their creations. Together, I believe we can create a more mindful approach to buying. 

 

Risks & Challenges

The inventory costs for the type of goods Hygge carries are high given the nature of production. The majority of the products have been purchased at more than the typical fifty percent (or more) discount offered at wholesale. Having a lower markup does not result in excessive profit when considering the expenses of rent, insurance, supplies, labor and taxes. While risky, I have poured all of my savings as well as taken out a loan because I truly believe in the makers, their wonderful products and the difference they are making in the industry.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you so much for considering making a donation. If you are unable to contribute at this time, spreading the word is greatly appreciated. If you are in the area, please come by and say hello!

story:
OUR STORY

Hi, my name is Aidan Miller, and I am the founder of Kwizera Coffee! Growing up in East Africa I witnessed the effects of poverty and unemployment in communities across Rwanda. Our team at Kwizera has a heart for marginalized people and a passion for coffee. Kwizera coffee exists to leverage the specialty coffee industry to provide for hope creation programs that fight sex trafficking and provide economic opportunity to vulnerable women and youth in Rwanda, East Africa! 

 

Kwizera coffee is a brand that is a continuation of our journey of using our passion for coffee to directly impact people’s lives. 'Kwizera' in Kinyarwanda (the language of Rwanda) means “hope” or “belief,” and above all we believe that we can use coffee as a means of hope creation and that coffee can be used to bring about greater change in this world. 

Kwizera initially started out of the dorm room that I shared with my friend Elijah Reeves. Together we sold coffee to our fellow residents and students on campus. With the help of the College of Business at Lipscomb University we started to develop the company and book ourselves for different events and corporate venues.  

As our bookings increased the future for our company seemed bright! When COVID - 19 hit we had a majority of our contracts canceled. Through the following months we iterated our model to selling coffee online to support food relief packages for people in Rwanda. Praying for an opportunity I was approached by my friend William Robertson  (Seen in the Video above^) and he  connected me to Rocketown. Our missions aligned so perfectly and we had the opportunity to build out a space in their building. 

We had a soft launch in October of 2020 but we still have a lot to do to create the space and impact that we have envisioned. I hope you can join our campaign and help us in supporting this vision! 

 

What does "Hope Creation" Mean? 

 

When we talk about "Hope Creation" we are referencing how our company helps to generate hope in peoples' lives through our partnerships and how we operate our supply chain.  Ten percent of all of our profits will be dedicated to supporting our partner organizations that fight sex trafficking and provide economic opportunity to vulnerable communities in Rwanda and throughout East Africa!

This funding will also allow us to achieve our goal of vertical integration with our coffee supply chain by the end of the year and begin to heavily invest with our nonprofit partners. We believe in 100% Transparency. We want you to know exactly who grew your coffee, who picked your coffee, what farm it came from, that they received above fair wages, and how Kwizera's involvement is changing peoples lives for the growth of God's Kingdom!

 

 

What We Need & What You Get!

Our goal for this campaign is to raise $40,000. These funds will be used to help us continue to operate and push into the spaces that we need to be in to create both our social and global economic impact.

There are still several renovations and additions that we need for our space.

 

 

If you want to support us you can do so by choosing a perk. Each perk offers a package of our products and merchandise!

 

 

Flint Global: 

We equip groups and individuals to build businesses that will have a positive impact on their families and communities. Through our ready-made, field-proven, and locally-adapted approaches, our partners grow profitable businesses in order to increase their personal household incomes and achieve their goals.

In the world of business incubators, we’re unconventional. Alongside our work with more traditional entrepreneurs in brick-and-mortar entrepreneurship centers, we also specialize in partnering with individuals often described as living in “extreme poverty,” or on less than $2 per day. Because we believe that lasting solutions come from local problem solvers, not foreign aid, we equip local people with the tools, connections, and resources to solve their own problems in ways that will last. 

Our role is simple: we equip people to ignite change in their own lives

https://flintglobal.org/ 

 

Peace House:

Peace House Ministries is dedicated to improving the lives of vulnerable women and children.  We have a passion to see those whose lives have been influenced by the ‘street’ experience healing through God’s Kingdom. 

We work with women between the ages of 15-25 who have either been sex trafficked from a very young age, who are currently involved in prostitution, or who are vulnerable to being so.  Most of the time, these girls have little education and no skills.  For a year, they come to our day center where they receive training in income-generating projects. They become part of a community of people who love and accept them, and they discover a different way of life and community through discovery Bible studies and life skill lessons.

We also work with "high risk" young men.  The boys have usually dropped out of school and have either abandoned or have been abandoned by their parents.  These boys participate in different programs designed to teach discipline, integrity, and creativity.  We work with them and their families to help get the boys back in school.  We also have a short-term transition house for those who are coming off the streets.  While the boys are in transition, we engage in “social work” with their families. We believe that broken families are the true source of the problem, NOT the boy or girl on the ‘street.’  As such, we seek to plant communities and build networks of others who are trying to turn around their lives.

https://at-network.org/peace-house/ 

Rocketown:

Founded by contemporary Christian music artist Michael W. Smith, Rocketown of Middle Tennessee is a faith-based youth outreach facility in the heart of downtown Nashville. Rocketown was founded in 1994 as a 501(c)3 Non-Profit organization, a "Public Benefit Corporation". Rocketown's mission is to offer hope to the next generation through Christ’s love. Their vision is to be the place of peace, purpose and possibilities for youth.

https://www.rocketown.org/about

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell as many people as possible about our campaign! You can use the Indiegogo share tools to easily do this! Share on Facebook, Twitter, e-mail, or any other way you can think of!

Come by and support us at the shop or buy a bag of coffee on our website (www.kwizeracoffee.com)

Thanks so much for taking the time to learn about Kwizera and helping make our dream a reality!

Other Ways You Can Help
Tell as many people as possible about our campaign! You can use the Indiegogo share tools to easily do this! Share on Facebook, Twitter, e-mail, or any other way you can think of!
Come by and support us at the shop or buy a bag of coffee on our website (www.kwizeracoffee.com)

story:
Short Summary

Earth + Ether is an educational and retail project birthed by Lindsey Granger on October 1st, 2019. With 6 years of Zero Waste research, 4 years of experience running a Bodywork private practice, and a hunger to hold space for her community, Lindsey trusted her instincts and signed a lease on a retail space in Amesbury, MA. 

The retail store stocks a wide variety of Zero Waste Consumables including; Butters, Carrier Oils, Clays, Essential Oils, Herbs, Salts, Seeds, Spices, Waxes and Zero Waste Reusables in 4 categories; Personal Care, Cleaning, Food prep & Storage, School & Office Supplies

The Healing Arts Co-op features 3 Session Spaces available for rent on an as needed basis for 1-1 practitioners in a variety of industries which creates a coworking space for practitioners interested in practicing outside of their homes, but not quite in their very own rented office.  

What We Need & What You Get

We need capital to:

  • Order inventory in quantities that keep the unit cost low, so I can pass that savings on to my customers
  • Order retail display furniture, a Point of Sale system, and make sure the treatment spaces are ready to support any practitioner seeking to practice.
  • Cover rent, utilities, insurance, website, etc. expenses

You get:

  • To support a Zero Waste Business and help it thrive
  • A feature on the Thank Yous page of the website
  • Valuable perks normally reserved for Patreon Subscribers

The Impact

This store will provide a comprehensive shopping experience to brand new and veteran Zero Wasters alike, and provide access to hard-to-find bulk products, expanding awareness and making it that much easier for people to live a zero waste lifestyle.

Risks & Challenges

The largest challenge I forsee, which is remedied by this crowdfunding campaign, is that folks will be interested in my shop before it has all the products their interested in. I worry about losing my locally interested customers to the internet available products. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share share share! 

We also have a Patreon, ideal for people looking to support the shop and all of it's projects on a continued basis: https://www.patreon.com/earthandether

story:
Dashi Needs Your Help!

We've been in business 5 years now, and this has been the toughest period we've ever faced.  Coming out of winter we felt as if we'd hit our stride in the restaurant, the food truck was going out again, we'd expanded our base of loyal customers and we were growing.  Spring was looking good!   Then it all came to a screeching halt as part of the COVID-19 crisis.  

Although we remain open, we have cut back to a skeleton crew.  We are offering only takeout and delivery via the restaurant and most of our food truck services have cancelled.  This leaves enough to keep our heads above water (for now) and we are scrambling to continue going for as long as we can, but we are all facing a crisis of unknown duration and magnitude.

Accordingly, we need your help!  We are committed to keeping our core staff intact for as long as we can so that we can resume normal operations quickly once we get through this crisis.  In order to do so, we are asking you to pre-purchase activities and events (called perks) with Dashi (at a discount!).  Doing so will provide us with much needed additional cashflow during this time, and will enable you to lock in an experience with us once we put all of this behind us and are ready to celebrate!

So, please browse the perks available and make plans to enjoy happier times with us.  Your support means the world to us!  

And, even if you decide you can't spend now on one of these experiences (this is tough on all of us), please spread the word, share this campaign, stop by the restaurant and food truck, and support other local restaurants, breweries, farmers and other small businesses!

story:
What is this?

  • First off, we are The Mouse Merch Box! We work with Disney and their licensees to bring the most magical subscription box to your doorstep!
  • We are now creating a pet box because most people have a pet and your pet needs magic just like you!
  • Every backer will help us achieve a dream that we have been working on for a long time! Your help creates magic for us, so we can create magic for you!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Here is a bit of a break down:

  • We need at least $6000.00 to help us get everything lined up for this box (product, boxes, etc.)
  • If you are a backer, you will be added to our list of High Priority guest! This means you will get some extra magic in your box for your fur baby!
  • If we were to not reach out entire goal, the funds we do raise will go to help as much as we can for this box!

 

The Magic

We want to provide magic to your fur baby like we provide for our little fur baby at our home! Here are some ways that we can do that for your fur baby!

  • This is something amazing that we want to share with the world! Everyone including the fur babies need magic!
  • Think about Bark Box, this will be like that but magical!
  • We can promise you that your fur baby will love everything they get!
  • We are also looking for an animal charity to partner with to donate 10% of all sales to every month! Please send us some of the best ones you know!

 

A Little Cautious?

You may be a little cautious so here are some reasons you can trust us!

  • We are working with Disney on this. We also do a Disney subscription box for humans! The product is in good hands ;)
  • The main challenge we face is just having enough product for all of you!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that you can't all contribute to this fund and we understand that. Here are a few other ways you can help:

  • Share this on your personal accounts (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.)
  • You can also use the share tools in Indiegogo so you can share right away!

story:
Short Summary

In September 2018 we were able to secure and open our first restaurant "Casa Indigo" in the Pilsen neighborhood in Chicago.  Casa Indigo is a affordable all day type cafe with great coffee, lunch and dinner.  Our menu's soul comes from Mexico City, where our mother Suzanna is from and has taught us her families recipes.  We try and serve unique dishes only found at our restaurant.  Our tortillas are hand made everyday by our Mother from organic Oaxacan heirloom corn that we purchase from a local tortilla maker El Popo.  Our menu is focused on buying local, wild, and sustainable goods.  Our chicken comes from 3 local farms, our beef comes from Slagel Family Farm, all our seafood is wild and or sustainable, and almost everything else in the menu is local or organic when possible.  We serve high quality ingredients with affordable prices so everyone in our neighborhood can enjoy.  With our quality and affordability at the top of our business plan, we hope it allows for all people in our diverse neighborhood to come and try new food, meet new people, start new conversations, and etc.  We offer all our employees liveable wages, health insurance, and daily tips passed out to all employees. 

Rebel Owl company was created in the Pilsen neighborhood in Chicago. We use many local business' everyday that make a direct social and economic impact in our community. We've established direct relationships with many local farmers which allows them to keep more revenue while allowing us to offer high quality unique menu in our neighborhood at a reasonable price. This project was founded by lifelong Pilsen residents Mer Mansuria and Carolina Landeros-Mansuria.  Here are some articles and reviews from the Chicago Tribune, and Eater Chicago:

https://www.chicagotribune.com/dining/ct-food-r...

https://www.chicagotribune.com/dining/foodfocus...

https://chicago.eater.com/maps/best-chicken-win...

What We Need & What You Get

Our dream was to open a restaurant in our own neighborhood with food that is not served by any other restaurant in the area. We secured a location and a small investment from family and friends.  Once we started building our restaurant, we had a lot of unexpected expenses and expensive demands from the city of Chicago and health department.  Shortly after opening while preparing for a large catering order, our car was stolen from in front of the restaurant.  We had over $3000 of all our Japanese knives, supplies, equipment, and food stolen(car was found slightly damaged 2 months later).  With some unexpected costs and we had gone a lot deeper into our life savings to keep the restaurant running.  All our employees are from the neighborhood, and our focus is to make our neighborhood thrive through meeting places and great food. We want to increase our hours, increase our menu, add more employees, and be able to provide livable wages and health insurance for the entire staff.

We were hoping to secure a grant from FedEx of up to $50,000 but we did not place in the top 10. However, our business at Casa Indigo is on the rise, and we have gotten great reviews on all our media outlets.  We are now preparing for a busy Summer patio season as well as street festivals for which we will have to purchase equipment and a license.  Busy Patio and street festival season will greatly increase our sales.

We are very close to achieving our goals but but we need your help to raise the money to cover the gap in funding. In return we will offer an array of perks including a large bottle of our habanero hot sauce and our exclusive Indigo Pilsen T-shirt created by Definitive Selection only for us.  Here is what your donations will allow us to complete:

$10,000

By helping us raise $10,000 you will help us purchase equipment or invest in more retail space that was removed from the budget due to not receiving the FedEx grant.

Increase hours, add more employees, add to menu

Wood-fired Grill

Equipment for All Street festivals

License completion for street festivals and outdoor space.

Apply for the permit for the adjacent land next to our restaurant and reserve it for gardening and al fresco dining

Commissary and Test Kitchen for our growing catering operations and other concepts, space close to our restaurant on 18th St.

Outdoor Patio build-out

Japanese Knives that were stolen when our catering car got stolen

$15,000

With $15,000, we will be able to cover our cash requirements for working capital until we hit our break-even point and allow us to fund the following:

Living wage salaries/health insurance for owners Chef Mer and the entire kitchen staff

Apply for liquor license, cannabis license research, and outdoor spaces in the city.

Gardening and Green space investment around neighborhood with fresh vegetables and herbs

Marketing

Rainy day fund

$20,000

Anything raised above $20,000 will go towards building, researching, and acquire more property or retail space, learning how to get into the legal cannabis business to create more local jobs, invest into rent control and affordable housing initiatives, 50-seat outdoor garden space free to the public and for rent, and build out our research and catering kitchen.   Currently, the neighborhood lacks these places where people can gather for events, culture, music, and the arts for free. We hope to provide the space where people could create, discuss ideas and share their talents with the community. We want to inspire that anything is possible.

 

The Impact

The Rebel Owl company and Casa Indigo restaurant mission is to have a direct social and economic impact in our Pilsen neighborhood.  The Rebel Owl company will create better paying culinary or hospitality jobs, increase business to business sales within our communities, help bridge the gap between entrepreneurship opportunities and the local residents.

Both Mer and Carolina are natives of the Pilsen neighborhood and we have a long track record of service in the community. Carolina helped create and run "we are hip hop" a program which is still running to this day.  Casa Indigo has donated food to numerous local non profit organizations, and food for the homeless in our neighborhood.  During the Polar Vortex of 2019, Casa Indigo donated 200 servings of hot oatmeal to the less fortunate.  

That is why we understand the importance of doing this as a community. With your help, Rebel Owl company and Casa Indigo can:

Provide new taxable revenue into the local economy

Purchase from local urban farms and small businesses

Promote sustainability practices

Hire locally

Offer entrepreneurship training and support and work together to learn about the Cannabis industry

Help fund current initiatives that are working to yield high social and economic returns

Additionally, we hope to create a large yearly music festival on 18th St. and use that platform to help fund local initiatives and community interest.

Risks & Challenges

Chef Mer and Carolina have worked with some of the best restaurants and chefs in the world as well as local restaurants.  With multiple michelin starred restaurants and chefs, and over 15 years of experience in the industry.  Our families have lived in the Pilsen neighborhood for over 20 years.  We know there is a lot of hard work ahead of us, but we are eager and willing to get started and follow through.

Other Ways You Can Help

Like what Rebel Owl company and Casa Indigo are doing but can't make a contribution right now but would still like to help in other ways? Not a problem! You can like us on Facebook, and follow us on Instagram, Pinterest and Snapchat. You can also share this link on your social media networks, via email and through text; talk to your family, friends and neighbors and encourage them to support our cause.  We thank everyone for believing in our honest goals and colorful dreams!!!  Tip well and pay cash :) Thank you to everyone, Gracias!!!

story:
But first, why?

Paddle Park was born on a beautiful summer day kayaking on the shores of Lake Erie with my son.  We asked the question, "Why don't we do this more often?" That continued with "What if we could kayak indoors when the weather outside sucks?"

Over the ensuing time that we took to develop the concept of creating a first-of-its-kind indoor paddle sport facility, we learned from paddlers both novice and experienced, as well as those without any paddling experience. The resounding feedback was positive and accepting of creating a facility that allows for educational, therapeutic, physical fitness and entertainment elements suitable for a wide audience of users.

In creating Paddle Park, we want it to be all of these things and a bit more. Providing educational access to disadvantaged kids as well as therapeutic access for those with special needs, we decided to make Paddle Park a social enterprise to meet the needs of these communities. We hope you'll support our mission!

 

What We Need & What You Get

To create our first pilot facility, which we are targeting at about a 10,000 square foot size with two pool, locker rooms and a small event space, we seek to raise $100,000. This will cover the cost to rent a warehouse/industrial type space and retrofit it with the necessary equipment we need to get going.

Here's the quick breakdown:

  • Pools and plumbing: $25,000
  • Projectors, screens and computers: $20,000
  • Watercraft: $10,000
  • General buildout including decking, racks, event space, lockers: $20,000
  • Facility Lease downpayment: $10,000
  • Signage, licenses, insurance: $5,000
  • Indiegogo fees and perk fulfillment: $10,000

We've created some pretty awesome perks where you can get some cool Paddle Park swag, pre-order park time and unlimited use memberships, sponsor educational access for our Kayak Kids program, attend our preview night party, or autograph a permanent art installation at the park. The support/perk levels were carefully crafted to provide you with a great value while allowing us to raise the funds needed to be able to fulfill our promise.

Our stretch goals will allow us to do a little bit more at our first facility. If we raise $150,000 we will be able to add in a retail shop along with a food and beverage center. With $175,000 we'll add in a Pooch Paddle area where you can bring your four-legged friends to swim. And if we make it all the way to $250,000 we will lease a bigger space and add in a fourth pool with pumps powerful enough to recreate some whitewater experiences.

If, by chance, we don't meet our campaign goal here, we will fundraise privately to make up the difference and get Paddle Park built.  Trust us, we want this to come to fruition as much as our followers and supporters do!

 

The Impact

Paddle Park has been carefully structured and designed to be an all-inclusive and highly unique destination that also does good for its community and will serve to enhance Columbus' image and reputation for being a sports/athletic and entertainment destination.

We aim to fill the void of indoor sports and activities by building the first immersive paddle sport facility, that recreates water current and entertaining visuals of the outdoors, all within a climate controlled and secure environment.  The educational opportunities, along with the fitness and entertainment ones are boundless as we have discovered in researching this concept, but we need the financial backing of the paddle sport community to make Paddle Park a reality in order to meet these opportunities.

This project was not sketched out on a napkin last month. In fact, it has taken several years of planned development to get to this point, including market and consumer research, legal navigation, and the building of partnerships with stakeholders in the community. These partnerships include the American Kayaking Association, Adaptive Sports Connection, LifeSports OSU, A Kid Again, Hero USA, Special Olympics and more.

Our ultimate goal is to provide educational, therapeutic, fitness and entertainment access to people of all ages, skills and abilities. For the first-time paddler too fearful of going out on an open body of water, Paddle Park will provide that safe learning environment to get comfortable with a watercraft. For the novice that enjoys the challenge of SUP yoga but is limited to fair weather conditions, Paddle Park will serve that need no matter the weather outdoors.  And for the pro paddler who just wants to sneak in a lunch-break fitness session to stay in top form, Paddle Park will do just that for them.

Beyond that, Paddle Park will allow for fun teambuilding and group outings, party rentals, date  night fun, and probably some things we haven't even thought of yet.  This is a groundbreaking project that, given the chance, can be a transformative experience for many.

 

Risks & Challenges

Resiliency is the hallmark of an entrepreneur, as is remaining adaptable to circumstances beyond ones control.  These are the things I've learned the most having been a small business owner for the past 18 years.  I've also learned that I don't know what I don't know.  In creating Paddle Park I asked many questions of many people and have learned a lot about the paddle sport community. It is our pledge to all of our supporters that Paddle Park will provide a space for ALL people to enjoy paddle sports in a safe and secure environment.

The biggest challenges we foresee is the actual process of securing a facility and building it out.  But with a solid professional contact list and the partnerships we have already developed here in Central Ohio, we'll rally the community to get it done on time and on budget.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Whatever you can do to help us here is wonderful and so truly appreciated. Whether you grab a few perks or not, we ask for you to help us spread the word about our fundraising campaign and how making Paddle Park a reality will benefit our community.

Please use the share tool on our campaign page and post to your social media.  Feel free to copy any of these lines for your post:

 

"I support Paddle Park and their mission to create the first indoor paddle sport facility that creates an immersive paddling environment. Check out their campaign on Indiegogo."

 

"Paddle sports should be experienced by people of all ages, skills and abilities, and that's just the mission that Paddle Park is setting out to meet in central Ohio. They're raising funds on Indiegogo and I encourage you to support them (as I do)."

 

"Hey fellow paddlers, check out Paddle Park on Indiegogo. They're a new social enterprise raising funds to build a paddle sport facility that will allow for fitness, education and entertainment."

It is our pledge to all of our supporters that Paddle Park will provide a space for ALL people to enjoy paddle sports in a safe and secure environment.
The biggest challenges we foresee is the actual process of securing a facility and building it out.  But with a solid professional contact list and the partnerships we have already developed here in Central Ohio, we'll rally the community to get it done on time and on budget.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Whatever you can do to help us here is wonderful and so truly appreciated. Whether you grab a few perks or not, we ask for you to help us spread the word about our fundraising campaign and how making Paddle Park a reality will benefit our community.
Please use the share tool on our campaign page and post to your social media.  Feel free to copy any of these lines for your post:
 
"I support Paddle Park and their mission to create the first indoor paddle sport facility that creates an immersive paddling environment. Check out their campaign on Indiegogo."
 
"Paddle sports should be experienced by people of all ages, skills and abilities, and that's just the mission that Paddle Park is setting out to meet in central Ohio. They're raising funds on Indiegogo and I encourage you to support them (as I do)."
 
"Hey fellow paddlers, check out Paddle Park on Indiegogo. They're a new social enterprise raising funds to build a paddle sport facility that will allow for fitness, education and entertainment."

story:
Summary

 

Wandering Deli- Dairy Free is a unique vegan cheese company in Toronto, ON, helmed by Kira Lancaster. We specialize in nut cheeses that embrace the idea that if you wander from dairy, there is a path of truly rewarding delights awaiting you. After years of vegan cheese experimenting, and working in Toronto restaurants, Kira was being asked to make delicious nut cheeses for every occasion by friends and family, and as word spread she extended her cheese endeavours to a 'secret' vegan cheese club that was quickly featured in The Toronto Star, The Globe and Mail, Toronto Life, and various blogs! Needless to say, the secret was out, and she started renting kitchen space generously offered by Easy Restaurant in Parkdale. Running a special order vegan cheese company allowed for vegan cheese creativity to flourish, and we have offered over 40 different vegan cheeses, including the favourites that Wandering Deli offers at farmers markets today. 

This year, 2019, Wandering Deli has transitioned it's reach to farmers markets and the response has been overwhelmingly positive! Kira's husband, Cailean Lewis, has joined the company full time and we are overjoyed to be meeting new folks who love what we do on a constant basis. Something we are often asked at farmers markets is 'where else can I buy this? do you have a storefront?"  and that is where this campaign comes in!

We have been offered the downright incredible opportunity to renovate our current production space at Easy Restaurant into Toronto's first bonafide vegan cheese shop! As a small family company, this is huge! A shop would mean we would be able to continue to offer a wide variety of cheeses that truly 'wanders' from the expectation of what 'cheese' or 'dairy' or even 'vegan food' should be. Most large city's have vegan cheese shops popping up, and it would be a true honour to continue this path in our beloved community.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are so ready to bring this cheese shop to Toronto! We have the space, the team, the oodles of recipes, the awesome clientele, but we need some renovations and equipment:

Your support will help us:

-put a new entrance door on at Easy, just for us ($3000+)

-buy some new kitchen equipment to scale up ($6000+)

-put in a new sink ($700)

-purchase larger quantities of supplies (variable)

-and generally get our space customer ready ($2500+)

 

In return for your support, we are offering some no-thing-else quite like it perks, like our cheese itself, of course, as well as unique platters- go special occasion with something for two or get lavish and have us craft a whole table for a party! Take a vegan cheese making class with friends, book a private cheese maker consult for yourself (via skype or in person), check out a zine that will have you well on your way to being a vegan cheese platter afficianado, there's something that suits any vegan cheese lover. We are passionate about what we do, and every chance we have to show our gratitude through food is one we will truly celebrate.

If we don't quite reach our goal, we still intend to undertake this project, it will simply be a little slower. If fully funded, we could potentially open our doors in a matter of months, if not, a little longer as we tackle things piece by piece, or wedge by wedge, if you will.

The Impact

Funding this project not only blossoms a small family business, it rewards the loving community that has supported us along the way. Kira has been wildly lucky on her wandering path to meet so many people who truly love and support not only vegan cheese, but small local business. She's seen Wandering deli (in all it's forms) grow from a facebook group to a family business. This opportunity comes out of years of hard work, but also years of generous folks believing in us. Toronto is a city where it is becoming increasingly cost-prohibitive for companies like ours to find space to get started, and it cannot be understated that the owner of Easy Restaurant is truly putting his faith in community and small-scale entrepreneurial gumption when he offers us this chance. Supporting our dream sends the message that he is doing a great thing! 

It's time for Toronto not only to have an artisan vegan cheese shop, but a small business that truly is something the whole community can celebrate.

Risks & Challenges

There will certainly be challenges, especially if scaling up quickly takes place, but years of honing recipes and working in the food and hospitality industry have Kira and Cailean honed and familiar with tackling the work of a busy food establishment.

The main risks presented are timeline, as it is dependent on funds raised. We intend to do everything as quickly as we can, but currently this is campaign dependent!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to contribute financially, please spread the word! Tell folks about this campaign on whatever platforms you use, this is incredibly valuble! Indiegogo has some built in share tools, so they can help you out there;)

story:
LET'S MAKE THIS HAPPEN!

It's been four amazing years of burning rubber, creating amazing food, knocking on doors and introducing Hampton Roads Virginia to the food truck culture called Eat The Streets 757! Everyday new mobile chefs are joining in creating their dreams on a plate, and serving the community. Busting myths about "roach coaches" & carnival food. Pushing the barriers & exceeding expectations. Full of passion and pride and excelling at their craft! Our Goal is simple - to give local food trucks & artisans a place to serve on a regular basis, while building & expanding the food truck culture to residents & tourists right at the resort area of Virginia Beach Virginia.  Welcome to - THE HUB!

  • Eat The Streets 757 is owned by 3 passionate ground breakers for the food truck movement in Hampton Roads. We  have been serving our 7 cities for over 4 years with our own food trucks while working hard at building a brand with a solid reputation working with major companies as well as locals and foodie fans. Known for working with, not against, our fellow food truckers and maintaining a professional attitude & exceptional customer service. We have created food truck meet ups and rodeos for the area so everyone can experience the amazing food that our local mobile chefs have to offer! In the process we have  been able to help bring awareness of food trucks to our community. Our purpose has been to fill trucks calendars and schedules, as well as help hosts offer gourmet food at their events with ease .

  • Everyday is a new experience! It is a challenge and a joy to share your passion each and everyday as an entrepreneur. Walking the tight rope and making the sacrifices to keep it rolling!  Many trucks open, but close very quickly seeing their dreams crushed, not able to navigate the zoning, rules and regulations, or  just not able to develop a calendar of successful locations to serve. Hampton Roads is ready for a cultural HUB of local businesses! 

  • That's where the HUB will come into play & we are asking for your help! The Hub will be a central location for gatherings of local artisans, food trucks, pop ups, craft brews and musicians to share with the community! The HUB will offer an exciting destination location that is family friendly for tourists and locals alike!

  • What We Need & What You Get

Breaking it down in more detail:

  • We are asking for $18,000 for Phase 1 startup costs.
  • Phase 1 includes: build-out of beer garden/bar, city and state fees, ABC license, picnic tables and umbrellas, lighting, sound system, gazebo for VIP Cabana area. Although we are in phase 1, we want the HUB to be professionally done with pride and class. The first of it's kind in the whole state of VA- there are many hoops to jump through, but with local support and backing we can do this!
  • This idea is built with YOU in mind- it is by the locals for the locals. the HUB is not only going to be an amazing experience and a fun new place to hang out but it is a door-opener for all small locally owned businesses. We want everyone to benefit from the HUB.
  • 100% of the funds collected will go towards any and all costs associated with Phase 1 buildout. 
  • Perks- anyone who donates will be invited to a special kick-off party at the HUB! First 25 $50 dollar donation- free meal at Sofrito or Malbon's BBQ The Flying Pig! Anyone who donates $500 will receive a THANK YOU package which will include merchandise, a free meal for 2 and a couple drinks- on us. Anyone who donates $1000 or more will receive a THANK YOU package which will include merchandise, a free meal for 4 and a couple of drinks- on us! 

The Impact

of your contribution will make:

  • Your contribution will not only mean you support the HUB but it means you support ALL small and locally owned businesses. 
  • Your contribution helps open doors for all types of local businesses, as the HUB will give these businesses a place to thrive!
  • Your contribution will prove that a grassroots campaign can really make a positive impact on the community!
  • ETS757 has been a grassroots marketing campaign from the very beginning, pioneering the food truck culture in Hampton Roads- please visit our website to see some of the companies we have partnered, contracted and/or worked with, all 7 cities are represented. 
  • The time is now! THIS CAN REALLY HAPPEN! We have been working so hard to open these doors and we are so close we can taste it- all that local food and beer ;) .

Risks & Challenges

We will be busting our butts to get this build-out and set up done in a months time to open May 29!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please spread the word- tag your friends, family! Share our posts and join in on the discussion! 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

THANK YOU!!!!

story:
Hello,

Welcome to "La Vie en Rose" Food Truck Crowd Funding Campaign. 

Bienvenue à mes amis et membres de famille outre-Atlantique.

Delicious, simple, healthy food. My mom's is an authentic French "Cordon Bleu" and as far back as I can remember was cooking amazing dishes for our family and friends. She got em hooked on delicious food. She's the reason I am so passionate about cooking and want to bring the same dishes to our community.

Great food means smiles, laughter and happiness.  Chefs like me do what we do  not only to satisfy your hunger,  but to feed your senses and your soul. It's a lot of love embedded in a bunch of ingredients and cooked together :-)
I have been working as a Chef  in different restaurants for a long time now. Today my family and I have the chance to start our own business. We have a gorgeous  remodeled school bus which is now a food truck compliant with the Health Department regulations. Obviously we are working on a (very) tight budget. We are doing a lot of the work ourselves and also with the help of some good friends and family members very enthusiast about this project (Thanks Benoit, Greg, Olivier, Spike, Anthony we love you ;-) )
We are almost ready to hit the road. We want to share those special moments  people love to celebrate with great food, which will be ideally completed by eating an authentic French crêpe just as French people have been doing for centuries.
We have a couple of jobs left to finish before we be part of your lives.
If you feel like this project is exciting, fun as we think it is then please contribute any the way you can. Every dollar is highly appreciated and counts a lot. If you can't, please share this campaign with your friends and relatives any way you can. 

Thanks for Watching/Contributing/Sharing ! 
La Vie en Rose - Food Truck Team...

story:
Welcome! 

This is a document composed by all the members of this community, in an effort to share our collective vision for the next year (April 2015-April 2016). We have witnessed, and been humbled by, the dream into which we see this community giving breath, and we are excited to bring you into what is rising up from our journey in this space. We would love for you to contribute to our vision in any way you can, even if it's just sharing this page with your friends and family.

Vision: 

We see this center as a catalyst for cultural renewance, integration of interdependence, and spiritual activism. A home for spiritual warriors who are dedicated to living out a lifestyle embodying fieriness, aliveness, and loving kindness. We see this community as a microcosm of what is possible in the world when people bring the fullness of their being into community. We see this place as a hub of revitalization and a launch bay to carry people closer to what it means to serve Life. 

Our passion is re-kindling the inner flame: That people can show up with their full sense of power in the world, and actualize their gifts to wholly project themselves into a living process of global transformation. We are actively co-creating a culture that amplifies the essential Self of each community member, so we are deeply conscious participants in the living process of a world recreated.  


 Action Plan for the coming year:


1.) Sustaining a team of facilitators who offer Nonviolent Communication (NVC) learning spaces at Clallam Bay Correctional Center.  This team will be composed of people living within this intentional community. With the hope:

  • That this community directly harvests from supporting consciousness in the prison system, so that it has a direct influence on the flourishing of our unique culture.
  • So that community members can collectively receive the spiritual development that takes place from grounding and holding spaces that are rich with conflict and emotional and spiritual pain.
  • To co-create a community of people embodying this consciousness within the prison, and to build support systems and create resources for inmates, so this practice can be sustained there.

2.) We are in the process of bringing maximum power to our community by cross-pollinating with other visionaries and integrating ourselves into other organizations or projects we see as in line with our vision.

  • This fall, we are planning to initiate a prototype for direct action, which we call the Meta-Response Force, which involves a team of community members who are willing to travel to areas of conflict or social struggle around the US to help create systems to sustain NVC consciousness in those spaces. This community would sustain the Meta-Response Force as a continuous practice.
  • Our hope is to bring most of our community to NVC family camps in Seattle and Wisconsin this summer to co- create radical ways of being in fellowship with others.
  • Members plan to continuously participate in the NVC community and the Theatre of the Oppressed movement in the Seattle area, to support learning and growth of these practices in our region and smaller community.


3.) Expansion of food growth, utilizing permaculture design and alternative farming techniques to support community members and bring radical change to food production and holistic land stewardship:

  •  Construct fencing to protect gardening areas from damage from  both goats and other native browsers
  • Construct a number of new raised beds with hoop houses, expand garden space utilizing permaculture design and other alternative organic farming techniques, construct hoop houses for prolonged harvests.
  • Develop a gardening calendar, including a working project list, to assist with improving food yield and giving direction for those interested in food production.

-  In addition, create a calendar of harvests for foods and medicinals that are growing wild on the land. This document would support a broader and more accessible knowledge of land resources available to community members, as well as assist in aspects of food security.

  • Using wild and cultivated specimens of fungi, establish patches for the cultivation of edible and medicinal mushrooms, as well as utilizing fungi for permaculture techniques in garden beds.


4.) Developing housing and movement space this summer on the land to help bring more visitors and members into our community, as well as to provide open indoor areas.

  • Helping two new community members build a straw-bale tiny house on the land.
  • Building a bunkhouse that can provide comfortable living space for up to four addition visitors.

5.) Maintain a team of doulas who serve moms and families in Forks and surrounding areas on a volunteer basis.

  • Providing compassionate support during pregnancy, birth and postpartum period to contribute to empowered child bearing experiences, provide advocacy and preserve birth stories. 

What your monetary contributions will be directly supporting:

-  Acquiring mycelium cultures for the gardens and purchase equipment for developing  mushroom growth

-  Gasoline for running equipment on the land (chainsaw, wood chipper, generator)

-  Transportation cost for traveling (to nearby prisons, NVC Family Camps, areas of conflict, to birthing mommies, gathering materials for building projects, Theater of the Oppressed facilitation trainings, and to the Peninsula Dispute Resolution Center)

-  Purchasing of resources/books for building the Clallam Bay Correctional Center NVC community

-  Materials for building projects including: local and reclaimed lumber, local straw bales, energy efficient construction materials

-  Materials for garden expansion including: soil amendments, reclaimed lumber for container gardening, materials for constructing hoop houses, materials for raised beds, and seed and transplants for initial planting

-  Gifting (monetarily) to other communities we see aligned with our vision


Other ways you can contribute to our community (non-monetary):

-  Visit our community! Or ask about how you can join.

-  Volunteer with us at Clallam Bay Correctional Center or join our Theatre of the Oppressed Ensemble, based out of the city of Forks.

-  Help us establish connection/network with others who you see in alignment with our vision (especially those regionally near us)

-  Ask about our community resource list, which contains an on-going list of material/equipment we are looking to get ahold of to support our projects (e.g. metal roofing, books, loads of gravel, tools)

-  Share with us techniques, plant varieties, or general gardening tips that work for our unique temperate rainforest climate

 Construct fencing to protect gardening areas from
     damage from  both goats and other native browsers


Construct a number of new raised beds with hoop houses,
     expand garden space utilizing permaculture design and other alternative
     organic farming techniques, construct hoop houses for prolonged harvests.


Develop a gardening calendar, including a working
     project list, to assist with improving food yield and giving direction for
     those interested in food production.

- 
In addition, create a
calendar of harvests for foods and medicinals that are growing wild on the
land. This document would support a broader and more accessible knowledge of
land resources available to community members, as well as assist in aspects of
food security.

Using wild and cultivated specimens of fungi, establish
     patches for the cultivation of edible and medicinal mushrooms, as well as
     utilizing fungi for permaculture techniques in garden beds.




4.) Developing housing
and movement space this summer on the land to help bring more visitors and
members into our community, as well as to provide open indoor areas.

Helping two new community members build a straw-bale
     tiny house on the land.


Building a bunkhouse that can provide comfortable
     living space for up to four addition visitors.

5.) Maintain a team of
doulas who serve moms and families in Forks and surrounding areas on a
volunteer basis.

Providing compassionate support during pregnancy, birth
     and postpartum period to contribute to empowered child bearing
     experiences, provide advocacy and preserve birth stories. 

What your monetary
contributions will be directly supporting:
- 
Acquiring
mycelium cultures for the gardens and purchase equipment for developing  mushroom growth
- 
Gasoline
for running equipment on the land (chainsaw, wood chipper, generator)
- 
Transportation
cost for traveling (to nearby prisons, NVC Family Camps, areas of conflict, to
birthing mommies, gathering materials for building projects, Theater of the
Oppressed facilitation trainings, and to the Peninsula Dispute Resolution Center)-  Purchasing of resources/books for building the Clallam Bay Correctional Center NVC community
- 
Materials
for building projects including: local and reclaimed lumber, local straw bales, energy efficient construction materials-  Materials for garden expansion including: soil amendments, reclaimed lumber for container gardening, materials for constructing hoop houses, materials for raised beds, and seed and transplants for initial planting
- 
Gifting
(monetarily) to other communities we see aligned with our vision
Other
ways you can contribute to our community (non-monetary):
- 
Visit
our community! Or ask about how you can join.
- 
Volunteer
with us at Clallam Bay Correctional Center or join our Theatre of the Oppressed
Ensemble, based out of the city of Forks.
- 
Help
us establish connection/network with others who you see in alignment with our
vision (especially those regionally near us)
- 
Ask
about our community resource list, which contains an on-going list of
material/equipment we are looking to get ahold of to support our projects (e.g.
metal roofing, books, loads of gravel, tools)-  Share with us techniques, plant varieties, or general gardening tips that work for our unique temperate rainforest climate

story:
Please help the Slovak devotees in Bratislava

(prosím pomôžte slovenským oddaným v Bratislave)

ISKCON has been active in Slovakia for more than 15 years, but during this time the devotees have spread Krishna Consciousness without a center in capital city Bratislava of their own. 

(ISKCON je aktívnym na Slovensku už viac ako 15 rokov, ale za ten čas oddaní šírili Krišna vedomie bez vlastného centra - chrámu v hlavnom meste Bratislava)

The people of Slovakia have shown a great appreciation for Srila Prabhupada’s books, especially his teaching of simple living and high thinking. Young people of the country are particularly attracted, and make up most of the community. Although without significant financial resources, they are known for their enthusiasm to give Krishna Consciousness to their fellow countrymen.

(Ľudia na Slovensku veľmi ocenili knihy Šrílu Prabhupádu, najmä jeho učenie jednoduchého života a hlbokého myslenia. Predovšetkým sú priťahovaní mladí ľudia a tvoria väčšinu komunity. Aj keď bez významných finančných prostriedkov, sú známi pre ich nadšenie predať vedomie Krišnu svojim krajanom.)

We found new place which is quite suitable for our use, but we need Your help

(Našli sme nové miesto, ktoré je vhodné pre naše použitie, ale potrebujeme Vašu pomoc)


This congregation of mainly young men and women have limited resources, as many of the congregation are students. There is a small but dedicated Sankirtan party that makes collections and a small Indian community that provides some support.

(Táto kongregácia je tvorená  mladými mužmi a ženami s obmedzenými zdrojmi príjmu, tiež je v kongregácii veľa študentov. Určitou podporou je malá ale odovzdaná sankírtanová skupina, ktorá kolektuje a malá indická komunita.)

Before this crowdfunding campaign we sold the land in Bratislava towards the goal of purchasing the property.

(Pred vytvorením tejto zbierky sme predali pozemok v Bratislave aby sme sa priblížili k získaniu tohto domu)

We are very grateful for the support that has come in. We Slovak devotees in Bratislava have been content with whatever facility Krishna has given, but this is a great opportunity to offer Srila Prabhupada a suitable and permanent place in Bratislava. We are very grateful for any donation, big or small, towards this end. 

(Sme veľmi vďační za podporu, ktorá prichádza. Sme v Bratislave spokojní s akoukoľvek možnosťou, ktorú nám Krišna dáva, ale toto je obrovská príležitosť ponúknuť Šrílovi Prabhupádovi vhodné a stále miesto v Bratislave. Sme veľmi vďační za akýkoľvek príspevok, veľký alebo malý poskytnutý v tomto smere.)

Please consider becoming part of this opportunity by clicking the “Contribute now” button today.

(Prosím zvážte možnosť stať sa súčasťou tejto kampane kliknutím na tlačidlo "prispieť teraz/Contribute now" už dnes i Vy.)
