story:
We have 7 more days.

We have 7 more days remaining.  

As of today 1,119 interested, although shy, people visit who wanted to contribute but without activity that they could see they left the site without contributing.  

Please help us create activity, however much please contribute something and then share the site with those whom you respect and know appreciate the need to reforest.  

Our product is a healthcare supplement made from the leaves of a nutritious tree.  When we plant more the farmers earn and in-turn plant more and the cycle repeats itself.  

Your contributions help this cycle to repeat. 

Please help us end at our goal in these final seven days by contributing and sharing that fact with others.  Thanks.


Short Summary

The goal is to place a money making methodology in front of poor farmers who can put it to use. 

Figure 1.  The eastern view of the valley at Tanyag about, 300 farms are visible.


The person behind the methodology is the mentor, Joseph J. Reynolds.  He is passionate about bringing back forests throughout the tropical world.

Figure 2 Moringa seedlings, two months old" 
The Moringa oleifera tree is highly productive and it produces income monthly on a sustainable basis.
 The Moringa oleifera tree is highly productive when cultivated properly and it produces income monthly on a sustainable basis.  The profitability for the farmer is more than ten times what his net earnings are from growing rice when computed on a per square meter basis. 
Planting one Moringa will be equivalent to the effectiveness of fifty (50) Japanese cedar trees in absorbing carbon.[1]


Marketing of the product uses the Internet to make direct consumer sales. 

The savings of eliminating the middlemen layers more for less achieves the paradigm shift.  And, commences reforesting.

[1] “Moringa Malunggay Philippines”, by Luis R. Villafuerte and Lalaine Villafuerte-Abonal, AG Publishing, Singapore, ISBN 978-971-0512-04-1, 2009, pg. 239.


Exponential Reforestation

  • The More for Less Paradigm permits exponential reforestation to emerge.  First the farmer experiences a better way, next the idea spreads and spreads.  Those who might say that one product will not be feasible for so many growers and consumers are correct.  To solve that we have more than 300 more food source trees from which to select.
  • With regards to the beginning, i.e. Moringa oleifera:  When we grow 100,000 Moringa oleifera not only does the community of 900 farmers climb out of poverty the ecology benefits as if we had planted 2 million to 5 million trees of the other more general varieties. 
  • This campaign is the first outreach used to engage our agroforestry demonstration farm as the initial step to reforesting the Philippines.
  • The magnitude of what your contribution will help us, all of us, to achieve starts with this ongoing sole proprietorship model for replication, it is THE BEGINNING TO THE REFORESTATION OF THE PHILIPPINES THROUGH INCREMENTAL REPLICATION BY FARMERS AND ENTREPRENEURS WHO UNDERSTAND THAT THEY CAN EARN MORE FROM GROWING TREES THAN THEY CAN FROM TRADITIONAL MONOCROP FARMING.
  • The Philippines needs to be reforested, it is basically agricultural, which is not alleviating poverty; of the millions of farmers, nearly all are poor.
  • Growing Moringa oleifera at the demo-farm and in the adjacent community will provide a model for the other farmers to successfully grow trees that within one year provide a substantial increase in their incomes.
  • The leaves of Moringa oleifera trees grown on 300 square meters are commercially more productive than growing rice on 15,000 square meters or 50 times (50x) more profitable.
  • In this example Moringa oleifera is the tree of choice and this plan provides the step-by-step process for rapidly winning over the farmer. The plan demonstrates how the Philippines can reforest incrementally and rapidly to help both the economy and the environment and thirdly, the consumer. The demonstration farm is on track to open in July/August of this year. There are more than 1,000 similar valleys on Mindoro that can replicate the project as a beginning. In concert with the Barangay of Tanyag in January 2016 we are jointly planting 33,333 Moringa oleifera annually for three years on contiguous land provided by 100 farmers. The entire community of 900 will share in the work and the profits.  The Philippines has over 7,000 islands and 42,000 barangays, the task requires exponential thinking and approaches but first it must be totally in-house from where it can reach outwardly.


[1] “Moringa Malunggay Philippines”, by Luis R. Villafuerte and Lalaine Villafuerte-Abonal, AG Publishing, Singapore, ISBN 978-971-0512-04-1, 2009, pg. 239

What We Need & What You Get

We Need

We require funding to meet the FDA[1] licensing and health requirements including the respective labeling and packaging where we will set our product apart from others by making authorized nutritional and health benefit claims as we may.

We are on the verge of having a positive cash flow which will be turned internally to meet our continuing requirements.  This outreach is to raise us to the next level and permit us to step away from the ordinary and customary, or traditional, marketing practices that keep prices higher than they could be otherwise.  

We need to deal directly with the consumer who needs to be our customer and partner.  Our product is a food with tremendous nutrients so we need government certified/approved testing to enable us to make such claims on our labeling. 

We need to get away from the present practice of using a toll company and not being able to list the beneficial claims of our product that we want our customers to know about. 

Your help by joining our membership will enable us to complete these requirements in record time so that we can market exclusively under our own brand using the Internet to create additional memberships in furtherance of our reforestation efforts. 

What You Get

1.  You receive membership in Hilltop Moringa Farms

2.  You receive recognition through our commemorative marble wall for tropical reforestation.

3.  You may receive free product for one year.

4.  You may receive extra free product for one year.

5.  You may receive a wall certificate commemorating your participation in tropical reforestation.

6.  You may receive a wall plaque commemorating your participation in tropical reforestation.

Memberships guarantee that product received by members is the finest and it is free.  The product is not for sale, it is a gift to the membership that guarantees reforestation. 

Memberships lower our production cost through efficient scheduling to meet our long-term gift requirements.

The savings are significant enough to make our/your reforestation possible.

Volume is built through lots of little bits rather than bulk sales to a redistributor.  Our gift is shipped to you monthly for a year’s supply ensuring freshness.

The extra product gifted to you enables you to spread the word when you either gift it to another or even sell it to another.  In either event those recipients also begin reforesting.

We do profit financially and our as the profits grow the overall project will expand more rapidly from our internal funding.

One reason we selected Moringa oleifera to be our first product is that the existing worldwide research is extensive and the very positive results are archived at the National Center for Biotechnology information(NCBI),United States National Library of Medicine(NLM),National Institutes of Health, Bethesda, Md., www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov › NCBI › Literature › PubMed Central (PMC).  It is from this repository of data that we substantiate health/nutritional claims that we intend to place on our label with government approval.

Figure 4 Metalized pouch for powder, sheet and bottles for capsules; no label or claims.

Figure 5 No Claims, we will add appropriate and government approved claims." 

  • The modest funding that we are seeking will overcome our immediate impediments to being fully independent.  It will begin the paradigm shift from the ordinary and customary sale of our product using middle companies, a process that requires keeping the consumer retail price very high and will bring all outsourced processes inside so we may exclusively label and make specific nutrition and health claims.

Figure 6.   The kinds of claims that we want to make but first we must have the independent lab certification/report.

  • Funding that surpasses our immediate needs will speed our growth and the rapid reforestation may begin scaling up to exponential reforestation.

Membership in Hilltop Moringa Farms

  • This is unique and exciting! We are offering you a membership in Hilltop Moringa Farms and as a member you may
    • receive free product,
    • have your name inscribed onto our memorial wall to be built out of marble at the location of the first community reforestation project in what is the beginning of reforesting the tropical world.
  • Membership Awards are determined by the following contribution level:
    • A Hilltop Moringa Honored Member…pledges just $1.
    • A Hilltop Moringa Gold Member…pledges $425
    • A Hilltop Moringa Platinum Member…pledges $5,000
    • A Moringa-fancier member…pledges $10,000
    • A trustee member…offers a $10,000 line of credit for perfecting Internet marketing or other pertinent services provided by Trustee directly.

Awards/Gifts

The Hilltop Honored Moringa Member is remembered for all time as being a part of the tropical world’s reforestation begun in Tanyag, Calintaan, Occidental Mindoro, Philippines by having his/her name or the name of any designee permanently engraved into the marble recognition wall permanently displayed at site.  This memorial will symbolize the first and only successful reforestation project beginning exponential reforestation of all of the currently deforested tropical world.  

The Hilltop Moringa Gold, Platinum, Moringa-fancier and Trustee members will also be remembered with their names engraved into the Wall with marks of respective distinction and each will receive monthly our gift of 120 capsules (500mg) each, 500mg, shipping and handling included.[2]

Certificate of Commemoration presented at Hilltop when visiting…Moringa-Fancier

Engraved Commemorative Plaque presented at Hilltop when visiting…Trustee

Extra Value

Our gift to you as a new member has special value for you, examine this:

    • Value, retail:  two orders of 60 capsules each, 500mg, per month, one-year is $514.68, your gift for membership.
    • The funds from the membership go to the support, maintenance, care, custody and control of one Moringa oleifera tree at the demonstration farm and to reforest. 
    • The proceeds from the sale of product produced by that tree far exceed the cost of the gift and the size of the gift to you is double your monthly requirement.  The value of the extra 60 capsules that you do not need is about $16.00 and you will have 12 of them over the next year valued at 257.34 which allows you to sustain your membership indefinitely while personally benefiting from the health benefits that we are seeking to be able to claim on our own label. 
    • The funds that we receive will first go to qualify Hilltop Moringa oleifera leaf powder to make health and/or therapeutic claims on its label.  Beyond that goal the membership proceeds will go directly to the direct involvement of the community to grow 33,333 new seedlings each year for three years commencing in January 2016 in partnership with Hilltop Moringa Farms. 
    • Proceeds from those producing trees will be used to enhance the public relations of the project to foster broader interest in the neighboring villages and others to observe the lessons of the demonstration farm and to create replication that leads to reforestation in other villages. 
    • The unwitting benefit is the carbon tradeoff. 
    • If we do not reach our goal of raising the required amount of money we will continue until we do. 


[1] The Food and Drug Administration, Philippines is closely aligned with international requirements.   A 2-day training-accreditation intended for company liaison officer to become FDA accredited QPIRA for Center for Food Regulation and Research is aimed at providing information on FDA Application Process, guidance on acquiring market authorizations such as License to Operate (LTO) and Certificate of Product Registration (CPR) from CFRR and Post Marketing Surveillance, Releasing (ICTMD), Fees and Charges.

[2] The retail value of the gift is $514.68. The dosage for one person is 60 capsules per month.  The extra may be sold by you to others and thus provide for sustainable annual membership of $400 for only $142.66 out of pocket, supporting the continued growth of the tree(s) you helped to get started, each renewal year for only $11.88 per month.

The Impact

The characteristics of the Moringa oleifera tree are such that the 100,000 trees combined over their lifetime will be able to offset 30,001.7 tons of CO2.[1]  The uncanny quantity and diverse nature of the nutrients contained in Moringa oleifera are well documented and when Hilltop Moringa Farms is able to make these credible claims about its particular product line we will be able to grow, produce and provide products exclusively from our own farms.  Our products will avoid all middlemen.  The cost of producing the product is absorbed from the membership dues and the excess “profit” is for reforestation.

  • The growing area in Tanyag will be 10 hectares of community land.  Considering that the Moringa oleifera produces twenty to fifty times (20x to 50x) more CO2 extraction from the air than the Japanese Cedar and other general vegetation that planting 100,000 Moringa oleifera is the equivalent of between two to five million “regular” trees.[2]  From the memberships sought in this campaign the results should be the equivalent of three million trees per village for ten villages or 30,000,000 trees.
  • This project has everyone’s best interest at heart throughout the world, even those who do not believe in climate change mitigation or eating healthy food. The benefits from reforestation can only help us all and the benefits from making very healthy food available to the rising billion, likewise, can only help us all.

Figure 7 the original 10 Ilin Forester Families, still growing trees, since 1994, before Mr. Reynolds entered the picture in 1999, back right.

  •  The single most significant part of the project is replication.  Why?  Social psychology is at play here.  Only the farmers, particularly the poor farmers, can successfully reforest deforested lands that lay barren.  Any other way involves either the wealthy or the government using traditional methods that are far too costly and consistently wrought with failure.
  • "I began growing Mahogany trees in November 1999 when I first visited the 9,000 hectare, remote and mostly barren, island in the Philippines which was inhabited with 16,000 people, all subsistence farmers.” Is what Reynolds has told to so many, so many times over so many years and is willing to tell it so many more times?  He observed the lack of soil, fresh water and protection against the wind.  The logistics were a nightmare. He met 30 local farmers who all belonged to the local forester’s association, interesting especially when considering that they had no training whatsoever in forestry.  The village (barangay) captain, who was his host, had spent three years working in Japan as a forester in one of Japan’s foreign assistance programs. When he returned to his roots on Ilin Island he planted Mahogany seeds with the money that he had earned.  His friends, the farmers, joined him and they formed a forestry association but they had no resources to buy even seeds.   “We selected 10 of the farmers and entered into agreements that our foundation would provide seedlings, which they would each plant on their land, maintain them, replace those that died and get paid for their labor; the trees however would remain the property of the foundation.” Reynolds recalls. 
  • As of this time the program has more than 50,000 mature Mahogany trees all growing and protected by the farmers themselves.  They know now about sustainability and that the monetary benefits will be for their grandchildren, they too know and appreciate that the sustainable forest benefits Mother Nature.  Each farmer took it upon himself to plant seedlings for himself from seeds that they scrounged and other farmers outside of the program also planted in a similar fashion until the total was close to double.  The nearly 100,000 trees continue to grow and so does our trust for one another. 
  • Figure 8 Little Bobby Solanga, January 2000, is 17 now and appreciates trees." 
  • As of this time the program has more than 50,000 mature Mahogany trees all growing and protected by the farmers themselves.  They know now about sustainability and that the monetary benefits will be for their grandchildren, they too know and appreciate that the sustainable forest benefits Mother Nature.  Each farmer took it upon himself to plant seedlings for himself from seeds that they scrounged and other farmers outside of the program also planted in a similar fashion until the total was close to double.  The nearly 100,000 trees continue to grow and so does our trust for one another. 

  • Using Moringa oleifera as the Tree of Choice

    • What it is that we offer for the poor farmer is a significantly higher earnings methodology that is regular and sustainable, unlike rice that has a 150-day cycle before repeating its laborious self, time and time again?  On the low end this plan will increase the local farmer’s net income per square meter of P5.4 to P35.2 and subsequently to P70 (US $0.12 to $0.80 and subsequently to $1.59), an increase of more than 1,200%. 
    • This program varies by using a demonstration approach and changing from timber to food production.  The tree of choice rapidly provides highly nutritional leaves on a regular basis after only about six months.  The result is healthy food, cash flow and discretionary money for both the farmer and the project.  In time, after the basic needs of the farmer are met he will become a student and advocate of climate change mitigation.  At that point watch the reforestation take off exponentially, but for now let’s get him sustainable income from growing trees. 


    [1] TheResearch Conferences Forestwill have 5833 Moringa Trees which will contribute to the offset of CO2  emitted through Conference travel in 2010. Within their life span, these trees will be able to offset 1750 tons of CO2. In addition to the carbon offset, the trees also counter desertification, enhance soil fertility, and provide nutrition & work to local inhabitants in Dosso, Niger. Niger is one of the poorest countries in the world according to the Human Development Index and one of the most affected by desertification. http://www.esf.org/?id=6659 

    [2] Ibid, “Moringa Malunggay Philippines”.

Risks & Challenges

The primary risk is in the influence that soothsayers possess.  In particular the ones who say that it is too good to be true. 

The significant results from the anticipated growth of the trees is risky to sell to the traditional farmer unless it is first demonstrated beyond doubt. 

Our biggest challenge is to complete the demonstration farming cycle and show through documentation that corresponds directly with the farmer’s hands-on examination of the trees, their leaves, the harvesting, processing, packaging, marketing, selling and generating positive cash flow that shows actual income that exceeds what they are used to receiving from growing rice. 

Everything is in place to be able to so demonstrate except for our being able to not have to outsource the packaging and being able to make health claims, however, even under the current co-packaging arrangement the farmer will still benefit with no less than ten times (10x) his current net earnings from growing rice.  That is because he is paid for the wet matter (leaves) as they are harvested from the trees.  His share from the subsequent processing and sale of the finished product is extra, an incentive to help see the process through to the finish.  In order to make it possible for him to earn the extra we must be able to label the project ourselves, with claims.

At the Hilltop Moringa Demonstration farm …..

·  In short, our greatest risk is in non-believers but our greatest barrier to that influence is in presenting empirical data along with hands-on examination of the process, the product and proof of income. 

Figure 9 the green highlight marks the intended area of Moringa oleifera to be planted, 100 meters by 1,000 (10 hectares).

Commencing in January 2016 Hilltop Farmers’ Helper Demonstration Farm in partnership with Barangay Tanyag will begin planting seedlings of Moringa oleifera on ten (10) hectares of community designated land using the demonstrated biodiversified method to produce commercial products. This second phase within Barangay Tanyag will grow out 100,000 Moringa oleifera trees in three years. 

Figure 10 timing is perfect, high school and college students are learning about reforestation…

The learning activities conducted at the demonstration farm are the key catalyst for minimizing any social risks.  The technical risks are already minimal in that the test growing has been ongoing since 2008 and the results are what we have come to work with routinely.  For instance the bedding area is well drained in the wet season, however irrigated from in-ground saturation hoses so that in the dry season there is water.  Fertilizers and ‘pest pushers’ are all made from leaves and branches of a combination of four trees also growing within the project hectares.  Also, each seedling has a companion tree, Gliricidia sepium that is a legume and thereby always fixes nitrogen to the soil of each Moringa.  The legume is kept smaller than the Moringa and its leaves are also mulched with others, such as the mulched leaves of the banana tree that provide manganese which helps in the photosynthesis of the Moringa leaves keeping them luscious green.  The mulched leaves, seeds and branches of the Neem, Azadirachta indica, amazingly pushes (repels) and/or interrupts the breeding cycles of more than 300 different kinds of insect pests without disturbing the beneficial insects such as the pollinators or Ladybug nor the beneficial bacteria found within the soil nor the earthworms.  The mulched leaves of the Atis, Annona squamosa L., provide additional pest control.  All-in-all the Moringa oleifera grows well by itself, but these processes make the commercial aspect of growing it for profit a pleasure, not a burden. 

Our Current State of Readiness

  • We are already staffed and ready to move onto the paradigm shift. 
  • Our laboratory is equipped with four commercial grade dehumidifiers to enable the rapid indoor drying of leaves in 8 hours without the use of applied heat. 
  • Our pulverizer is industrial grade, South Korean made and can operate at constant temperature without overheating or otherwise being required to stop before whatever amount of leaves there are to be pulverized are completed.  The mesh size is #100, most competition is less at #65. 
  • We utilize tie-grid solar energy for our laboratory operations to assure start-to-finish processing is continuous and we are scheduled to step up our capacity. 
  • Our facilities are hygienic and meet government health standards for commercial food preparation.
  • Storage of the powder is maintained inside the climate controlled laboratory until shipped to the toll packaging company for encapsulating, labeling and packaging into sheets of 10 capsules each, 10 sheets to a box and sealed and ready for distribution to the clientele. 
  • Our trees are ready for routine harvesting.        

Ordinary and Customary Funding vs. Crowdfunding

The traditional way for projects to proceed is to apply to large financial or development organizations and to supply volumes of substantiation of endless details while asking for millions of dollars and finally being rejected.

The crowdfunding way is to make a common sense appeal to real people and gain their support, a little bit from each contributor, and then apply the funds to the project and make it happen on the basis of the amount of funds received.  Our initial goal is small but most significant because it will allow us to use a small amount to change our direction so that we can then earn millions on our own and apply those funds to our overall goal.  Thanks for your incremental help, however large or small.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute through membership please do not shy away.  The mere fact that you are reading this means it is of interest to you.  Tell us what you can do to help us and good common sense will take it from there.  Even the useful common sense suggestion will get your name on the memorial wall.  We would like to see your name there and someday that will be as significant to the public as so many exceptional memorials are around the world. 

Please help to get the word out.  Your help in sharing this with your network whether tiny or large is all that we can ask, you do that and the rest will happen.  Thanks.  

We read about Indiegogo and I first saw its value when observing one of their campaigns that was a huge success in getting their very beneficial product to both the public and to Mother Nature.  Please check the Indiegogo share tools!  In doing so the one additional interested person may make the difference that we all need.  Thank you.
story_txt:
We have 7 more days.

We have 7 more days remaining.  
As of today 1,119 interested, although shy,
people visit who wanted to contribute but without activity that they could see
they left the site without contributing.  
Please help us create activity, however much please contribute something
and then share the site with those whom you respect and know appreciate the
need to reforest.  
Our product is a
healthcare supplement made from the leaves of a nutritious tree.  When we plant more the farmers earn and
in-turn plant more and the cycle repeats itself.  
Your contributions help this cycle to
repeat. 
Please help us end at our goal
in these final seven days by contributing and sharing that fact with
others.  Thanks.



Short Summary
The goal is to place a money making
methodology in front of poor farmers who can put it to use. 

Figure 1.  The eastern view of the valley at Tanyag about, 300 farms are visible.

The person behind the methodology is the
mentor, Joseph J. Reynolds.  He is passionate
about bringing back forests throughout the tropical world. 




Figure 2 Moringa seedlings, two months old" 


The
     Moringa oleifera tree is highly productive and it produces income monthly on
     a sustainable basis.
The Moringa oleifera tree is highly productive
when cultivated properly and it produces income monthly on a sustainable
basis.  The profitability for the farmer
is more than ten times what his net earnings are from growing rice when
computed on a per square meter basis. 

Planting one Moringa will be equivalent to the
effectiveness of fifty (50) Japanese cedar trees in absorbing carbon.[1]



Marketing of the product uses the Internet to make direct consumer sales. 


The savings of eliminating the middlemen layers more for less achieves the paradigm shift.  And, commences reforesting.





[1] “Moringa
Malunggay Philippines”, by Luis R. Villafuerte and Lalaine Villafuerte-Abonal,
AG Publishing, Singapore, ISBN 978-971-0512-04-1, 2009, pg. 239.


Exponential
Reforestation

The
     More for Less Paradigm permits exponential reforestation to emerge.  First the farmer experiences a better
     way, next the idea spreads and spreads. 
     Those who might say that one product will not be feasible for so
     many growers and consumers are correct. 
     To solve that we have more than 300 more food source trees from
     which to select.
With
     regards to the beginning, i.e. Moringa oleifera:  When we grow 100,000 Moringa oleifera
     not only does the community of 900 farmers climb out of poverty the
     ecology benefits as if we had planted 2 million to 5 million trees of the
     other more general varieties.  
This
     campaign is the first outreach used to engage our agroforestry
     demonstration farm as the initial step to reforesting the Philippines.
The
     magnitude of what your contribution will help us, all of us, to achieve
     starts with this ongoing sole proprietorship model for replication, it is THE
     BEGINNING TO THE REFORESTATION OF THE PHILIPPINES THROUGH INCREMENTAL
     REPLICATION BY FARMERS AND ENTREPRENEURS WHO UNDERSTAND THAT THEY CAN EARN
     MORE FROM GROWING TREES THAN THEY CAN FROM TRADITIONAL MONOCROP FARMING. 
The
     Philippines needs to be reforested, it is basically agricultural, which is
     not alleviating poverty; of the millions of farmers, nearly all are poor. 
Growing
     Moringa oleifera at the demo-farm and in the adjacent community will provide
     a model for the other farmers to successfully grow trees that within one
     year provide a substantial increase in their incomes. 
The
     leaves of Moringa oleifera trees grown on 300 square meters are
     commercially more productive than growing rice on 15,000 square meters or
     50 times (50x) more profitable. 
In
     this example Moringa oleifera is the tree of choice and this plan provides
     the step-by-step process for rapidly winning over the farmer. The plan
     demonstrates how the Philippines can reforest incrementally and rapidly to
     help both the economy and the environment and thirdly, the consumer. The
     demonstration farm is on track to open in July/August of this year. There
     are more than 1,000 similar valleys on Mindoro that can replicate the
     project as a beginning. In concert with the Barangay of Tanyag in January
     2016 we are jointly planting 33,333 Moringa oleifera annually for three
     years on contiguous land provided by 100 farmers. The entire community of
     900 will share in the work and the profits.  The Philippines has over 7,000 islands
     and 42,000 barangays, the task requires exponential thinking and
     approaches but first it must be totally in-house from where it can reach
     outwardly.





[1] “Moringa
Malunggay Philippines”, by Luis R. Villafuerte and Lalaine Villafuerte-Abonal,
AG Publishing, Singapore, ISBN 978-971-0512-04-1, 2009, pg. 239



What We Need & What You Get

We
Need
We require funding to meet the FDA[1]
licensing and health requirements including the respective labeling and packaging where we
will set our product apart from others by making authorized nutritional and
health benefit claims as we may.
We are on the verge of having a positive
cash flow which will be turned internally to meet our continuing requirements.  This outreach is to raise
us to the next level and permit us to step away from the ordinary and
customary, or traditional, marketing practices that keep prices higher than
they could be otherwise.  
We need to deal directly with the
consumer who needs to be our customer and partner.  Our product is a food with tremendous
nutrients so we need government certified/approved testing to enable us to make
such claims on our labeling.  
We need to get away from the present
practice of using a toll company and not being able to list the beneficial
claims of our product that we want our customers to know about.  
Your help by joining our membership will
enable us to complete these requirements in record time so that we can market
exclusively under our own brand using the Internet to create additional memberships
in furtherance of our reforestation efforts. 


What
You Get

1. 
You
receive membership in Hilltop Moringa Farms
2. 
You
receive recognition through our commemorative marble wall for tropical
reforestation.
3. 
You
may receive free product for one year.
4. 
You
may receive extra free product for one year.
5. 
You
may receive a wall certificate commemorating your participation in tropical
reforestation.
6. 
You
may receive a wall plaque commemorating your participation in tropical
reforestation.
Memberships guarantee that product
received by members is the finest and it is free.  The product is not for sale, it is a gift to
the membership that guarantees reforestation. 

Memberships lower our production cost through
efficient scheduling to meet our long-term gift requirements.
The savings are significant enough to
make our/your reforestation possible. 
Volume is built through lots of little
bits rather than bulk sales to a redistributor. 
Our gift is shipped to you monthly for a year’s supply ensuring
freshness.
The extra product gifted to you enables
you to spread the word when you either gift it to another or even sell it to
another.  In either event those
recipients also begin reforesting.
We do profit financially and our as the profits
grow the overall project will expand more rapidly from our internal funding. 
One reason we selected Moringa oleifera
to be our first product is that the existing worldwide research is extensive
and the very positive results are archived at the National Center for Biotechnology information(NCBI),United States National Library of Medicine(NLM),National
Institutes of Health,
Bethesda, Md., www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov › NCBI › Literature › PubMed
Central (PMC). 
It is from this repository of data that we substantiate
health/nutritional claims that we intend to place on our label with government
approval. 



Figure
4 Metalized pouch for powder, sheet and bottles for
capsules; no label or claims.


Figure 5 No Claims, we will add appropriate and government approved claims." 
The modest funding that we are seeking will overcome
     our immediate impediments to being fully independent.  It will begin the paradigm shift from
     the ordinary and customary sale of our product using middle companies, a
     process that requires keeping the consumer retail price very high and will
     bring all outsourced processes inside so we may exclusively label and make
     specific nutrition and health claims. 


Figure 6.   The kinds of claims that we want to make but first we must have the independent lab certification/report.


Funding
     that surpasses our immediate needs will speed our growth and the rapid
     reforestation may begin scaling up to exponential reforestation.

Membership
in Hilltop Moringa Farms

This
     is unique and exciting! We are offering you a membership in Hilltop
     Moringa Farms and as a member you may

receive
      free product,
have
      your name inscribed onto our memorial wall to be built out of marble at
      the location of the first community reforestation project in what is the
      beginning of reforesting the tropical world.

Membership
     Awards are determined by the following contribution level:

A
      Hilltop Moringa Honored Member…pledges just $1.
A
      Hilltop Moringa Gold Member…pledges $425

A
      Hilltop Moringa Platinum Member…pledges $5,000

A
      Moringa-fancier member…pledges $10,000
A
      trustee member…offers a $10,000 line of credit for perfecting Internet marketing or other pertinent services provided by Trustee directly.


Awards/Gifts
The Hilltop Honored Moringa Member is remembered for all time as being a
part of the tropical world’s reforestation begun in Tanyag, Calintaan,
Occidental Mindoro, Philippines by having his/her name or the name of any
designee permanently engraved into the marble recognition wall permanently
displayed at site.  This memorial will
symbolize the first and only successful reforestation project beginning
exponential reforestation of all of the currently deforested tropical
world.  
The Hilltop Moringa Gold,
Platinum, Moringa-fancier and Trustee members will also be remembered with their names engraved into the
Wall with marks of respective distinction and each will receive monthly our
gift of 120 capsules (500mg) each, 500mg, shipping and handling included.[2]
Certificate of Commemoration presented at Hilltop when visiting…Moringa-Fancier
Engraved Commemorative Plaque presented at Hilltop when visiting…Trustee
Extra
Value
Our gift to you as a new member has
special value for you, examine this:


Value,
      retail:  two orders of 60 capsules
      each, 500mg, per month, one-year is $514.68, your gift for membership.
The
      funds from the membership go to the support, maintenance, care, custody
      and control of one Moringa oleifera tree at the demonstration farm and to
      reforest.  
The
      proceeds from the sale of product produced by that tree far exceed the
      cost of the gift and the size of the gift to you is double your monthly
      requirement.  The value of the
      extra 60 capsules that you do not need is about $16.00 and you will have
      12 of them over the next year valued at 257.34 which allows you to
      sustain your membership indefinitely while personally benefiting from the
      health benefits that we are seeking to be able to claim on our own
      label.  
The
      funds that we receive will first go to qualify Hilltop Moringa oleifera
      leaf powder to make health and/or therapeutic claims on its label.  Beyond that goal the membership
      proceeds will go directly to the direct involvement of the community to
      grow 33,333 new seedlings each year for three years commencing in January
      2016 in partnership with Hilltop Moringa Farms.  
Proceeds
      from those producing trees will be used to enhance the public relations
      of the project to foster broader interest in the neighboring villages and
      others to observe the lessons of the demonstration farm and to create
      replication that leads to reforestation in other villages.  
The
      unwitting benefit is the carbon tradeoff. 
      
If
      we do not reach our goal of raising the required amount of money we will continue until we do. 






[1] The Food
and Drug Administration, Philippines is closely aligned with international
requirements.   A 2-day
training-accreditation intended for company liaison officer to become FDA
accredited QPIRA for Center for Food Regulation and Research is aimed at providing
information on FDA Application Process, guidance on acquiring market
authorizations such as License to Operate (LTO) and Certificate of Product
Registration (CPR) from CFRR and Post Marketing Surveillance, Releasing
(ICTMD), Fees and Charges.



[2] The
retail value of the gift is $514.68. The dosage for one person is 60 capsules
per month.  The extra may be sold by you
to others and thus provide for sustainable annual membership of $400 for only
$142.66 out of pocket, supporting the continued growth of the tree(s) you helped to get started, each renewal year for only
$11.88 per month.

   The Impact

The characteristics of the Moringa
oleifera tree are such that the 100,000 trees combined over their lifetime will
be able to offset 30,001.7 tons of CO2.[1]  The uncanny quantity and diverse nature of
the nutrients contained in Moringa oleifera are well documented and when
Hilltop Moringa Farms is able to make these credible claims about its
particular product line we will be able to grow, produce and provide products
exclusively from our own farms.  Our
products will avoid all middlemen.  The cost
of producing the product is absorbed from the membership dues and the excess “profit”
is for reforestation.

The
     growing area in Tanyag will be 10 hectares of community land.  Considering that the Moringa oleifera
     produces twenty to fifty times (20x to 50x) more CO2 extraction from the air than the
     Japanese Cedar and other general vegetation that planting 100,000 Moringa
     oleifera is the equivalent of between two to five million “regular” trees.[2]  From the memberships sought in this
     campaign the results should be the equivalent of three million trees per
     village for ten villages or 30,000,000 trees.
This
     project has everyone’s best interest at heart throughout the world, even
     those who do not believe in climate change mitigation or eating healthy
     food. The benefits from reforestation can only help us all and the
     benefits from making very healthy food available to the rising billion,
     likewise, can only help us all.

Figure 7 the original 10 Ilin Forester Families, still growing trees, since 1994, before Mr. Reynolds entered the picture in 1999, back right.

 The single most significant part of the
     project is replication.  Why?  Social psychology is at play here.  Only the farmers, particularly the poor
     farmers, can successfully reforest deforested lands that lay barren.  Any other way involves either the
     wealthy or the government using traditional methods that are far too
     costly and consistently wrought with failure.
"I began growing
     Mahogany trees in November 1999 when I first visited the 9,000 hectare,
     remote and mostly barren, island in the Philippines which was inhabited
     with 16,000 people, all subsistence farmers.” Is what Reynolds has told to
     so many, so many times over so many years and is willing to tell it so
     many more times?  He observed the
     lack of soil, fresh water and protection against the wind.  The logistics were a nightmare. He met
     30 local farmers who all belonged to the local forester’s association,
     interesting especially when considering that they had no training
     whatsoever in forestry.  The village
     (barangay) captain, who was his host, had spent three years working in
     Japan as a forester in one of Japan’s foreign assistance programs. When he
     returned to his roots on Ilin Island he planted Mahogany seeds with the
     money that he had earned.  His
     friends, the farmers, joined him and they formed a forestry association
     but they had no resources to buy even seeds.   “We selected 10 of the farmers and
     entered into agreements that our foundation would provide seedlings, which
     they would each plant on their land, maintain them, replace those that
     died and get paid for their labor; the trees however would remain the
     property of the foundation.” Reynolds recalls. 

As
     of this time the program has more than 50,000 mature Mahogany trees all growing
     and protected by the farmers themselves. 
     They know now about sustainability and that the monetary benefits
     will be for their grandchildren, they too know and appreciate that the
     sustainable forest benefits Mother Nature. 
     Each farmer took it upon himself to plant seedlings for himself from
     seeds that they scrounged and other farmers outside of the program also
     planted in a similar fashion until the total was close to double.  The nearly 100,000 trees continue to
     grow and so does our trust for one another. 


Figure 8 Little Bobby Solanga, January 2000, is 17 now and appreciates trees." 

As
     of this time the program has more than 50,000 mature Mahogany trees all growing
     and protected by the farmers themselves. 
     They know now about sustainability and that the monetary benefits
     will be for their grandchildren, they too know and appreciate that the
     sustainable forest benefits Mother Nature. 
     Each farmer took it upon himself to plant seedlings for himself from
     seeds that they scrounged and other farmers outside of the program also
     planted in a similar fashion until the total was close to double.  The nearly 100,000 trees continue to
     grow and so does our trust for one another.  



Using Moringa oleifera as
the Tree of Choice

What
     it is that we offer for the poor farmer is a significantly higher earnings
     methodology that is regular and sustainable, unlike rice that has a
     150-day cycle before repeating its laborious self, time and time again?  On the low end this plan will increase
     the local farmer’s net income per square meter of P5.4 to P35.2 and
     subsequently to P70 (US $0.12 to $0.80 and subsequently to $1.59), an
     increase of more than 1,200%.  
This
     program varies by using a demonstration approach and changing from timber
     to food production.  The tree of
     choice rapidly provides highly nutritional leaves on a regular basis after
     only about six months.  The result
     is healthy food, cash flow and discretionary money for both the farmer and
     the project.  In time, after the
     basic needs of the farmer are met he will become a student and advocate of
     climate change mitigation.  At that
     point watch the reforestation take off exponentially, but for now let’s
     get him sustainable income from growing trees.  





[1] TheResearch
Conferences Forestwill have 5833 Moringa Trees which will contribute to the offset of CO2  emitted through Conference travel in 2010.
Within their life span, these trees will be able to offset 1750 tons of CO2. In addition to the carbon offset, the trees
also counter desertification, enhance soil fertility, and provide nutrition
& work to local inhabitants in Dosso, Niger. Niger is one of the poorest
countries in the world according to the Human Development Index and one of the
most affected by desertification. http://www.esf.org/?id=6659  



[2] Ibid, “Moringa
Malunggay Philippines”.



   Risks & Challenges  

The
primary risk is in the influence that soothsayers possess.  In particular the ones who say that it is too
good to be true.  
The
significant results from the anticipated growth of the trees is risky to sell
to the traditional farmer unless it is first demonstrated beyond doubt.  
Our
biggest challenge is to complete the demonstration farming cycle and show
through documentation that corresponds directly with the farmer’s hands-on
examination of the trees, their leaves, the harvesting, processing, packaging,
marketing, selling and generating positive cash flow that shows actual income
that exceeds what they are used to receiving from growing rice.  
Everything
is in place to be able to so demonstrate except for our being able to not have
to outsource the packaging and being able to make health claims, however, even
under the current co-packaging arrangement the farmer will still benefit with no
less than ten times (10x) his current net earnings from growing rice.  That is because he is paid for the wet matter
(leaves) as they are harvested from the trees. 
His share from the subsequent processing and sale of the finished
product is extra, an incentive to help see the process through to the
finish.  In order to make it possible for
him to earn the extra we must be able to label the project ourselves, with
claims.
At
the Hilltop Moringa Demonstration farm …..
· 
In
short, our greatest risk is in non-believers but our greatest barrier to that
influence is in presenting empirical data along with hands-on examination of
the process, the product and proof of income. 



Figure 9 the green highlight marks the intended area of Moringa oleifera to be planted, 100 meters by 1,000 (10 hectares).


Commencing
in January 2016 Hilltop Farmers’ Helper Demonstration Farm in partnership with
Barangay Tanyag will begin planting seedlings of Moringa oleifera on ten (10)
hectares of community designated land using the demonstrated biodiversified
method to produce commercial products. This second phase within Barangay Tanyag
will grow out 100,000 Moringa oleifera trees in three years. 


Figure 10 timing is perfect, high school and college students are learning about reforestation…


The learning activities conducted at the
demonstration farm are the key catalyst for minimizing any social risks.  The technical risks are already minimal in
that the test growing has been ongoing since 2008 and the results are what we
have come to work with routinely.  For
instance the bedding area is well drained in the wet season, however irrigated
from in-ground saturation hoses so that in the dry season there is water.  Fertilizers and ‘pest pushers’ are all made
from leaves and branches of a combination of four trees also growing within the
project hectares.  Also, each seedling
has a companion tree, Gliricidia sepium that
is a legume and thereby always fixes nitrogen to the soil of each Moringa.  The legume is kept smaller than the Moringa
and its leaves are also mulched with others, such as the mulched leaves of the
banana tree that provide manganese which helps in the photosynthesis of the Moringa
leaves keeping them luscious green.  The
mulched leaves, seeds and branches of the Neem, Azadirachta indica, amazingly
pushes (repels) and/or interrupts the breeding cycles of more than 300
different kinds of insect pests without disturbing the beneficial insects such
as the pollinators or Ladybug nor the beneficial bacteria found within the soil
nor the earthworms.  The mulched leaves
of the Atis, Annona squamosa L., provide additional pest control.  All-in-all the Moringa oleifera grows well by
itself, but these processes make the commercial aspect of growing it for profit
a pleasure, not a burden.  
Our
Current State of Readiness

We are
     already staffed and ready to move onto the paradigm shift.  
Our
     laboratory is equipped with four commercial grade dehumidifiers to enable
     the rapid indoor drying of leaves in 8 hours without the use of applied
     heat.  
Our
     pulverizer is industrial grade, South Korean made and can operate at constant
     temperature without overheating or otherwise being required to stop before
     whatever amount of leaves there are to be pulverized are completed.  The mesh size is #100, most competition
     is less at #65.  
We
     utilize tie-grid solar energy for our laboratory operations to assure
     start-to-finish processing is continuous and we are scheduled to step up our capacity. 
     
Our
     facilities are hygienic and meet government health standards for
     commercial food preparation.
Storage of the powder is maintained inside the climate
     controlled laboratory until shipped to the toll packaging company for
     encapsulating, labeling and packaging into sheets of 10 capsules each, 10
     sheets to a box and sealed and ready for distribution to the clientele. 

Our
     trees are ready for routine harvesting.        




Ordinary
and Customary Funding vs. Crowdfunding
The traditional way for projects to
proceed is to apply to large financial or development organizations and to
supply volumes of substantiation of endless details while asking for millions
of dollars and finally being rejected.
The crowdfunding way is to make a
common sense appeal to real people and gain their support, a little bit from
each contributor, and then apply the funds to the project and make it happen on
the basis of the amount of funds received. 
Our initial goal is small but most significant because it will allow us
to use a small amount to change our direction so that we can then earn millions
on our own and apply those funds to our overall goal.  Thanks for your incremental help, however
large or small.

Other Ways You Can Help 
If
you are not able to contribute through membership please do not shy away.  The mere fact that you are reading this means
it is of interest to you.  Tell us what
you can do to help us and good common sense will take it from there.  Even the useful common sense suggestion will get your name on the memorial
wall.  We would like to see your name there
and someday that will be as significant to the public as so many exceptional memorials are around the world.  
Please
help to get the word out.  Your help in sharing this with your network
whether tiny or large is all that we can ask, you do that and the rest will
happen.  Thanks.  
We read about Indiegogo and I first saw its value when observing one of
their campaigns that was a huge success in getting their very beneficial
product to both the public and to Mother Nature.  Please check the Indiegogo share tools!  In doing so the one additional interested
person may make the difference that we all need.  Thank you.

story:
Help us open Roux Carré this fall!

Roux Carré is an open-air food court and community gathering place under construction in Central City (New Orleans). We've got more than 90 percent of the funds we need; please help us raise the remainder to open this fall!

A project of Good Work Network, Roux Carré celebrates the African American, Caribbean, and Latin American cultural influences on New Orleans and is located at 2000 Oretha Castle Haley Blvd.  

Roux Carré will include:

  • Six enclosed food vendor stalls
  • Performance stage
  • Covered outdoor seating and gathering space in the center
  • Commercial kitchen
  • Cooking demonstration area
  • On-site parking

Roux Carre promotes community development by:

  • Providing a low-cost, low-overhead means of market entry for food-preneurs
  • Incubating minority and women food-preneurs by offering training, coaching, and wrap-around support
  • Offering 30 performing and visual artists a residency program
  • Giving a platform to up-and-coming artists
  • Establishing a unique, culturally grounded gathering space
  • Creating jobs for low-income individuals
  • Returning vacant property into commerce in a way that honors its culturally and historically rich location

Progress

We’ve started construction! Visit our website to see our progress and to see what Roux Carré will look like when complete.

Our historic location

Dryades Street, later renamed Oretha Castle Haley Blvd., was once a thriving African American and immigrant commercial corridor. It was one of the only places where blacks could freely shop for clothes in New Orleans, and it was the location of the successful 1960 boycott by black shoppers. In this neighborhood in 1957, Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. was elected president of the Southern Christian Leadership Conference. But due to economic downturn in the area, this community began to suffer from blight and neglect. Hurricane Katrina and the levee failures in 2005 delivered further setbacks.

Roux Carré represents another step that this historic community is taking to say “We are BACK... BETTER and STRONGER!”

Help us make Roux Carré a reality for the Central City community!

story:
Hi, I am Maria Grissom owner of BlackLabelVirginHair it  is only a Online Store at this Time shipping out The Best Quality Extensions & Wigs Around the World..  My goal is to create more jobs in The Atlanta Area & help our Clients with thin or thinning hair get their confidence back... 

By helping me, I can continue doing what I love & that's Helping Women... Blacklabel will provide a service to clients with Alopecia & Hair Loss of any kind... My Goal is to get women back to the work force by going to the Battered Women Shelter to donate our Hair if needed & also our time. We Will be Creating Wigs for Cancer Patients as we have already started shipping out Clip-ins, Extensions etc... Hi, I am Maria Grissom owner of BlackLabelVirginHair it  is only a Online Store at this Time shipping out The Best Quality Extensions & Wigs Around the World..  My goal is to create more jobs in The Atlanta Area & help our Clients with thin or thinning hair get their confidence back... 
By helping me, I can continue doing what I love & that's Helping Women... Blacklabel will provide a service to clients with Alopecia & Hair Loss of any kind... story:
Short Summary

Adopt Pennadomo, an ancient Italian village in the hills of Abruzzo

An exciting project that helps a community save and revitalize their 1,000 year old village in Abruzzo, Italy

The non-profit IK0 Foundation takes a unique approach to responsible tourism by helping local people in Italian villages open up their own extraordinary range of small business opportunities, while providing travellers’ with authentic experiences in the countryside.  Pennadomo will become an all-inclusive resort entirely developed, owned and managed by the local population, thereby ensuring both the preservation of this ancient village and employment for future local generations of this unique community.

The Foundation needs an initial contribution to make the Pennadomo project happen.  Once this first village is revitalized, the Foundation will become self-sustaining with profits generated by the project and re-invested to support other ancient and declining villages across the country.

Funding for Pennadomo will create locally-owned and managed, sustainable businesses, including 56 boutique hotel rooms, panoramic and traditional restaurants, a local specialties store featuring products of the region, wine tasting, olive oil tasting in an old mill, two Panini cafes, two bars and one artisanal shop, along with a botanical garden, art gallery and a museum of the fairy tales of Abruzzo. 

Visitors to Pennadomo will find an all-inclusive village that features authentic Italian experiences of food, wine, local products and culture in one place.

Find out more about the Project

http://www.ik0.it/fondazione/en/

Find out more about Barbara Ciarrapico (Project Manager)

http://www.ik0.it/turismostrategico/en/who-we-are/

story:
This is a humanitarian response for vulnerable young people with intellectual disabilities in the Oaza organization in Sarajevo, Bosnia and Herzegovina. Oaza Sarajevo, in cooperation with FIFH Malmö, MyRight and Special Olympics, organizes large sports events for people with disabilities in Bosnia and Herzegovina. Oaza Sarajevo and FIFH Malmö has managed to create incredibly impressive projects in the eight years they have worked together.

This project is not only about physical education and sport. It’s also about the right to a meaningful life and the right to grow and develop as an individual. It’s also about creating a forum where people from different parts of the community can come together. This creates an opportunity for people with disabilities to participate in society as equal citizens.

We intend to continue to cooperate with Oaza in Bosnia and we need to quickly gather 40 000 in order to fund the project!



Where will your money go?

MyRight has already agreed to fund the project but require an initial participation fee of 4350€ before Oaza and FIFH are allowed to access the grant. The money raised would be used for paying this fee.


About the project

The ‘Oaza’ Sports Games and the Games of the Special Olympics of Bosnia and Herzegovina were established in 2011. The length of the tournament is four days and persons with intellectual disabilities have an opportunity to compete in eight sports: football, basketball, swimming, bocci bowling, athletics, table tennis, bowling and MATP (Motor Activity Training Program). The games have been organized consecutively for three years. Furthermore, during these three years, a great number of people were involved in the implementation of the games, whether it were the partners, volunteers, or parents of persons with intellectual disabilities.

Having in mind the experience gained in the last three years, during which a great number of people aided the implementation and realization of the project, an idea was further developed. It involved the youth population that are a active in different sports teams in the Canton of Sarajevo, directly influencing the youngest demographic and raising awareness in their understanding and attitudes towards persons with intellectual disabilities. It was conceptualized that interactions between persons with intellectual disabilities and the younger demographics are very likely to be established through sports encounters.

The aim of the project is that through its realization, a chance is given to persons with intellectual disabilities to develop through sports and active training, thus helping them achieve a higher quality of life through the equalization of possibilities. This in accordance to Article 30 of the UN Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities. Through acquired knowledge we have witnessed the importance of sport as an instrument in integrating persons with intellectual disabilities in society, as well as enabling the promotion of their rights. Sport is a means of decreasing prejudice towards persons with intellectual disabilities and encouraging the development of their rightful possibilities and capabilities.



Why is this project important?

Primarily, the objective of this project is the inclusion of persons with intellectual disabilities in social activities and their improved status in society. We have recognized the possibilities of sports as a means to solving this issue. The main goal we want to achieve is for the attitudes of the society to change towards persons with intellectual disabilities and the opportunities they are offered; they should be allowed an equal, lawful position in society. This is a responsibility because Bosnia and Herzegovina has signed the UN Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities. Through sports tournaments, we have a chance to show the general public that persons with intellectual disabilities can equally participate in social, cultural and sport life. Sports and sports tournaments are a means through which we will establish common ground. Acquaintances between persons with intellectual disabilities and persons without disabilities will consequently demonstrate to the public that persons with intellectual disabilities are unjustifiably neglected.

Besides this importance, sport plays a role in the improvement of overall health of persons with intellectual disabilities, their ability to work, self-confidence, and overall quality of life. Through this project we plan to cooperate and target sports clubs so that we may be able to form selections and teams which will include both persons with intellectual disabilities and persons without disabilities.



Cooperation between Oaza and FIFH

The swedish organization FIFH Malmö will, Malmo Open - one of the biggest competitions of its kind in the world, provide security and stability in Project Oaza Sarajevo. FIFH will advise Oaza in strategizing and planning the future for the Oaza Sports Games in Sarajevo to further professionalization.

FIFH will be able to apply the functional structure used in Sweden and use the knowledge, resources and contacts gained through organizing Malmo Open to assist Oaza. The organization of FIFH will act as a model for the construction of buildings and sustainable, long-term solutions.

Oaza athletes gain experience and vast improvements in terms of sports right in Malmo Open. They get a chance to compete with the people from all around the globe and prove their skills internationally.

More information about Oaza, FIFH and Malmö Open

Oaza: http://udruzenjeoaza.ba/

FIFH: http://www.fifh.com/

Malmö Open: http://www.malmo-open.com/

SIDA: http://www.sida.se/English/

MyRight: http://myright.se/

story:
My name is Janine and I’d like to tell you a little about myself.  I have worked as a social worker for the past 20+ years.  I am married and I have an awesome husband and two wonderful children.  I have been making cold process soap as a hobby for the past several years and have often been told by friends and family that I should sell my soap!  Well,  after much thoughtful consideration, I have decided to take their advice and bring Squeaky Suds to life!  Now I want to do what I love and love what I do and I need help from you to make the Squeaky Suds dream come true.

A typical day for me involves going to work for 8+ hours and then when I get home from work I make dinner for my family and then I make soap.  My days are typically 18+ hour days and I am not complaining at all!  I am saying, however, that these days can be exhausting and it would be my dream at some point to just focus on growing Squeaky Suds, rather than working a full day before I get to come home and focus on what I love. Our production is very small scale at this time.  Our production area consists of a corner of our kitchen. And our storage area is one small corner of our family room.  We are currently preparing to sell Squeaky Suds at a local farmers market and so that has been our most recent focus.  My family is 100% supportive of the Squeaky Suds dream!  In fact , my children have become very passionate about our dream.  Please take a moment to view the first official Squeaky Suds commercial;  written, produced, directed and acted by my two children!

 What do we need funding for?  We have a website, but need money to fully develop our site into a fully functioning online store.  We need money for equipment and supplies, such as soap molds and soap cutters.  Funding is needed for raw ingredients including essential oils, natural colorants and a variety of base oils.  We need money for packaging and labeling costs and last but not least, we need funding to get moved into our own space where we can produce and sell Squeaky Suds!

Risks:  Everything in life involves risk.  If one wants to move forward and succeed, then one must be willing to risk.  With risk comes the possibility of failure; they are inherently connected to one another.  I am fully aware of the risks involved with building Squeaky Suds, however, my heart and soul are fully invested in this endeavor and I am fully committed to success.  I am not afraid of hard work and I am a very tenacious person.  I am anticipating some road blocks along the way and I am prepared to overcome them!

  We do not use any fake ingredients in our soap and this is something that I am very passionate about!  This is one of the primary reasons I started making cold process soap; I was very upset by all the garbage and crap that is put into most of the large scale commercial soaps on the market today.  I desired to make a product that was safe, nourishing and comforting to the skin.  Squeaky Suds is completely pure and natural.  You can be confident that when you use a bar of Squeaky Suds soap, you are using a product that was made with care and concern for your skin!

Thank you so much for taking the time to visit our Indiegogo page.  We hope you will decide to contribute and experience the Squeaky Suds difference!
